original: bam po dang po ;
analyzed: bam po dang po ;

original: bkra shis / dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bkra shis / dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Auspicious! Homage to the Three Jewels!🔽The four types of ethical conduct of the Sugata, surrounded by the light rays of the autumn moon on the lofty peaks of silver and snow mountains,

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa bzhi dngul dang gangs kyi ri bo spo mthon po ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba dang / dung dang zla ba rab tu gsal ba dang / me tog ku mu da dang / chu klung sin dhu dang /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa bzhi dngul dang gangs kyi ri bo spo mthon po ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba dang / dung dang zla ba rab tu gsal ba dang / me tog ku mu da dang / chu klung sin dhu dang /
translated: like a conch, the moon shining brightly, a kumuda flower, the Sindhu river,

original: me tog sin du ba ra dang / pad ma'i rtsa lag gi chu ba dang / mu tig dag gi chun po'i phreng ba bas kyang ches dkar ba rjes su bskyang bar mdzad pas mthu stobs shin tu chen po yang dag par brnyes pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: me tog sin du ba ra dang / pad ma'i rtsa lag gi chu ba dang / mu tig dag gi chun po'i phreng ba bas kyang ches dkar ba rjes su bskyang bar mdzad pas mthu stobs shin tu chen po yang dag par brnyes pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: a sindhuvara flower, the stalk of a lotus friend, and a garland of pearls, I pay homage to the one who is even whiter than those, who has attained great power and strength through caring for them.

original: rgyal ba rgya mtsho dpal dang ldan //
analyzed: rgyal ba rgya mtsho dpal dang ldan //
translated: The ocean of victors, endowed with splendor,

original: lta bas mi ngoms shin tu zab //
analyzed: lta bas mi ngoms shin tu zab //
translated: Unfathomable, never satiated by gazing,

original: dus las yol ba mi mnga' zhing //
analyzed: dus las yol ba mi mnga' zhing //
translated: Not beyond the time,

original: rin chen phyug la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: rin chen phyug la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: I pay homage to the one rich in jewels.

original: blo gzhan go bar bya ba'i phyir //🔽gzhan gyis bcol bas bdag gis ni //
analyzed: blo gzhan go bar bya ba'i phyir // gzhan gyis bcol bas bdag gis ni //
translated: For the sake of understanding others,🔽Having been requested by others,

original: so sor @2a * //
analyzed: so sor @2a * //
translated: I will compose

original: thar pa'i rgya cher 'grel //🔽gsal ba dag ni brtsam par bya //
analyzed: thar pa'i rgya cher 'grel // gsal ba dag ni brtsam par bya //
translated: A commentary on the extensive pratimoksha.🔽Even though there are commentaries composed by others,

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i 'grel pa dag / yod kyang de dag tshig mi 'grel //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i 'grel pa dag / yod kyang de dag tshig mi 'grel //
translated: Their words are not explained.

original: gzhan dag mtshan nyid 'gal bar smra //
analyzed: gzhan dag mtshan nyid 'gal bar smra //
translated: Others speak with contradictory characteristics,

original: don mi gsal bar phal yang che //
analyzed: don mi gsal bar phal yang che //
translated: And most are unclear in meaning.

original: rnam par 'chad pas de dang de //
analyzed: rnam par 'chad pas de dang de //
translated: Having looked at this and that,

original: bltas nas blo dag rmongs 'gyur bas //
analyzed: bltas nas blo dag rmongs 'gyur bas //
translated: The minds of the wise become confused.

original: de phyir 'bad pas brtsam par bgyi //
analyzed: de phyir 'bad pas brtsam par bgyi //
translated: Therefore, I will compose this with effort,

original: nga rgyal dag gi phyir ma yin //
analyzed: nga rgyal dag gi phyir ma yin //
translated: Not for the sake of pride.

original: bdag nyid chen po gang dag gis//🔽'dul ba dag la tshig dang don //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po gang dag gis// 'dul ba dag la tshig dang don //
translated: Those who are great beings

original: 'bad byas de dag rang gi mthus //
analyzed: 'bad byas de dag rang gi mthus //
translated: Can, through their own power,

original: don rnams 'byed par byed par nus //
analyzed: don rnams 'byed par byed par nus //
translated: Analyze the words and meanings🔽In the vinaya with effort.

original: gang dag gzhung rgyas phyir phyogs shing //
analyzed: gang dag gzhung rgyas phyir phyogs shing //
translated: Those who turn away because of the length of the text,🔽

original: mdor bsdus 'dod pa de dag phyir //
analyzed: mdor bsdus 'dod pa de dag phyir //
translated: For those who prefer a concise text,🔽I will make an effort to teach a little

original: 'di la 'bad pas phyogs tsam zhig / rab tu bstan pas brtsam par bya //
analyzed: 'di la 'bad pas phyogs tsam zhig / rab tu bstan pas brtsam par bya //
translated: of this subject, and so compose it.

original: bdag gi brtsams pa 'di 'dra ba //
analyzed: bdag gi brtsams pa 'di 'dra ba //
translated: This composition of mine

original: mkhas pa dag la bskul ba ste //🔽byis pa mkhas pa'i dbus dag tu //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag la bskul ba ste // byis pa mkhas pa'i dbus dag tu //
translated: is for the sake of inspiring the wise;🔽the foolish will not dare to do it

original: spyi rtol mi byed med pa bzhin //
analyzed: spyi rtol mi byed med pa bzhin //
translated: even in the midst of the wise.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis sde snod gsum du 'dus pa ni 'dul ba'i sde snod dang / mdo'i sde snod dang / chos mngon pa'i sde snod do //🔽de la 'dul ba'i sde snod du @2b gtogs pa thams cad ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis sde snod gsum du 'dus pa ni 'dul ba'i sde snod dang / mdo'i sde snod dang / chos mngon pa'i sde snod do // de la 'dul ba'i sde snod du @2b gtogs pa thams cad ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis yang dag par bsdus so //
translated: The teaching of the Sugata is included in the twelve branches of the excellent speech, which are contained in the three collections: the collection of the discipline, the collection of the sets of discourses, and the collection of higher knowledge.🔽All that is included in the collection of the discipline was compiled by Upali, the most excellent of those who uphold the discipline.

original: mdo sde'i sde snod du gtogs pa thams cad ni mdo sde 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa kun dga' bos yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: mdo sde'i sde snod du gtogs pa thams cad ni mdo sde 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa kun dga' bos yang dag par bsdus so //
translated: All that is included in the collection of the sets of discourses was compiled by Ananda, the most excellent of those who uphold the sets of discourses.

original: chos mngon pa'i sde snod du gtogs pa thams cad ni ma mo 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa 'od srungs chen pos yang dag par rab tu bsdus so //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i sde snod du gtogs pa thams cad ni ma mo 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa 'od srungs chen pos yang dag par rab tu bsdus so //
translated: All the scriptures of the Abhidharma were compiled by the noble Mahākāśyapa, the foremost of those who upheld the mother of the victors.

original: de dag yang dag par bsdu ba yang bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i tshe dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu yang dag par sdud pa lnga brgya pa dang / bdun brgya pa dang / bzhi brgya pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul dang dus gang du gang gi tshe ji ltar yang dag par bsdus pa'i lo rgyus ni bde bar gshegs pa'i lung nyid las gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag yang dag par bsdu ba yang bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i tshe dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu yang dag par sdud pa lnga brgya pa dang / bdun brgya pa dang / bzhi brgya pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul dang dus gang du gang gi tshe ji ltar yang dag par bsdus pa'i lo rgyus ni bde bar gshegs pa'i lung nyid las gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: The accounts of the compilations, whether the Bhagavān was present or after his parinirvāṇa, such as the five hundred, seven hundred, and four hundred compilations, and so on, and the place, time, and how they were compiled are as they are taught in the scriptures of the Sugata.

original: 'dir 'dul ba'i sngo snod kyi dbang du bya ba'i skabs yin pas de je brjod par bya ste ;
analyzed: 'dir 'dul ba'i sngo snod kyi dbang du bya ba'i skabs yin pas de je brjod par bya ste ;
translated: Here, since this is the section on the basket of vinaya, that will be explained.

original: 'dul ba'i sde snod ni yul dang slob dpon dang don gyi dbang du mdzad nas sde bzhi rnam pa bco brgyad du gyes pa'i lo rgyus kyang lung las mang du gsungs te de dag gi rgya cher brjod pa yang 'dul ba'i sde snod nyid kyi gzhung las shes
analyzed: 'dul ba'i sde snod ni yul dang slob dpon dang don gyi dbang du mdzad nas sde bzhi rnam pa bco brgyad du gyes pa'i lo rgyus kyang lung las mang du gsungs te de dag gi rgya cher brjod pa yang 'dul ba'i sde snod nyid kyi gzhung las shes
translated: The extensive explanation of these should be known from the texts of the Vinaya Piṭaka itself.

original: par bya'o // da 'dir ni 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa bshad pa'i skabs yin pas de'i lo rgyus phyogs tsam zhig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: par bya'o // da 'dir ni 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa bshad pa'i skabs yin pas de'i lo rgyus phyogs tsam zhig brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, since this is the section explaining the commentary on the noble Mūlasarvâstivāda Prātimokṣa Sūtra, I will briefly relate its story.

original: de la 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa 'ong srungs chen po la sogs pa dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus nas tshangs par spyod pa
analyzed: de la 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa 'ong srungs chen po la sogs pa dgra bcom pa lnga brgya 'dus nas tshangs par spyod pa
translated: This Vinaya Piṭaka of the noble Mūlasarvâstivāda was compiled by five hundred arhats, including the noble Mahākāśyapa, after the Blessed Buddha had passed into parinirvāṇa. They gathered in Rājagṛha, the capital of Magadha, in the Kalandaka-nivāpa, the Bamboo Grove, the Squirrels' Feeding Ground.

original: yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / skye bo mang po la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa nye ba 'khor la yang dag par bsdu bar gsol nas 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / skye bo mang po la phan gdags pa'i phyir 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i mchog 'phags pa nye ba 'khor la yang dag par bsdu bar gsol nas 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis yang dag par bsdus so //
translated: In order to preserve the Dharma for a long time and to benefit many people, he requested the foremost of the upholders of the vinaya, the noble Upali, to compile it, and the noble Upali compiled it.

original: gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod ni dum bu bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod ni dum bu bzhi ste /
translated: The vinaya piṭaka of the Mūlasarvâstivādins has four parts:

original: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang 'dul ba gzhi dang / 'dul ba phran tshegs dang / 'dul ba gzhung bla ma'o //🔽de dag gi gnas pa'i snying @3a * //
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang 'dul ba gzhi dang / 'dul ba phran tshegs dang / 'dul ba gzhung bla ma'o // de dag gi gnas pa'i snying @3a * //
translated: the Vinaya Verses, the Vinaya Bases, the Vinaya Miscellany, and the Vinaya Exegesis.

original: dang snying po ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di yin no //
analyzed: dang snying po ni so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di yin no //
translated: The heart and essence of those is this Sūtra on the Foundation of Mindfulness.

original: de dag yang dag par bsdus pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid med pa dag yan lag la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spang bar bya ba dang / nyan pa po brjod pa nyung dus don gyi spyi rtogs par 'dod pa dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir sngom rnam pa gsum du bsdus te /
analyzed: de dag yang dag par bsdus pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid med pa dag yan lag la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spang bar bya ba dang / nyan pa po brjod pa nyung dus don gyi spyi rtogs par 'dod pa dag la phan gdags pa'i phyir sngom rnam pa gsum du bsdus te /
translated: They are summarized in three summaries:

original: spyi sdom dang / sdom dang / bar sdom du'o //
analyzed: spyi sdom dang / sdom dang / bar sdom du'o //
translated: the general summary, the summary, and the intermediate summary.

original: de la spyi sngom ni spyi'i don tshigs su bcad par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyi sngom ni spyi'i don tshigs su bcad par bsdus pa'o //
translated: The general summary summarizes the general meaning in verses.

original: sdom ni dngos kyi don tshigs su bcad par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sdom ni dngos kyi don tshigs su bcad par bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary summarizes the actual meaning in verses.

original: bar sdom ni yan lag gi don tshigs su bcad par bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: bar sdom ni yan lag gi don tshigs su bcad par bsdus pa ste /
translated: The intermediate summary summarizes the branch meaning in verses.

original: de dag kyang lung gi skabs dang sbyar te ci rigs par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang lung gi skabs dang sbyar te ci rigs par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Those should be understood as appropriate in the context of scripture.

original: de la so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni don las bstan bcos kyi ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba ni don las bstan bcos kyi ming du btags pa ste /
translated: Regarding that, the so-called Pratimokṣa Sūtra is a treatise name designated from the meaning.

original: de la rnam grangs gcig tu na dang por thar pa zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de la rnam grangs gcig tu na dang por thar pa zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: In one sense, the first is called liberation.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni dang po ste /
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni dang po ste /
translated: The term “individually” means “first.”

original: dang po sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i cho na gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshig bzlas nas sdom pa yang dag par blang ba'i tshig brjod pa gsum pa'i tha ma la sdom pa thob pa ni thog ma sdom pa thob pa'i gnas skabs yin pas dang🔽po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i cho na gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshig bzlas nas sdom pa yang dag par blang ba'i tshig brjod pa gsum pa'i tha ma la sdom pa thob pa ni thog ma sdom pa thob pa'i gnas skabs yin pas dang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The first is the occasion of obtaining the vows, because the vows are obtained at the end of the third repetition of the words for taking the vows after reciting the words for taking refuge in the three jewels in the rite for correctly taking the vows.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni grol ba ste /
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni grol ba ste /
translated: Liberation is freedom.

original: de ltar sdom pa dang po thob pa de nyid kyi tshe na sdom pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las grol te /
analyzed: de ltar sdom pa dang po thob pa de nyid kyi tshe na sdom pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las grol te /
translated: At the time of first obtaining the vows, one is freed from the characteristics of nonvows.

original: sdom pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs thob pa ni thar pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs thob pa ni thar pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Obtaining the form of nonindicative virtue subsumed by the characteristics of the vows is called liberation.

original: de ltar dang por thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di byung ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar dang por thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di byung ba'am /
translated: Thus, this treatise was composed in order to explain the meaning of liberation.

original: don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang dang por thar pa zhes bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang dang por thar pa zhes bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Since that meaning is included in this treatise, the name of this treatise is first called “Liberation.”

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan dun so sor thar pa zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan dun so sor thar pa zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: Again, it is taught that it is called “Individual Liberation.”

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni rgyud tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni rgyud tha dad pa'o //
translated: Individual means different mindstreams.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: Liberation means freedom.

original: gang zag / rgyud tha dad pa gang gis sngom pa yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rjes su sgrub par byed pa de nyid ngan 'gro dang / 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis sdom pa yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rjes su bsgrub pas gzhan rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur @3b bas so sor thar pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag / rgyud tha dad pa gang gis sngom pa yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rjes su sgrub par byed pa de nyid ngan 'gro dang / 'khor ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis sdom pa yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rjes su bsgrub pas gzhan rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur @3b bas so sor thar pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the one who takes up the vow and practices the bases of training who is liberated from unfortunate realms and samsara, not someone else who takes up the vow and practices the bases of training, it is called individual liberation.

original: de ltar so sor thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di byung ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar so sor thar pa'i don de las bstan bcos 'di byung ba'am /
translated: This treatise arose from that meaning of individual liberation.

original: don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang so sor thar pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang so sor thar pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since this topic is included in this treatise, this treatise is also called the Prātimokṣa.

original: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na thar pa'i thabs zhes bya bar ston te /🔽so sor zhes bya ba ni phyir zhes bya ste thabs kyi don to //
analyzed: yang rnam grangs gzhan du na thar pa'i thabs zhes bya bar ston te / so sor zhes bya ba ni phyir zhes bya ste thabs kyi don to //
translated: Moreover, it is taught that there is another enumeration: the means of liberation.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The term “prātimokṣa” means “individually” and “mokṣa” means “means.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: “Liberation” means “nirvāṇa.”

original: des na so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ni nges par 'byung ba thob pa'i thabs kyi phyir gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: des na so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ni nges par 'byung ba thob pa'i thabs kyi phyir gsungs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this Prātimokṣa Sūtra is taught as the means of attaining liberation.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas lhag pa'i sems skye la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas lhag pa'i sems skye la /
translated: Based on superior morality, superior concentration arises.

original: lhag pa'i sems la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab skye ba'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims yin pas thar pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la brten nas lhag pa'i shes rab skye ba'i rim gyis nges par 'byung ba thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims yin pas thar pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: Based on superior concentration, superior wisdom arises. Since it is the means of attaining liberation through this process, this Prātimokṣa Sūtra is the morality of the means of liberation, and therefore it is called the means of liberation.

original: de ltar thar pa'i thabs kyi don de las bstan bcos 'di 'byung ba'am /🔽don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas /
analyzed: de ltar thar pa'i thabs kyi don de las bstan bcos 'di 'byung ba'am / don de bstan bcos 'dir bsdus pas /
translated: This treatise is called “The Means of Achieving Deliverance” because it is based on the means of achieving deliverance,

original: bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang thar pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di'i ming yang thar pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: or because it summarizes the means of achieving deliverance.

original: mdo zhes bya ba ni don mdo tsam du bstan pas mdo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdo zhes bya ba ni don mdo tsam du bstan pas mdo zhes bya ste /
translated: The word “sutra” means “that which sets forth the meaning in brief.”

original: de ltar na bstan bcos 'di ni dang por thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba dang / so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba dang / thar pa'i thabs kyi mdo zhes bya ba dag tu ston to //
analyzed: de ltar na bstan bcos 'di ni dang por thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba dang / so sor thar pa'i mdo zhes bya ba dang / thar pa'i thabs kyi mdo zhes bya ba dag tu ston to //
translated: Thus, this treatise is called “The Sutra of Deliverance,” “The Sutra of Individual Deliverance,” and “The Sutra of the Means of Achieving Deliverance.”

original: de la so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas ston te /
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas ston te /
translated: The summary of the Sutra of Individual Deliverance is set forth by means of five characteristics:

original: mchod pa dang / gleng bslang ba dang / yang dag par rtsom pa dang / gzhung rgyas pa dang / bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid kyis so //

original: 'brel pa ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid rab tu bstan pa de yang tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po tshig gi bdag nyid 'dis byed pas tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'di ni thabs yin la /

translated: The connection is that the teaching of their reality is done by this half-verse, which has the nature of words. Thus, this half-verse is the means,

translated: Thus, the half-verse and the goal are connected by the characteristics of the means and the goal that arises from the means.

original: 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'dis bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid mngon par gsal bar byed pas de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis ni thabs yin la dgos pa ni thabs las byung ba yin par gnas so //

translated: Thus, in this first half-verse, the Blessed One’s excellence in benefiting others and his excellence in benefiting himself are revealed. Therefore, the first half-verse is the means, and the purpose is the result of the means.

translated: If they respond by saying, “Just like examining the teeth of a crow, your effort is misplaced, so it is pointless to teach the nature of those,” then the purpose of the purpose

analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa rnams kyi yid la bsams pa'i 'bras bu dge ba yid du 'ong ba khyad par can myur du yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par sdud par byed pa 'di dag kyang skyes bu dam pa'i spyod pa rjes su bsgrub pa na /

analyzed: dang por rang gi ston pa la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa byed pa la zhugs pa yin no //

translated: All those who have auspiciousness, mantra repetition and fire sacrifice, and who have pure minds internally and externally, their power to harm and lead astray is diminished, and

original: de dag gi yid la bsams pa'i 'bras bu dge ba yid du 'ong ba khyad par can dag kyang mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi yid la bsams pa'i 'bras bu dge ba yid du 'ong ba khyad par can dag kyang mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: the special, pleasant, virtuous results they desire will increase.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: bdag nyid chen po gang zhig sems dang khyod mtshan 'dzin //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po gang zhig sems dang khyod mtshan 'dzin //
translated: Those who hold your name in their mind

original: de ni tshangs ris bkra shis sbyin sreg bzlas brjod bgyis //
analyzed: de ni tshangs ris bkra shis sbyin sreg bzlas brjod bgyis //
translated: are auspicious, have fire sacrifice and mantra repetition.

original: de ni khrus bgyis chu ngogs kun du dbang bskur zhing //
analyzed: de ni khrus bgyis chu ngogs kun du dbang bskur zhing //
translated: They are purified, consecrated on the banks of the river,

original: de ni nang dang phyi rol shin tu dag par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nang dang phyi rol shin tu dag par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and they become very pure internally and externally.

original: yang gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs 'byam klas pa bla na med pa nyan pas yid yang dag par bsdus pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das srid pa'i 'jigs pa nges par bcom pa la dad pa mi phyed pa yang dag par bskyed de /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs 'byam klas pa bla na med pa nyan pas yid yang dag par bsdus pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das srid pa'i 'jigs pa nges par bcom pa la dad pa mi phyed pa yang dag par bskyed de /
translated: Moreover, those who have gathered their minds in faith in the Bhagavān, who has conquered the fears of existence, by listening to the boundless, unsurpassed collection of the Tathāgata’s good qualities,

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa gcod pa'i 'dam rdzab mtha' dag rab tu bsal nas mtho ris dang byang grol gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu yang dag par 'dod pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa gcod pa'i 'dam rdzab mtha' dag rab tu bsal nas mtho ris dang byang grol gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu yang dag par 'dod pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: completely eliminate all the mud of the afflictions and branch afflictions and attain the fruit characterized by high status and definite excellence.

original: de ltar yang /🔽gang dag rgyal ba bde gshegs la //
analyzed: de ltar yang / gang dag rgyal ba bde gshegs la //
translated: As it is said:🔽Those who make even a small offering

original: mchod pa chung du'ang byed 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mchod pa chung du'ang byed 'gyur ba //
translated: to the Victorious One, the Sugata,

original: de dag mtho ris kun bgrod nas //
analyzed: de dag mtho ris kun bgrod nas //
translated: having gone to all the higher rebirths,

original: bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur // zhes tshigs su bcad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: attain the state of nectar.

original: gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang /
translated: And in another text:

original: grags mdangs yid bde rtsom zhing de bzhin 'od dang ldan //
analyzed: grags mdangs yid bde rtsom zhing de bzhin 'od dang ldan //
translated: is fame, radiance, mental happiness, and likewise light,

original: dga' zhing smra mkhas dri med blo ldan skyon dang bral //
analyzed: dga' zhing smra mkhas dri med blo ldan skyon dang bral //
translated: joy, skill in speech, a stainless intellect, and freedom from faults.

original: tshe 'phos bdud rtsi'i go 'phang gzhal yas thob 'gyur bas //🔽sangs rgyas bstod 'byung 'bras bur de shes rnams kyis gsungs //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'phos bdud rtsi'i go 'phang gzhal yas thob 'gyur bas // sangs rgyas bstod 'byung 'bras bur de shes rnams kyis gsungs // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One attains the state of immortality, the immeasurable palace.

original: gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa byed de /
translated: Moreover, they make offerings to the Bhagavat through praise and prostration in order to benefit future beings.

original: 'di ltar @6a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar @6a * //
translated: Thus,

original: klag pa la sogs pa la bgegs gnyis srid de /
analyzed: klag pa la sogs pa la bgegs gnyis srid de /
translated: there are two obstacles to reading and so on.

original: gcig ni nang gi mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gcig ni nang gi mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: One is ignorance, which is internal.

original: gnyis pa ni phyi rol gyi 'byung po dang sha za la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phyi rol gyi 'byung po dang sha za la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other is external bhūtas and piśācas.

original: lha yid du 'ong ba la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa byas na ye shes chen po skye ba dang / bsod nams chen po 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha yid du 'ong ba la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa byas na ye shes chen po skye ba dang / bsod nams chen po 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one worships by praising and prostrating to the delightful deities, great intuition will be born and great merit will increase.

original: ye shes chen po skyes na nang gi mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bgegs dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ye shes chen po skyes na nang gi mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bgegs dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: When great intuition is born, one is free from the hindrance of the character of inner non-intuition.

original: ye shes ni mi shes pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams ni ye shes kyis gzhom pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes ni mi shes pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams ni ye shes kyis gzhom pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because intuition is the antidote to non-intuition, and because it is said that the afflictions are to be conquered by intuition.

original: de lta bas na ye shes chen po skyes na mi shes pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na ye shes chen po skyes na mi shes pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when great intuition is born, non-intuition is stopped.

original: bsod nams dang ldan pa chen po 'phel bas kyang phyi rol gyi 'byung po dang sha za la sogs pa'i bgegs ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ldan pa chen po 'phel bas kyang phyi rol gyi 'byung po dang sha za la sogs pa'i bgegs ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the hindrance of external elementals and flesh-eating spirits is stopped by the increase of great merit.

original: 'di ltar bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams kyi bya ba rtsom pa'i dus na 'byung po dang sha za la sogs pas bgegs byed mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams kyi bya ba rtsom pa'i dus na 'byung po dang sha za la sogs pas bgegs byed mi nus so //
translated: Thus, when the activities of those who have merit are begun, elementals, flesh-eating spirits, and so on, are unable to create obstacles.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: brjod na sdig pa 'byang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: brjod na sdig pa 'byang bar 'gyur //
translated: if you speak, your sins will be purified.

original: khyod nyid dran na mchog tu dga' //
analyzed: khyod nyid dran na mchog tu dga' //
translated: If you remember him, you will be supremely happy.

original: btsal na blo gros byed 'gyur te //
analyzed: btsal na blo gros byed 'gyur te //
translated: If you seek him, you will be wise.🔽If you understand him, you will be completely pure.

original: yongs su shes na rnam par dag / khyod la bsu na dpal du byed //
analyzed: yongs su shes na rnam par dag / khyod la bsu na dpal du byed //
translated: If you welcome him, you will be glorious.

original: bsten na blo mchog byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsten na blo mchog byed par 'gyur //
translated: If you rely on him, you will be most intelligent.

original: 'grogs na 'jigs pa med par byed //
analyzed: 'grogs na 'jigs pa med par byed //
translated: If you associate with him, you will be fearless.

original: bsnyen bkur byas na bde byed 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byas na bde byed 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you serve him, you will be happy.

original: gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang /
translated: Also, it is said in another sūtra:

original: thub pa'i dbang la phyag 'tshal bas //
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang la phyag 'tshal bas //
translated: “Homage to the Lord of Sages!

original: 'jig rten dag na mi rnams kyi //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na mi rnams kyi //
translated: In the world, the fame of humans

original: grags pa 'phel zhing legs pa skya //
analyzed: grags pa 'phel zhing legs pa skya //
translated: increases and becomes excellent.

original: snang bas rnam 'phel bgegs kun sel //
analyzed: snang bas rnam 'phel bgegs kun sel //
translated: Illuminated, all obstacles are removed.

original: dgra rnams thams cad spong 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: dgra rnams thams cad spong 'gyur zhing //
translated: All enemies are abandoned.

original: sems rgyud bde 'gror nges byed la //
analyzed: sems rgyud bde 'gror nges byed la //
translated: The continuum of mind is definitely made to go to happy realms.

original: mthar yang nges pa kho nar ni //
analyzed: mthar yang nges pa kho nar ni //
translated: In the end, it is certain that

original: zhi ba'i 'bras bu thob par byed //🔽ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i 'bras bu thob par byed //🔽ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the result of peace is attained.”

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir bstan bcos la sogs pa rtsom pa na ston pa la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir bstan bcos la sogs pa rtsom pa na ston pa la bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa byed de /
translated: Moreover, in order to generate respect for the treatise and the teacher, when one composes a treatise, etc., one makes offerings by way of praising and prostrating to the teacher.

original: 'di ltar sgrub pa po ni ston pa'i yon tan shes pa dang / mi shes pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrub pa po ni ston pa'i yon tan shes pa dang / mi shes pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, the practitioner is of two types, distinguished by whether or not he knows the qualities of the teacher.

original: de la ston pa'i yon tan shes pa rnams ni bstan bcos brtsams pa na bcom ldan 'das @6b kyi yon tan gyi tshogs 'byam klas pa bla na med pa brjod pa thos nas bstan bcos la gus pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ston pa'i yon tan shes pa rnams ni bstan bcos brtsams pa na bcom ldan 'das @6b kyi yon tan gyi tshogs 'byam klas pa bla na med pa brjod pa thos nas bstan bcos la gus pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who know the qualities of the teacher, when they compose a treatise, having heard the expression of the immeasurable, unsurpassed collection of qualities of the Bhagavat, generate respect for the treatise.

original: bstan bcos 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan bcos la gus pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan bcos la gus pa skyed par byed do //
translated: They generate respect for the treatise, thinking, “This treatise is in accord with the scriptures of the Bhagavat.”

original: bstan bcos la gus pa skyes par gyur na /
analyzed: bstan bcos la gus pa skyes par gyur na /
translated: When respect for the treatise is generated,

original: bstan bcos mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / sgrub pa la sogs pa dag la gus pas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / sgrub pa la sogs pa dag la gus pas 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One engages in listening to the treatise, reflection, exposition, practice, etc., with respect.

original: ston pa'i yon tan mi shes pa rnams ni /
analyzed: ston pa'i yon tan mi shes pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who do not know the Teacher's virtues

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrags pa thos na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrags pa thos na /
translated: when they hear the proclamation of the Tathāgata's aggregate of virtues,

original: ston pa la gus pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ston pa la gus pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: they generate respect for the Teacher,

original: gang gi yon tan gyi tshogs 'di lta bu dag yang dag par sgrogs pa'i ston pa de ni shin tu che ba yin no zhes ston pa la gus pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi yon tan gyi tshogs 'di lta bu dag yang dag par sgrogs pa'i ston pa de ni shin tu che ba yin no zhes ston pa la gus pa skyed par byed do //
translated: thinking, The Teacher who proclaims such an aggregate of virtues is very great.

original: ston pa la gus pa skyed par gyur na bstan bcos kyi don shes par bya ba la gus pas 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ston pa la gus pa skyed par gyur na bstan bcos kyi don shes par bya ba la gus pas 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: When they generate respect for the Teacher, they engage with respect in understanding the meaning of the treatise.

original: de dag ni dgos pa'i dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dgos pa'i dgos pa yin no //
translated: These are the ultimate purposes.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don ni 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don ni 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, here the meaning of the words is as follows.

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'di'i brjod par bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa mchog brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'di'i brjod par bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa mchog brjod pa'o //
translated: The subject matter of these one and a half verses is the expression of the excellence of the Blessed One’s benefit for others and the supreme excellence of his benefit for himself.

original: dgos pa ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The purpose is the teaching of their nature.

original: 'brel pa ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni rab tu bstan pa de yang tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'dis byed pas tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis dang dgos par thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni rab tu bstan pa de yang tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'dis byed pas tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis dang dgos par thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection is that the teaching of their nature is done by these one and a half verses, so the one and a half verses are connected with the purpose as means and goal.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni dam pa rnams kyi spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / bgegs dang log 'dren nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / mtho ris dang byang grol gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu yang dag par 'dod pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni dam pa rnams kyi spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / bgegs dang log 'dren nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / mtho ris dang byang grol gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu yang dag par 'dod pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The ultimate purpose is that one will engage in the conduct of the holy, obstacles and negative influences will be pacified, and one will perfectly attain the desired results of the characteristics of the higher realms and liberation.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams kyi nang dang phyi rol gyi bgegs zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / ston pa'i yon tan shes pa dang / mi shes pa'i sgrub pa po rnam gnyis bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams kyi nang dang phyi rol gyi bgegs zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / ston pa'i yon tan shes pa dang / mi shes pa'i sgrub pa po rnam gnyis bstan bcos dang ston pa la gus pa skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It will pacify the inner and outer obstacles of future generations, and it will cause both types of practitioners—those who know the qualities of the Teacher and those who do not—to develop respect for the treatise and the Teacher.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod //🔽'phags pa'i tshogs @7a * //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod // 'phags pa'i tshogs @7a * //
translated: The basis of training for the omniscient one, the vessel of the three jewels,

original: kyi dbus su dbye bar bya //
analyzed: kyi dbus su dbye bar bya //
translated: In the midst of the assembly of the noble ones,🔽I shall expound the Vinaya.

original: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma phyed kyis ni so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma phyed kyis ni so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' ba bstan te /
translated: The second half of the next verse teaches the commitment to compose the Vinaya:

original: de yang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba dag gi 'jug pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: de yang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba dag gi 'jug pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the limb of engagement for those who are inclined to conceptualize.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis po 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this half-verse is twofold:

original: ston pa la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa'o //
translated: worship through praise and worship through homage.

original: de la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, worship through praise is twofold:

original: 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ; bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ; bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: through the excellence of benefit for others and through the excellence of benefit for oneself.

original: de la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa dang po gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa dang po gcig gis bstan to //
translated: Therein, the excellence of benefit for others is taught in the first verse.

original: des kyang 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga bstan te /
analyzed: des kyang 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga bstan te /
translated: By that, the excellence of benefit for others is taught in five aspects.

original: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of cause, the perfection of benefit, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of compassion, and the perfection of the special result.🔽Of these,

original: de la / snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
analyzed: de la / snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
translated: The banner of fame resounds in the three worlds.

original: zhes bya bas ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of cause.

original: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //
translated: The sound of the Dharma, the lion's roar,

original: zhes bya bas ni phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of benefit.🔽The omniscient one,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of wisdom.🔽The one who has attained the treasure of the Three Jewels,

original: dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa zhes bya bas ni thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa zhes bya bas ni thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of compassion.

original: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
analyzed: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
translated: His feet are touched by the crest jewels of Brahma and Indra,

original: zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the special result.

original: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma'i phyed dang pos bstan to //
analyzed: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma'i phyed dang pos bstan to //
translated: The perfection of one's own aim is taught by the first half of the next verse.

original: des kyang 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: des kyang 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: By that, the excellence of the perfection of the qualities of the Bhagavat Buddha, the chief of the world, is taught, which is twofold:

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of abandonment and the perfection of knowledge.🔽Of those,

original: de la / sdug @7b bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med rgal ba //
analyzed: de la / sdug @7b bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med rgal ba //
translated: Having crossed the ocean of suffering, without bottom or shore,

original: zhes bya bas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: by this, the perfection of abandonment is taught.

original: 'gro ba'i gtso bo zhes bya bas ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso bo zhes bya bas ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: By chief of the world the perfection of knowledge is taught.

original: de ltar 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ; bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa smos pa des ni ston pa la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ; bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa smos pa des ni ston pa la bstod pa'i sgo nas mchod pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, by mentioning the qualities of the Bhagavat Buddha, the chief of beings, which are the perfection of benefit for others and the perfection of benefit for self, he shows worship by way of praise of the Teacher.

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal bas te /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal bas te /
translated: Worship by way of prostration is by way of prostration with body, speech, and mind.

original: de ni spyi bos phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni spyi bos phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: That is shown by “I bow my head in reverence.”

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Having thus prostrated, what will he do?

original: so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' bar bya ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' bar bya ste /
translated: He will undertake the composition of the Prātimokṣa.

original: de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma'i phyed kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'og ma'i phyed kyis bstan to //
translated: That is shown by the second half of the verse.

original: des kyang gang gis bstan pa dang / ci zhig bstan pa dang / su la bstan pas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod nas /
analyzed: des kyang gang gis bstan pa dang / ci zhig bstan pa dang / su la bstan pas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod nas /
translated: By that, having expressed the greatness of the Prātimokṣa by way of what is taught, what is taught, and to whom it is taught,

original: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The one who taught what to whom is to be divided in the midst of the assembly to whom it was taught.

original: de la gang gis bstan zhe na ston pas te /
analyzed: de la gang gis bstan zhe na ston pas te /
translated: What is the one who taught? The Teacher.

original: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the one called Omniscient.

original: ci zhig bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bstan zhe na /
translated: What was taught?

original: so sor thar ba ste /
analyzed: so sor thar ba ste /
translated: The Prātimokṣa.

original: de ni bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya bas bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the one called the vessel of the precious basis of training.

original: su la bstan zhe na /
analyzed: su la bstan zhe na /
translated: To whom was it taught?

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la ste /
translated: To the Saṅgha of Hearers.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: That is taught by the one called the assembly of noble ones.

original: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba'i ston pas so sor thar pa bstan pa de nyid nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba'i ston pas so sor thar pa bstan pa de nyid nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbye bar bya ste /
translated: The Teacher taught the Prātimokṣa to the Saṅgha of Hearers, and that is to be divided in the midst of the assembly to whom it was taught.

original: de ni / dbus su dbye bar bya zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni / dbus su dbye bar bya zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: That is taught by the one called to be divided in the midst.

original: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
translated: That is the general meaning for now.

original: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the subsidiary meaning will be explained.

original: de la 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /🔽snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
analyzed: de la 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten gsum du grags //
translated: The qualities of the Lord of beings, the Bhagavan Buddha, are the means for the perfect benefit of others.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The banner of fame resounds in the three worlds.

original: snyan pa'i zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa grangs med pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa las byung ba'i 'bras bu spangs pa dang / ye @8a * //
analyzed: snyan pa'i zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa grangs med pa nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa las byung ba'i 'bras bu spangs pa dang / ye @8a * //
translated: The banner of fame is the result of the perfect cause, the accumulation of immeasurable merit and knowledge by the Tathagata for countless eons.

original: shes bla na med pas bsdus pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: shes bla na med pas bsdus pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is the immeasurable qualities included in the unexcelled abandonment and knowledge.

original: ba dan zhes bya ba ni snyan pa de nyid ba dan dang 'dra bas ba dan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ba dan zhes bya ba ni snyan pa de nyid ba dan dang 'dra bas ba dan zhes bya ste /
translated: The banner is like that fame, so it is called a banner.

original: yon tan mngon par 'phags pas kun la gsal ba dang / de la dmigs na mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i lam mi nor ba'i phyir ro //🔽'jig rten gsum zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yon tan mngon par 'phags pas kun la gsal ba dang / de la dmigs na mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i lam mi nor ba'i phyir ro // 'jig rten gsum zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And if one focuses on it, one will not err in the path to the higher realms and definite excellence.

original: 'jig tshogs kyi phung po 'jig pa tsam la brten bas bsdu ba'i khams gsum po 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dag go //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi phung po 'jig pa tsam la brten bas bsdu ba'i khams gsum po 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dag go //
translated: The three worlds are the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness, which are subsumed in the mere aggregates of beings in the world.

original: grags zhes bya ba ni de dag tu snyan pa'i sgras khyab pa ste /
analyzed: grags zhes bya ba ni de dag tu snyan pa'i sgras khyab pa ste /
translated: Renown means that the sound of his fame pervades those worlds.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe dang por sa bla ba la grags la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang po mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe dang por sa bla ba la grags la /
translated: When the Bhagavat first attained buddhahood, his fame first spread to the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings.

original: de nas bar snang ba la grags /🔽de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris la grags so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bar snang ba la grags / de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris la grags so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then it spread to the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: 'og min gyi bar du grags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: 'og min gyi bar du grags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
translated: Then it spread to the gods of the Heaven of the Yāma gods, and so on, until it spread to the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: gzugs med par ji ltar grags she na /
analyzed: gzugs med par ji ltar grags she na /
translated: How does it spread to the formless realm?

original: gzugs can gyi khams na gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams na gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: When it spreads to the gods of the form realm,

original: grags pa'i bag chags rgyud la yod pas rgyu la 'bras bu btags te grags par brjod do //🔽des ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa las byung ba'i yon tan gzhan la ston par byed pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: grags pa'i bag chags rgyud la yod pas rgyu la 'bras bu btags te grags par brjod do // des ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu phun sum tshogs pa las byung ba'i yon tan gzhan la ston par byed pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Since the latent impressions of fame exist in the mindstream, the cause is designated as the effect and is expressed as fame.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the cause, which is the means for accomplishing the welfare of others, by means of demonstrating to others the qualities that arise from the perfection of generosity and so forth.

original: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the perfection of benefit,🔽the text reads:

original: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa //🔽zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sgra seng ge'i sgra bsgrags pa // zhes gsungs te ;
translated: The sound of the sublime Dharma, the lion’s roar.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The sublime one is the Blessed Buddha.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he has completely abandoned all afflictions without exception, together with their latent imprints.

original: chos sgra zhes bya ba ni dam pa des gsungs pa'i chos te /
analyzed: chos sgra zhes bya ba ni dam pa des gsungs pa'i chos te /
translated: The sound of the Dharma is the Dharma taught by that sublime one.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is because the four noble truths were taught from the throat of glory.

original: / seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyi sgra de nyid seng ge'i sgra dang 'dra ba'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyi sgra de nyid seng ge'i sgra dang 'dra ba'i phyir seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ste /
translated: The lion's roar is the sound of the true Dharma, because it is like the lion's roar.

original: mu stegs can glang po che lta bu skrag par byed cing rigs kyi bu mi'i seng ge'i phru gu lta bu dag sdud par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mu stegs can glang po che lta bu skrag par byed cing rigs kyi bu mi'i seng ge'i phru gu lta bu dag sdud par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: It terrifies the elephant-like tīrthikas and attracts the lion-cub-like sons of the victors.

original: bsgrags pa zhes bya ba ni bstan @8b pa ste ;
analyzed: bsgrags pa zhes bya ba ni bstan @8b pa ste ;
translated: It is proclaimed, which means it is taught.

original: bden pa bzhi la lan gsum du bzlas te chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la lan gsum du bzlas te chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is proclaimed in the three turnings of the wheel of the Dharma with its twelve aspects, which are the four noble truths repeated three times.

original: des ni ston pas mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa gzhan la chos ston pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ston pas mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa gzhan la chos ston pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of benefit, which is the perfection of the method for accomplishing the welfare of others through teaching the Dharma to others.

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the perfection of wisdom,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said that he is omniscient.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The one called omniscient is the Lord.

original: dang por dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma lus pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / tshad med pa dang / phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang por dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma lus pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / tshad med pa dang / phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, because of the non-reversal of the nature of all things, the uncommon, the immeasurable, and the non-erroneous teaching.

original: des ni thams cad mkhyen pas lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni thams cad mkhyen pas lung shin tu rnam par dag pa gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa shes rab phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of wisdom as the means for the perfection of the welfare of others through the teaching of the establishment of the extremely pure scripture by the omniscient one.

original: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the perfection of compassion,

original: dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dkon mchog mdzod brnyes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the one who has attained the treasure of the jewels.”

original: dkon mchog ces bya ba ni bshad pa dang / bsgrub pa'i chos dkon mchog ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog ces bya ba ni bshad pa dang / bsgrub pa'i chos dkon mchog ste /
translated: The jewels are the jewels of the teaching and the practice.

original: rin po che dang 'dra bar dkon pa dang / rin che ba dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa gnod pa byed pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che dang 'dra bar dkon pa dang / rin che ba dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa gnod pa byed pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a jewel because it is rare, valuable, delightful, beneficial, and the antidote to non-human beings, etc., that cause harm.

original: mdzod ces bya ba ni rin chen mdzod dang 'dra bar chos dkon mchog de'i mdzod 'phags pa'i dge 'dun te lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas de'i snod du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzod ces bya ba ni rin chen mdzod dang 'dra bar chos dkon mchog de'i mdzod 'phags pa'i dge 'dun te lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas de'i snod du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “treasury” means that the noble Sangha is the treasury of that jewel of the Dharma, because they are the vessels of the Dharma through scripture and realization.

original: brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma nyid du brnyes pa ste /
analyzed: brnyes pa zhes bya ba ni slob ma nyid du brnyes pa ste /
translated: “ Attained” means attained as disciples.

original: ston pa'i lam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i lam gyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they follow the path of the Teacher.

original: des ni 'khor yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'khor yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of compassion as the means for the perfection of the benefit of others through the complete ripening of the retinue.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The perfection of the special result is shown in the next verse.

original: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
analyzed: zhabs la tshangs dbang gtsug gi nor bus gtugs //
translated: The crowns of Brahmā and Indra touch his feet.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: zhabs la zhes pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: zhabs la zhes pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: “His feet” are the feet of the Tathāgata, which bear the mark of the wheel.

original: tshangs dbang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshangs dbang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Brahmā and Indra” are as follows.

original: changs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i bsam gtan khyad par can bsgrubs te /🔽tshangs pa'i rgyal po @9a * //🔽thob pa stong gi 'jig rten la dbang sgyur ba'i tshangs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: changs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i bsam gtan khyad par can bsgrubs te / tshangs pa'i rgyal po @9a * // thob pa stong gi 'jig rten la dbang sgyur ba'i tshangs pa chen po'o //
translated: “Brahmā” is one who has attained the special meditative concentration of the first meditative concentration.

original: dbang po zhes bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin te /
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin te /
translated: “Indra” is the king of the Thirty-Three Gods.

original: de gnyis ni sa bla'i gtso bo dang / stong gi khams na gtso bor grags nas 'dir smos par zad kyi gzhan yang de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //🔽gtsug gi nor bu zhes bya ba ni spyi bo ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ni sa bla'i gtso bo dang / stong gi khams na gtso bor grags nas 'dir smos par zad kyi gzhan yang de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o // gtsug gi nor bu zhes bya ba ni spyi bo ste /
translated: These two are the chief ones on the earth and in the heavens, and they are mentioned here because they are renowned as the chief ones in a thousand world systems. But others should be understood in the same way.🔽“The crowns” are the heads.

original: nor bu gdags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu gdags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called crowns because they are the places where the jewels are placed.

original: gtugs zhes bya ba ni des btud de phyag byas pa'o //
analyzed: gtugs zhes bya ba ni des btud de phyag byas pa'o //
translated: The word bowed means that he bowed down and paid homage.

original: des ni 'jig rten na 'bras bu thob pa'i mchog dag gis spyi bos gtugs pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa pa'i thabs su gyur pa 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //🔽de ltar de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa la bstod pas mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'jig rten na 'bras bu thob pa'i mchog dag gis spyi bos gtugs pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa pa'i thabs su gyur pa 'bras bu'i khyad par phun sum tshogs pa bstan to // de ltar de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa la bstod pas mchod pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the excellence of the result, which is the means for the perfection of the aims of others, by way of the bowing down of the heads of those who have attained the highest results in the world.🔽Thus, by these verses, he has shown worship by praise to the Blessed One, the Lord of the world, by way of the excellence of his perfection of the aims of others.

original: de'i 'og tu 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /🔽sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med rgal ba //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / sdug bsngal rgya mtsho gting mtha' med rgal ba //
translated: After that, with regard to the Blessed One, the Lord of the world, he shows the excellence of his perfection of the abandonment of the greatness of the excellence of his perfection of his own aim, from the point of view of the excellence of his perfection of abandonment,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: saying, He has crossed the fathomless ocean of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi bas bsdus pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi bas bsdus pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag go //
translated: Suffering is the five appropriated aggregates, which are included in birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho zhes bya ste /
translated: The ocean is suffering itself, which is called an ocean because it is like an ocean.

original: shin tu rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called an ocean because it is very vast.

original: gting med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i gting med pa ste /
analyzed: gting med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i gting med pa ste /
translated: It is bottomless because it has no bottom.

original: 'dis ni rgya mtsho bzhin du sdug bsngal mang ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgya mtsho bzhin du sdug bsngal mang ba nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows that suffering is like an ocean in being very vast.

original: mtha' med pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi mtha' med pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' med pa zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi mtha' med pa ste /
translated: It is boundless because it has no end.

original: 'dis ni rgya mtsho bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgyun mi 'chad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgya mtsho bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgyun mi 'chad par bstan to //
translated: This shows that suffering is like an ocean in being an uninterrupted continuum.

original: rgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'das pa ste /
translated: It is to be crossed over because it is to be transcended.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa spangs pas sdug bsngal zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa spangs pas sdug bsngal zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suffering is to be transcended because the afflictions and karma are abandoned and suffering is exhausted.

original: des ni las dang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ston to //🔽ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: des ni las dang nyon mongs pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ston to // ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: This shows the excellence of abandonment through the abandonment of the defilement that is characterized by the arising of karma and moral defilement, and so the excellence of the perfection of the benefit for oneself is revealed.🔽With reference to the excellence of direct intuition he says:

original: 'gro ba'i gtso zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtso zhes bya ba gsungs te / 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten te /
translated: The foremost of beings.

original: rtag tu @9b 'khor ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu @9b 'khor ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: The world is called 'beings' because it is always revolving.

original: gtso zhes bya ba ni zla med pa ste mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso zhes bya ba ni zla med pa ste mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The foremost is without a rival, because it is the highest.

original: de ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The foremost of beings is the Lord Buddha, because he has become the foremost of all beings through his acquisition of direct intuition which is unattached and unimpeded in regard to all that is to be known.

original: 'dis ni dngos po ji snyed yod pa nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid thugs su chud pas 'gro ba'i gtso bor gyur pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po ji snyed yod pa nyid dang ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid thugs su chud pas 'gro ba'i gtso bor gyur pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyi khyad par ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to
translated: This shows the excellence of the perfection of knowledge, the special excellence of the perfection of the individual aim, by means of becoming the chief of the world through understanding the existence of things in their variety and the existence of things in their real mode.

original: // de ltar de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa la bstod pas mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: // de ltar de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ston pa la bstod pas mchod pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, by these verses he shows worship by praise, showing the excellence of the qualities of the Lord Buddha, the chief of the world, by means of the perfection of the individual aim.

original: de'i 'og tu phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to show worship by prostration, he says:

original: spyi bos phyag 'tshal te zhes gsungs te /🔽spyi bos zhes bya bas ni lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba dngos su bstan te /
analyzed: spyi bos phyag 'tshal te zhes gsungs te / spyi bos zhes bya bas ni lus kyis phyag 'tshal ba dngos su bstan te /
translated: Having bowed my head to him,🔽By the words “bowing my head” he shows the actual prostration with the body.

original: phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bas ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum char gyis phyag 'tshal ba yang bsdus par blta'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal te zhes bya bas ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum char gyis phyag 'tshal ba yang bsdus par blta'o //
translated: By the words “having bowed” he shows the prostration with the three, body, speech, and mind.

original: 'dis ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas ston pa la mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi phyag 'tshal ba'i sgo nas ston pa la mchod pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the worship of the Teacher by means of the obeisance of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal te ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Having thus paid obeisance, what is to be done?

original: so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: so sor thar pa brtsam par dam bca' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the undertaking of the vow to compose the Prātimokṣa,🔽he says:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod //🔽'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod // 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya //
translated: The basis of training of the Omniscient One, the vessel of the Three Jewels,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is to be expounded in the midst of the assembly of the Noble Ones.

original: 'dis ni gang gis bstan pa dang / ci zhig bstan pa dang / su la bstan pas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni gang gis bstan pa dang / ci zhig bstan pa dang / su la bstan pas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod nas /
translated: By this, having described the greatness of the Prātimokṣa by whom it is taught, what is taught, and to whom it is taught,

original: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid du su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid du su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: it is shown that what is taught by whom should be expounded in the midst of the assembly of those to whom it is taught.

original: de la gang gis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang gis bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught by whom?

original: ston pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa ste /
translated: The Teacher.

original: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: That is shown by the word Omniscient One.

original: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is as before.

original: ci zhig bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught?

original: so sor thar pa ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa ste /
translated: The Prātimokṣa.

original: 'di ni bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ni bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the line, “The training is the vessel of the jewels.

original: bslab pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bslab pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ” The training is defined as the avoidance of killing and so on.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni tshig ste /
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni tshig ste /
translated: The basis is the words,

original: de la don gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning is contained in them.

original: dkon mchog ces bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi de nyid de chen po rnams kyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / dkon pa'i phyir @10a * //
analyzed: dkon mchog ces bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi de nyid de chen po rnams kyi rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / dkon pa'i phyir @10a * //
translated: The jewels are the very same training bases, because they are the conditions for the great ones and because they are rare.

original: rin po che dang 'dra bas dkon mchog go //
analyzed: rin po che dang 'dra bas dkon mchog go //
translated: They are like jewels, and so they are called jewels.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?
