original: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhi dang / phran tshegs dang / gzhung bla ma dag go //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhi dang / phran tshegs dang / gzhung bla ma dag go //
translated: They are the Vinaya, the Sūtras, and the Uttara-grantha.

original: snod ces bya ba ni de dag gi snod de so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di nyid do //
analyzed: snod ces bya ba ni de dag gi snod de so sor thar pa'i mdo 'di nyid do //
translated: The vessel is the very same Sūtra of Individual Liberation, because it is the vessel for them.

original: des ni ston pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya'o //
analyzed: des ni ston pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, the training bases of the Omniscient One are called the vessel of the jewels, because they were taught by the Omniscient One.

original: su la bstan zhe na /
analyzed: su la bstan zhe na /
translated: To whom are they taught?

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la ste /
translated: They are taught to the Saṅgha of Śrāvakas.

original: de ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i tshogs zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: That is indicated by the phrase “in the midst of the assembly of noble ones.”

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du gyur pa'o //
translated: “ Noble ones” are those who have gone far from evil, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: tshogs zhes bya ba ni bzhi yan chad do //
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba ni bzhi yan chad do //
translated: “ Assembly” refers to a group of four or more.

original: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba ni ston pas so sor thar pa bstan pa de nyid nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis ci zhig bstan pa de nyid su la bstan pa'i tshogs kyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba ni ston pas so sor thar pa bstan pa de nyid nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi dbus su dbye bar bya ba ste /
translated: The one who teaches and the one to whom the teaching is given are to be distinguished in the midst of the assembly. The one who teaches is the Buddha, and the one to whom the teaching is given is the assembly of śrāvakas.

original: de ni dbus su dbye ba zhes bya bas bstan te dbus su zhes bya ba nang du'o //
analyzed: de ni dbus su dbye ba zhes bya bas bstan te dbus su zhes bya ba nang du'o //
translated: That is indicated by the phrase “in the midst of the assembly.” “ In the midst” means “in the middle.”

original: dbye bar bya ba ni gdon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba ni gdon par bya ba'o //
translated: “ To be distinguished” means “to be expelled.”

original: su dag gi dbus su zhe na /
analyzed: su dag gi dbus su zhe na /
translated: In the midst of what assembly?

original: 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi ste /
translated: In the midst of the assembly of noble ones.

original: dper na rin po che'i snod dbye bar yang rin po che rtog shes pa dag gi tshogs kyi dbus su dbye ba bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod 'di yang bslab gzhi rin po che lta bu rtog shes pa'i 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus
analyzed: dper na rin po che'i snod dbye bar yang rin po che rtog shes pa dag gi tshogs kyi dbus su dbye ba bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i bslab gzhi dkon mchog snod 'di yang bslab gzhi rin po che lta bu rtog shes pa'i 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dbus
translated: For example, just as a precious vessel is opened in the midst of an assembly of those who know how to examine precious things, so too this vessel of the Three Jewels, the basis of training for omniscience, is to be opened and extracted in the midst of an assembly of noble ones who know how to examine the precious basis of training.

original: su dbye zhing gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: su dbye zhing gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: mchod pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: mchod pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The characteristics of worship have been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the characteristics of introduction should be explained.

original: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par brtsams pa gleng bslang ba'o //
analyzed: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo yang dag par brtsams pa gleng bslang ba'o //
translated: The characteristics of introduction are as follows: The introduction is the commencement of composing the Sūtra on Individual Liberation.

original: de yang so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid thos nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par 'dod pas so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes gleng bslang dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid thos nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par 'dod pas so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes gleng bslang dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, having heard the greatness of Individual Liberation, one who desires the path of accumulation together with its result should accomplish Individual Liberation. Since it is necessary to introduce this, therefore,

original: sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //
translated: The Buddha's discipline is a great ocean.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig gsungs so //
translated: Thus, eleven verses are spoken.

original: de la 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig po de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig po de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, the subject matter, purpose, connection, and purpose of the purpose should be stated for these eleven verses.

original: de la brjod par bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid do //
translated: Among them, the subject matter is the greatness of the Prātimokṣa.

original: dgos pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: The purpose is understanding.

original: 'brel @10b pa ni rtogs pa de yang gleng bslang ba 'dis byed pas gleng bslang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'di dang dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel @10b pa ni rtogs pa de yang gleng bslang ba 'dis byed pas gleng bslang ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'di dang dgos pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel ba'o //
translated: The connection is that understanding is produced by this introduction, so the method of the introductory verse and the purpose, which is characterized as arising from the method, are connected.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid thos nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par 'dod pas so sor thar pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid thos nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par 'dod pas so sor thar pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The purpose of the purpose is that having heard the greatness of the Prātimokṣa, one who desires the path of accumulation with its result establishes the Prātimokṣa.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig po 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gcig po 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The summarized meaning of these eleven verses is threefold:

original: so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa dang / tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba dang / so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa dang / tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba dang / so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: the greatness of the pratimoksa, the path of accumulation together with its result, and the practice of the pratimoksa.

original: de la so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The greatness of the pratimoksa is also threefold:

original: tshe 'di'i 'bras bu dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu dang / so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa'o //🔽de la / sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i 'bras bu dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu dang / so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa'o // de la / sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //
translated: the result in this life, the result in the next life, and praise of the pratimoksa as being like the Teacher.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni tshe 'di'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni tshe 'di'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The three verses beginning with “The Buddha’s discipline is a great ocean” teach the result in this life.

original: mtsho bas zab pa'i 'khor ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: mtsho bas zab pa'i 'khor ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The two verses beginning with “From samsara, deeper than the ocean” teach the result in the next life.

original: nga ni mya ngan 'da' gyur na //
analyzed: nga ni mya ngan 'da' gyur na //
translated: When I have passed into nirvana

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa bstan to //
translated: One verse on the praise of the prātimokṣa as the teacher:

original: tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The path of preparation with its result is threefold:

original: tshogs kyi lam dkon pa dang / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pa dang / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam dkon pa dang / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pa dang / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan bya ba'o //
translated: the path of preparation as rare, the path of preparation as attained, and the path of preparation as attained and practiced.🔽Two verses on the path of preparation as rare:

original: de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni tshogs kyi lam dkon pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni tshogs kyi lam dkon pa bstan to //
translated: The word “buddha” is rare, and the word “buddhahood” is rare.🔽One verse on the path of preparation as attained:🔽The appearance of a buddha in the world, the teaching of the true teaching,

original: 'jig rten sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pa bstan to //
translated: One verse on the path of preparation as attained and practiced:

original: mkhas pa bdag la legs 'dod cing //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan bya ba bstan to /
analyzed: mkhas pa bdag la legs 'dod cing //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan bya ba bstan to /
translated: The wise who desire their own good

original: so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The practice of the pratimoksa has four aspects:

original: bdag gi dbang du byas pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa dang / chos kyi dbang du byas pa dang / bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du byas pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa dang / chos kyi dbang du byas pa dang / bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: 1. based on oneself, 2. based on others, 3. based on the Dharma, and 4. based on accomplishment.

original: de la / dge slong dbang dul kun dbang po //
analyzed: de la / dge slong dbang dul kun dbang po //
translated: Among them, the verse “The monk who has controlled his senses”

original: @11a * // zhes bya bas ni bdag gi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
analyzed: @11a * // zhes bya bas ni bdag gi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
translated: teaches the aspect based on oneself.

original: sangs rgyas mi 'gyur rab byung ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi 'gyur rab byung ba //
translated: The verse “The one who has gone forth in the Buddha’s teachings”

original: zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
translated: teaches the aspect based on others.

original: nges par thar pa 'dod rnams kyis //
analyzed: nges par thar pa 'dod rnams kyis //
translated: The verse “Those who desire liberation”

original: zhes bya bas ni chos kyi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni chos kyi dbang du byas pa bstan to //
translated: teaches the aspect based on the Dharma.

original: so sor thar ba rtag tu bsrungs //
analyzed: so sor thar ba rtag tu bsrungs //
translated: The verse “Always protect the pratimoksa”

original: zhes bya bas ni bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: teaches the aspect based on accomplishment.

original: de ni re zhig spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de ni re zhig spyi'i don to //
translated: This is the general meaning for now.

original: yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: The branch meanings will be explained.

original: de la tshe 'di'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la tshe 'di'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In this regard, in terms of the greatness of the pratimoksa in terms of its result in this life, three verses are stated:

original: sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho //🔽gting mtha' med pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dul ba gang chen mtsho // gting mtha' med pa thams cad kyis //
translated: The ocean of the Buddha’s discipline🔽is without bottom or end.

original: gnas pa'i snying dang snying po ni /
analyzed: gnas pa'i snying dang snying po ni /
translated: The heart and essence of all

original: so sor thar pa 'di yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa 'di yin no // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs te /
translated: is this pratimoksa.

original: sangs rgyas 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba'o //
translated: The Buddha’s discipline is the discipline taught by the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /🔽don thams cad nges par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te / don thams cad nges par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The Buddha is the Bhagavan Buddha.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i gnyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i gnyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has ascertained all objects or because he is free from all sleep of affliction together with its imprints.

original: 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i sde snod 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dul ba gzhi dang / 'dul ba phran tshegs dang / 'dul ba gzhung bla ma ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i sde snod 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / 'dul ba gzhi dang / 'dul ba phran tshegs dang / 'dul ba gzhung bla ma ste /
translated: The term vinaya means the Vinaya Piṭaka, the Vinaya Discourse, the Vinaya Bases, the Vinaya Miscellany, and the Vinaya Exegesis.

original: slob ma rnams dngos po thams cad kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das par 'khrid par byed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: slob ma rnams dngos po thams cad kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das par 'khrid par byed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Or, it is called vinaya because it leads disciples to the nirvana, which is the highest of all things,

original: rgyud la kun du spyod pa'i 'dir ma dang rnam par smin pa'i dri mas skyon chags par byed pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud la kun du spyod pa'i 'dir ma dang rnam par smin pa'i dri mas skyon chags par byed pa'i nyes pa thams cad rnam par 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because it disciplines all the faults that defile the mindstream, such as the stains of the innate and the fully ripened.

original: gang chen mtsho zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: gang chen mtsho zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho ste /
translated: The term mahāsāgara means ocean.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha’s vinaya is like an ocean.

original: ji ltar 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dra zhe na /
translated: How is it like an ocean?

original: gting mtha' med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gting mtha' med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be “without bottom or shore.”

original: rgya mtsho la gzhi'i gting dpag med pa bzhin du 'dul ba la yang kun nas slong ba'i gting mtha' dpag tu med pa'i phyir dang / rgya mtsho la pha rol gyi mtha' dpag tu med pa bzhin du 'dul ba la yang 'bras bu'i mtha' dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya mtsho la gzhi'i gting dpag med pa bzhin du 'dul ba la yang kun nas slong ba'i gting mtha' dpag tu med pa'i phyir dang / rgya mtsho la pha rol gyi mtha' dpag tu med pa bzhin du 'dul ba la yang 'bras bu'i mtha' dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the ocean has an immeasurable extent, so too the Vinaya has an immeasurable extent of result.

original: 'dul ba de dag thams cad kyi gnas pa'i snying dang snying po ni so sor thar pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dul ba de dag thams cad kyi gnas pa'i snying dang snying po ni so sor thar pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is the heart and essence of all those Vinaya teachings.

original: gnas pa'i @11b zhes bya ba ni ltung ba sde lnga dang / bzhi bcu rtsa bdun la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i @11b zhes bya ba ni ltung ba sde lnga dang / bzhi bcu rtsa bdun la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The Vinaya is the presentation of the characteristics of the five classes of downfalls, the forty seven downfalls and so on.

original: de'i snying zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa de'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i snying zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa de'i rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: The heart of that is the cause of that presentation of characteristics.

original: 'phen pa dang sa bon dang kun nas slong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa dang sa bon dang kun nas slong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the impetus, seed and motivation.

original: snying po zhes bya ba ni brtan pa rnam par mi g-yo ba ste ;
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba ni brtan pa rnam par mi g-yo ba ste ;
translated: The essence is the stable and unwavering.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o //🔽des ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba rgya mtsho lta bu gting dang mtha' med pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i snying dang snying po ni so sor thar pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o // des ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i 'dul ba rgya mtsho lta bu gting dang mtha' med pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i snying dang snying po ni so sor thar pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid
translated: Its definition is that it does not change into something else.🔽By this, the greatness of the Pratimoksha is taught by way of the statement:

original: brjod pa bstan to //
analyzed: brjod pa bstan to //
translated: “This is the heart and essence of the definition of all the ocean-like Vinaya taught by the Buddha, which is without bottom and without end.”

original: 'di ni dam chos rgyal po yi //🔽chos kun gyi ni 'dren pa mchog /'di ni dge slong tshong tshogs kyi //🔽bslab zong tshong khang chen po yin /
analyzed: 'di ni dam chos rgyal po yi // chos kun gyi ni 'dren pa mchog /'di ni dge slong tshong tshogs kyi // bslab zong tshong khang chen po yin /
translated: This is the king of the holy Dharma,🔽the supreme leader of all Dharmas. This is the great market place

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: of the merchandise of training for the assembly of monks.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
translated: This refers to the Pratimoksha.

original: dam chos rgyal po zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: dam chos rgyal po zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The king of the holy Dharma is the Lord Buddha,

original: thugs su chud pa dang ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs su chud pa dang ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has realized and taught it.

original: dam chos rgyal po de'i chos kun zhes bya ba ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dam chos rgyal po de'i chos kun zhes bya ba ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad do //
translated: The Dharmas of that king of the holy Dharma are all the Dharmas of Sutra and so forth.

original: chos de dag gi 'dren pa mchog / ces bya ba ni rgyal po'i blon po rin po che dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: chos de dag gi 'dren pa mchog / ces bya ba ni rgyal po'i blon po rin po che dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The best guide of those dharmas is the one called the precious minister of a king.

original: 'di la brten te de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la brten te de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise in dependence on it.

original: yang de nyid bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang de nyid bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, in order to specify that very [precept], he says, this, etc.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
translated: This is the pratimoksha.

original: dge slong tshong tshogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong mya ngan las 'das pa'i nor bu rin po che 'dod pa tshong pa lta bu'i tshogs don mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: dge slong tshong tshogs zhes bya ba ni dge slong mya ngan las 'das pa'i nor bu rin po che 'dod pa tshong pa lta bu'i tshogs don mthun pa dag go //
translated: The assembly of monks is the assembly of merchants who desire the jewel of nirvana.

original: de dag gi bslab zong zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i nor bu rin po che sgrub pa'i zong tshul khrims kyi nor /
analyzed: de dag gi bslab zong zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i nor bu rin po che sgrub pa'i zong tshul khrims kyi nor /
translated: The merchandise of their training is the wealth of morality, the merchandise for acquiring the jewel of nirvana.

original: de ni tshong khang zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i zong bcer ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: de ni tshong khang zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i zong bcer ba'i gnas te /
translated: That is the shop, the place where the merchandise of training is sold.

original: so sor thar pa'i nang du bslab pa thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i nang du bslab pa thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the trainings are included in the pratimoksha.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni bslab pa rin po che'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / chen po rnams la 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni bslab pa rin po che'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / chen po rnams la 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “great” is used because it is the basis of the precious training and because it is suitable for the great ones.

original: de dag gis ni chos kun gyi 'dren pa mchog yin pa dang / bslab pa'i zong gi tshong khang chen po yin pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa bstan to //🔽tshul khrims 'chal pas zin rnams @12a * //
analyzed: de dag gis ni chos kun gyi 'dren pa mchog yin pa dang / bslab pa'i zong gi tshong khang chen po yin pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa bstan to // tshul khrims 'chal pas zin rnams @12a * //
translated: These verses indicate the greatness of the discipline of individual liberation by showing that it is the supreme guide to all the teachings and that it is the great marketplace for the merchandise of the training.

original: kyi ; / gdug pa rnam sel sman 'di yin //🔽'di ni lang tsho rnam 'khrul pa'i //
analyzed: kyi ; / gdug pa rnam sel sman 'di yin // 'di ni lang tsho rnam 'khrul pa'i //
translated: This medicine removes the poison🔽of those who have been bitten by a snake.🔽This is the iron hook for the young

original: rkang gnyis gzhon nu'i lcags kyo yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rkang gnyis gzhon nu'i lcags kyo yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: of the two-legged species who are confused by youth.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa nyams pa lhag ma dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa nyams pa lhag ma dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The term “immoral” refers to those who have violated the training and still possess the remnants of their transgression.

original: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa nyid kyis sbrul chen po dug myur du khyab par byed pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa nyid kyis sbrul chen po dug myur du khyab par byed pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: They are like a great snake whose poison spreads quickly.

original: des zin pa zhes bya ba ni nyams par byas pa'o //
analyzed: des zin pa zhes bya ba ni nyams par byas pa'o //
translated: “Those who have been bitten by a snake” means those who have been injured by it.

original: des zin pa'i gang zag rnams kyi gdug pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ste sbrul gyi dug dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des zin pa'i gang zag rnams kyi gdug pa zhes bya ba ni ltung ba ste sbrul gyi dug dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The “poison” of those persons who are seized by it is a downfall, because it is like the poison of a snake.

original: rnam sel zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnon pa ste /
analyzed: rnam sel zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnon pa ste /
translated: “Elimination” is overcoming.

original: kun du spyod pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it eliminates the practice.

original: sman zhes bya ba ni gnod sel te /
analyzed: sman zhes bya ba ni gnod sel te /
translated: “Medicine” is a cure.

original: 'dis sbyong bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis sbyong bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it teaches purification.

original: de yang so sor thar pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa 'di yin te /
translated: Moreover, this is the Prātimokṣa.

original: des ni ltung ba rnam par sel ba'i rgyud nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ltung ba rnam par sel ba'i rgyud nyid du bstan to //
translated: Because it teaches the very cause of the elimination of downfalls.

original: yang de nyid bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de nyid bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach that very thing specifically,

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: he says, “This is the medicine,” etc.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
translated: “This” is the Prātimokṣa.

original: lang tsho zhes bya ba ni gzhon pa nyid do //
analyzed: lang tsho zhes bya ba ni gzhon pa nyid do //
translated: “Youth” is youthfulness.

original: rnam 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba ni bag med pa la sogs pas rnam par rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba ni bag med pa la sogs pas rnam par rmongs pa'o //
translated: “Delusion” is confusion due to heedlessness, etc.

original: rkang gnyis zhes bya ba ni mi'o //
analyzed: rkang gnyis zhes bya ba ni mi'o //
translated: “Two-legged being” is a human.

original: gzhon nu zhes bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu zhes bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: “Youth” is ignorance of what is to be done and what is not to be done.

original: lcags kyo zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i lcags kyo dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: lcags kyo zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i lcags kyo dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The hook is like an elephant hook,

original: bsnyil ba dang spo ba la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs ston pas kun du skrag par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyil ba dang spo ba la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs ston pas kun du skrag par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it frightens those who are difficult to train by showing the disadvantages of being drawn out and put back in.

original: des ni 'dul dka' ba rnams yang dag par sdom pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'dul dka' ba rnams yang dag par sdom pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is the cause of restraining those who are difficult to train.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gsum po de dag gis ni so sor thar pa la brtsam par byas na tshe 'di la 'bras bu de lta bu 'thob pas tshe 'di'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gsum po de dag gis ni so sor thar pa la brtsam par byas na tshe 'di la 'bras bu de lta bu 'thob pas tshe 'di'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, in these three verses, the greatness of the code of individual liberation is shown by the result in this life, since one who has begun the code of individual liberation obtains such a result in this life.

original: tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /🔽mtsho bas zab pa'i 'khor ba las ;
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / mtsho bas zab pa'i 'khor ba las ;
translated: The greatness of the code of individual liberation is shown by the result in the next life.

original: / sgrol ba'i rgal thabs 'di yin te //
analyzed: / sgrol ba'i rgal thabs 'di yin te //
translated: This is the raft for crossing the ocean of cyclic existence,

original: 'di ni bzang 'gror 'gro ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ni bzang 'gror 'gro ba yin //
translated: this is the path to good rebirth,

original: nges pa'i chu lon zam pa yin //
analyzed: nges pa'i chu lon zam pa yin //
translated: this is the bridge and dike for the waters of destiny.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the means of deliverance from cyclic existence.

original: mtsho bas zab pa'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho dug can pa bas kyang zab cing ches gting @12b slebs par dka' ba'i 'khor ba 'gro ba lnga'i 'jig rten no //
analyzed: mtsho bas zab pa'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho dug can pa bas kyang zab cing ches gting @12b slebs par dka' ba'i 'khor ba 'gro ba lnga'i 'jig rten no //
translated: The world of the five migrations is cyclic existence, deeper than the deepest ocean, more difficult to cross than the most difficult to cross.

original: 'khor ba de las sgrol ba'i rgal thabs zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba de las sgrol ba'i rgal thabs zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i lam ste /
translated: The means of deliverance from cyclic existence is the path to complete liberation.

original: zam pa dang gru dang gzings dang rkyal pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zam pa dang gru dang gzings dang rkyal pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a bridge, a boat, a raft, or a float.

original: de yang so sor thar pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa 'di yin te /
translated: And that is the code of monastic discipline.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag na lam skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag na lam skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the path arises when morality is pure.

original: des ni 'khor ba las sgrol zhing nges par legs pa'i lam 'thob pa'i thabs yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'khor ba las sgrol zhing nges par legs pa'i lam 'thob pa'i thabs yin par bstan to //
translated: It is the means of deliverance from cyclic existence and the attainment of the path of definite excellence.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar ba'o //🔽bzang 'gro zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro mtho ris te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar ba'o // bzang 'gro zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro mtho ris te /
translated: This is the code of monastic discipline.

original: lha dang mi'i 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i 'gro ba'o //
translated: Good destiny is the happy migratory states of the celestial and human worlds.

original: der 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni der 'jug cing 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: der 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni der 'jug cing 'thob pa'o //
translated: “Going there” means entering and attaining it.

original: des pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa gcig tu gyur pa gdon mi za ba'o //🔽chu lon zam pa zhes bya ba ni chu yang 'gog la rgyun sa'i zam par yang gyur pa ste /
analyzed: des pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa gcig tu gyur pa gdon mi za ba'o // chu lon zam pa zhes bya ba ni chu yang 'gog la rgyun sa'i zam par yang gyur pa ste /
translated: “ Steadfast” means that it is definitely one teaching.🔽“ Dam” means that it stops the water and is a bridge for the current.

original: ngan song gi chu bo yang 'gog la mtho ris su 'gro ba'i zam pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song gi chu bo yang 'gog la mtho ris su 'gro ba'i zam pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it stops the river of the lower realms and is a bridge for going to the higher realms.

original: de ni so sor thar pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ni so sor thar pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the pratimokṣa.

original: tshul khrims ni bde 'gro'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni bde 'gro'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because morality is the cause of happy rebirth.

original: des ni ngan song las grol zhing mngon par mtho pa'i lam thob pa'i thabs yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ngan song las grol zhing mngon par mtho pa'i lam thob pa'i thabs yin par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that it is the method for being liberated from the lower realms and attaining the path of high status.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs pham byed lam //🔽rgyal po yi ni 'dren pa mchog /'di ni thar pa'i grong 'jug pa'i //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs pham byed lam // rgyal po yi ni 'dren pa mchog /'di ni thar pa'i grong 'jug pa'i //
translated: This is the path for conquering the afflictions.🔽This is the supreme guide for the king.🔽This is like the foundation of the stairs

original: them skas gzhi dang 'dra bar gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: them skas gzhi dang 'dra bar gnas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: For entering the city of liberation.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
translated: “ This” refers to the pratimokṣa.

original: nyon mongs zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang khong khro ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang khong khro ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dag go //
translated: The so-called afflictions are the afflictions of passion, hostility, etc.

original: pham byed ces bya ba ni spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: pham byed ces bya ba ni spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The conqueror is the one who conquers them.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: lam ste / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: lam ste / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: The path, i.e., the eightfold noble path.

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa pham par byed pa'i lam de nyid rgyal po dang 'dra bas rgyal po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa pham par byed pa'i lam de nyid rgyal po dang 'dra bas rgyal po zhes bya ste /
translated: The king is the very path that conquers the afflictions, and is called king because it is like a king.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra pham par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra pham par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it conquers the enemy, the afflictions.

original: 'dren pa mchog ces bya ba ni rgyal po'i snying tshoms lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dren pa mchog ces bya ba ni rgyal po'i snying tshoms lta bu ste /
translated: The supreme leader is like the king’s minister.

original: 'dis 'phags pa'i lam 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'phags pa'i lam 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it leads the noble path.

original: des ni 'khor ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa spong zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu 'phags pa'i lam 'dren pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'khor ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa spong zhing mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu 'phags pa'i lam 'dren pa yin par bstan to //
translated: It has been shown that it abandons the afflictions, which are the cause of cyclic existence, and leads the noble path, which is the cause of nirvana.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o //
translated: This refers to the vow of individual liberation.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Liberation is nirvana.

original: grong zhes bya ba @13a * //
analyzed: grong zhes bya ba @13a * //
translated: The village is

original: ni thar ba de nyid grong khyer dang 'dra bas grong zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ni thar ba de nyid grong khyer dang 'dra bas grong zhes bya ba ste /
translated: liberation, because it is like a city.

original: 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from all violence.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: The entrance is going.

original: them skas gzhi zhes bya ba ni them skas kyi rten ma'o //🔽so sor thar pa 'di ni de dang 'dra bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: them skas gzhi zhes bya ba ni them skas kyi rten ma'o // so sor thar pa 'di ni de dang 'dra bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: The ground of the stairs is the support of the stairs.

original: lam gyi gzhi ni tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi gzhi ni tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is like that, because morality is the ground of the path.

original: des ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu 'phags pa'i lam gyi gzhi nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu 'phags pa'i lam gyi gzhi nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that morality is the ground of the noble path, the cause of attaining the fruit of nirvana.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po de dag gis ni so sor thar pa la brtsal ba byas na tshe phyi ma la 'bras bu de lta bu thob pas tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po de dag gis ni so sor thar pa la brtsal ba byas na tshe phyi ma la 'bras bu de lta bu thob pas tshe phyi ma'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, in these two verses, the greatness of the code of monkhood is shown from the point of view of its fruit in the next life, since one who has striven in the code of monkhood obtains such a fruit in the next life.

original: so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In terms of the greatness of the Pratimoksha itself, which is expressed by praising the Pratimoksha as if it were the Teacher.

original: da ni mya ngan 'das gyur na //
analyzed: da ni mya ngan 'das gyur na //
translated: Now, when you have attained nirvana,

original: 'di ni khyod kyi ston pa zhes //
analyzed: 'di ni khyod kyi ston pa zhes //
translated: this will be your teacher,

original: rang byung nyid kyis gus par bcas //
analyzed: rang byung nyid kyis gus par bcas //
translated: the self-arisen one, with respect,

original: nan tan dge slong tshogs mdun bstod //
analyzed: nan tan dge slong tshogs mdun bstod //
translated: will praise it in the assembly of earnest monks.

original: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: This is one verse.

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid do //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das nyid do //
translated: Now is the Bhagavat himself.

original: mya ngan 'das gyur na zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su'o //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das gyur na zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su'o //
translated: When you have attained nirvana is in the realm of nirvana without remainder of aggregates.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'o ;
translated: This is the Pratimoksha.

original: / khyod kyi zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi dge slong rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: / khyod kyi zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi dge slong rnams kyi'o //
translated: Yours is the monks of the Sravaka.

original: ston pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa dang 'dra'o zhes so //
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa dang 'dra'o zhes so //
translated: Teacher is like a teacher.

original: rang byung zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: rang byung zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Self-arisen is the Bhagavat.

original: gzhan gyi lung med par bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lung med par bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has attained unsurpassed knowledge without relying on the teachings of others.

original: nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi zhal nyid kyis so //
analyzed: nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi zhal nyid kyis so //
translated: “By himself” means by his own mouth.

original: gus bcas par zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa gtad de'o //
analyzed: gus bcas par zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa gtad de'o //
translated: “With respect” means with a special intention.

original: nan tan zhes bya ba ni lhur bzhes nas so //
analyzed: nan tan zhes bya ba ni lhur bzhes nas so //
translated: “Earnestly” means with great effort.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong ngo //
translated: “Bhikṣus” means fully ordained monks through the rite of four requests.

original: tshogs zhes bya ba ni mang po 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba ni mang po 'dus pa'o //
translated: “Assembly” means a gathering of many.

original: mdun zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o //
analyzed: mdun zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o //
translated: “In front” means in the presence of.

original: bstod ces bya ba ni ston pa dang 'dra'o zhes so //🔽des ni ston pa bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe na dge slong dag deng phyin chad bdag la ston pa med par 'gyur ro snyam du dgos pa bzlog pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das
analyzed: bstod ces bya ba ni ston pa dang 'dra'o zhes so // des ni ston pa bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe na dge slong dag deng phyin chad bdag la ston pa med par 'gyur ro snyam du dgos pa bzlog pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das
translated: “Praised” means he is like the Teacher.🔽This passage was spoken by the Bhagavān in order to prevent the monks from thinking, “From now on we will be without a teacher” when the Teacher Bhagavān had passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: @13b par gyur pa na /
analyzed: @13b par gyur pa na /
translated: “Bhikṣus, after I have passed into parinirvāṇa,

original: so sor thar pa 'di khyed la ston par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstod par mdzad nas so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa bstan to //
analyzed: so sor thar pa 'di khyed la ston par byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstod par mdzad nas so sor thar pa la ston pa dang 'dra bar bstod pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa bstan to //
translated: This Pratimoksha will teach you. Having praised it in this way, he has shown the greatness of the Pratimoksha by praising it as if it were the Teacher himself.

original: tshogs kyi lam dkon pas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam dkon pas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the path of accumulation, which is rare, he has stated two verses in order to make the path of accumulation fruitful:

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya'i sgra 'di yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya'i sgra 'di yang //
translated: This sound called Buddha

original: 'jig rten dag na rab tu dkon //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na rab tu dkon //
translated: is very rare in the world.

original: mi nyid shin tu rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: mi nyid shin tu rnyed par dka' //
translated: Human birth is very difficult to obtain,

original: rab tu byung ba shin tu dkon //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba shin tu dkon // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: and renunciation is extremely rare.

original: tshogs kyi lam zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam 'thob pa'i tshogs dang gzhir gyur pa'i lam rnam par bcu gsum ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam 'thob pa'i tshogs dang gzhir gyur pa'i lam rnam par bcu gsum ste /
translated: The so-called path of accumulation is the path of preparation, the path of purity, the basis for the accumulation of the thirteen aspects of the path.

original: gzhan gyi 'byor pa dang / bdag gi 'byor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'byor pa dang / bdag gi 'byor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang /
translated: the wealth of others, one's own wealth, the aspiration for virtuous qualities, the vow of moral discipline, the restraint of the sensory faculties, moderation in eating, the effort to be awake during the first and last parts of the night,

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge slong gi rgyan gang yin pa'o //🔽de la / sangs rgyas zhes bya'i sgra 'di yang //
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge slong gi rgyan gang yin pa'o // de la / sangs rgyas zhes bya'i sgra 'di yang //
translated: the practice of being watchful, the spiritual teacher, listening to and reflecting on the holy Dharma, the absence of obstacles, the increase of generosity, and the ornaments of a monk.

original: 'jig rten dag na rab tu dkon //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na rab tu dkon //
translated: The phrase, The sound of Buddha is rare in the world,

original: zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi 'byor pa dkon par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi 'byor pa dkon par bstan te /
translated: teaches the rarity of the wealth of others.

original: gzhan gyi 'byor pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'byor pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the wealth of others?

original: de ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / chos bstan pa rnams gnas pa dang / chos gnas pa rnams rjes su 'jug pa dang / gzhan gyi phyir rjes su snying brtse bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / chos bstan pa rnams gnas pa dang / chos gnas pa rnams rjes su 'jug pa dang / gzhan gyi phyir rjes su snying brtse bar byed pa'o //
translated: the appearance of the Buddhas, the teaching of the true Dharma, the duration of the true Dharma, the practice of the true Dharma, and the practice of compassion for others.

original: des ni tha na sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang 'jig rten na rab tu dkon na sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: des ni tha na sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang 'jig rten na rab tu dkon na sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: This shows that even the sound “Buddha” is rare in the world, much less the appearance of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dkon na dam pa'i chos ston pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dkon na dam pa'i chos ston pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
translated: If the appearance of the Buddhas is rare, how much more so is the teaching of the true Dharma, etc.?

original: mi nyid rnyed par shin tu dka' //
analyzed: mi nyid rnyed par shin tu dka' //
translated: It is very difficult to obtain human existence.

original: zhes bya bas ni bdag gi 'byor ba dkon par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bdag gi 'byor ba dkon par bstan te /
translated: This shows the rarity of the perfection of self-mastery.

original: bdag gi 'byor pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gi 'byor pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of self-mastery?

original: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: mir gyur pa dang / yul dbus su skyes pa dang / dbang po tshang ba dang / gnas la @14a * //
analyzed: mir gyur pa dang / yul dbus su skyes pa dang / dbang po tshang ba dang / gnas la @14a * //
translated: human existence, birth in a central land, complete sensory faculties, confidence in the words of the Buddha, and the ability to practice pure actions.

original: dad pa dang / las kyi mtha' ma log pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / las kyi mtha' ma log pa'o //
translated: faith, and not having perverted actions.

original: des ni mir gyur pa nyid kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' na yul dbus su skyes pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mir gyur pa nyid kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' na yul dbus su skyes pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is very difficult to attain even human birth, much less birth in a central land, etc.

original: rab tu byung ba shin tu dkon //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba shin tu dkon //
translated: “It is very rare to go forth.”

original: zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dkon pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dkon pa ste /
translated: This shows the rarity of the aspiration for virtuous qualities.

original: dge ba'i chos la mdun pa gang zhe na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la mdun pa gang zhe na / de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: What is the aspiration for virtuous qualities?

original: de'i nyan thos dag las chos thos shing dad pa thob par gyur la dad pa thob nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung zhing nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar yang dag par slob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nyan thos dag las chos thos shing dad pa thob par gyur la dad pa thob nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung zhing nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar yang dag par slob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the aspiration to hear the Dharma from the Tathāgatas or their disciples, to attain faith, and having attained faith, to go forth from home to homelessness and practice it.

original: des ni chos thos shing dad pa thob pa yang shin tu dkon na rab tu 'byung zhing nan tan gyis sgrub par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni chos thos shing dad pa thob pa yang shin tu dkon na rab tu 'byung zhing nan tan gyis sgrub par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is very rare to hear the Dharma and attain faith, much less to go forth and practice it.

original: de bzhin rab tu byung rnams kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin rab tu byung rnams kyi //
translated: “It is very rare for those who have gone forth

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs rab dkon //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs rab dkon //
translated: The perfection of morality is very rare.

original: zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid dkon par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid dkon par bstan te /
translated: This shows the rarity of the vow of morality, the restraint of the sense faculties, the knowledge of the proper amount of food, the effort to apply oneself to the first and last periods of the night and not to sleep, and the practice of being aware.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the vow of morality?

original: rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug ste /
translated: It is of six kinds:

original: rnam par dbye ba dang / bsdu ba dang / phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam grangs dang / rnam par dag pa dang / phan yon no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba dang / bsdu ba dang / phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam grangs dang / rnam par dag pa dang / phan yon no //
translated: analysis, inclusion, perfection, synonyms, purification, and benefits.

original: de la rnam par dbye ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par dbye ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Analysis is of six kinds:

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: It is to maintain discipline, to be restrained by the vows of individual liberation, to have perfect ritual, to have perfect conduct, to see danger even in the slightest transgression,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob pa'o //
translated: and to train in the precepts that one has taken up.

original: bsdu ba ni rnam pa gsum du bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba ni rnam pa gsum du bsdu ba ste /
translated: It is to be included in the three kinds of collections:

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i tshul khrims dang tshul khrims bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i tshul khrims dang tshul khrims bsgom pa'o //
translated: the collection of the taking up of discipline, the collection of the discipline of deliverance, and the collection of the cultivation of discipline.

original: phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bcus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bcus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: It is to be perfect through ten kinds of perfections:

original: dang po nyid nas legs par blangs pa dang / ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa dang / ha cang thal ches pa ma yin pa dang / bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis yongs su zin pa dang / yang dag par sdom pa dang /
analyzed: dang po nyid nas legs par blangs pa dang / ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa dang / ha cang thal ches pa ma yin pa dang / bag yod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyis yongs su zin pa dang / yang dag par sdom pa dang /
translated: to take it up well from the beginning, not to be too lax, not to be too strict, to be conscientious, to be sustained by effort, to be perfectly restrained,

original: cho ga ma nyams pas @14b yongs su zin pa dang / 'tsho ba ma nyams pas yongs su zin pa dang / mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba dang / nges par byung ba dang / yang dag par blangs pa yongs su ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga ma nyams pas @14b yongs su zin pa dang / 'tsho ba ma nyams pas yongs su zin pa dang / mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba dang / nges par byung ba dang / yang dag par blangs pa yongs su ma nyams pa'o //
translated: It is also accompanied by the absence of loss of the rite, accompanied by the absence of loss of livelihood, not fallen into either extreme, gone forth, and not lost the acceptance.

original: rnam grangs ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The synonyms are sixfold:

original: la lar tshul khrims rtsa ba'i don du gsungs pa dang / la lar rgyan dang / la lar byug pa dang / la lar spes dang / la lar legs par spyad pa dang / la lar sdom pa'i sgra gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: la lar tshul khrims rtsa ba'i don du gsungs pa dang / la lar rgyan dang / la lar byug pa dang / la lar spes dang / la lar legs par spyad pa dang / la lar sdom pa'i sgra gsungs pa'o //
translated: in some places morality is taught as the root, in some places as an ornament, in some places as an ointment, in some places as a flower, in some places as good conduct, and in some places as the sound of restraint.

original: rnam par dag ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The purification is threefold:

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa de yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir lus kyi las la so sor rtogs par byed pa dang / ngag gi las la so sor rtog par byed pa dang / yid kyi las la so sor rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa de yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir lus kyi las la so sor rtogs par byed pa dang / ngag gi las la so sor rtog par byed pa dang / yid kyi las la so sor rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: one examines the action of body, one examines the action of speech, and one examines the action of mind, in order to purify that restraint of morality.

original: phan yon ni tshul khrims kyi phan yon rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: phan yon ni tshul khrims kyi phan yon rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: The benefits are the ten benefits of morality:

original: 'gyod pa med par rim gyis mchog tu dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i chos thob par 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / phyogs bcur snyan pa'i bsgrags par 'gyur ba dang / bde bar gnyid kyis log cing bde bar sad par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'gyod pa med par rim gyis mchog tu dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i chos thob par 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba dang / phyogs bcur snyan pa'i bsgrags par 'gyur ba dang / bde bar gnyid kyis log cing bde bar sad par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will gradually attain the Dharma preceded by supreme joy without regret, they will die without regret, they will be renowned in the ten directions, they will sleep happily and wake happily,

original: gnyid log pa na lha rnams srung bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan las sdig pa'i bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / dngang ba med par 'gyur ba dang / dgra bo rnams kyis glags shig rnyed na yang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis de dag srung ba la sogs pa phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gnyid log pa na lha rnams srung bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan las sdig pa'i bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / dngang ba med par 'gyur ba dang / dgra bo rnams kyis glags shig rnyed na yang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis de dag srung ba la sogs pa phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: they will be protected by the gods when they sleep, they will not be afraid of or apprehensive about any misdeeds, and even if enemies find an opportunity, they will be protected and so forth due to the power of pure ethics.

original: gnod sbyin dang mi ma yin pa gdug pa gnyug mar gnas pa rnams kyis glags shig rnyed na yang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis de dag bsrung ba la sogs pas phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan la chos gso la sogs pa dag chos kyis tshegs chung dus 'grub par 'gyur ba dang /🔽gang du skye bar 'dod pa la sogs pa'i smon lam thams cad yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang mi ma yin pa gdug pa gnyug mar gnas pa rnams kyis glags shig rnyed na yang tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis de dag bsrung ba la sogs pas phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan la chos gso la sogs pa dag chos kyis tshegs chung dus 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / gang du skye bar 'dod pa la sogs pa'i smon lam thams cad yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And, by the Dharma, such as teaching the Dharma to others, one will easily accomplish whatever one wishes, such as being reborn in a pure land.

original: dbang po sdom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is restraint of the faculties?

original: de tshul khrims kyi sdom pa de nyid la brten nas dran pa kun du srung ba dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang / dran pas yid kun du srung ba dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi sdom pa de nyid la brten nas dran pa kun du srung ba dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang / dran pas yid kun du srung ba dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed cing /
translated: Relying on that very restraint of morality, one guards mindfulness, is diligent in mindfulness, protects the mind with mindfulness, and places it in an even state.🔽One does not look at forms with the eye,

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus @15a * //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus @15a * //
translated: does not listen to sounds with the ear,🔽does not smell scents with the nose,🔽does not taste flavors with the tongue,🔽does not touch touchables with the body,🔽and does not think of dharmas with the mind.

original: dang ; yid kyi gzugs dang / skra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams rnam par shes pa na yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: dang ; yid kyi gzugs dang / skra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams rnam par shes pa na yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la /
translated: When he experiences forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena with his eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind, he does not grasp at their signs or make distinctions based on them.

original: gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba de dag bsdam par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed cing dbang po rnams kyang srung bar byed la dbang po rnams kyis kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pas
analyzed: gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba de dag bsdam par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed cing dbang po rnams kyang srung bar byed la dbang po rnams kyis kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pas
translated: He practices to restrain the faculties so that the mental afflictions of nonvirtue and unwholesome factors do not arise in his mind. He guards the faculties and practices restraint with the faculties.

original: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa yin no //
translated: He is one who restrains the doors of the faculties.

original: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is moderation in eating?

original: de ltar dbang po bsdams pa de so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin /🔽rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po bsdams pa de so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin / rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: The one who restrains the faculties eats food after examination, not for fun,🔽not for enjoyment,

original: sgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: sgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for physical beauty or attractiveness,

original: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi lus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya ba dang / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par bya ba dang / tshor pa rnying pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi lus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya ba dang / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par bya ba dang / tshor pa rnying pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: It is not for the sake of adornment, but for the sake of maintaining this body, for the sake of nourishing it, for the sake of serving life, for the sake of living a spiritual life, for the sake of removing old feelings,

original: gsar pa rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na mtho ba med pa dang bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing zas za ba yin no //
analyzed: gsar pa rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na mtho ba med pa dang bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing zas za ba yin no //
translated: for the sake of not producing new feelings, and for the sake of remaining in a state of ease, without fault and without affliction.

original: nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: “What is it to be devoted to the first part of the night and the last part of the night, and not to be lazy?

original: de ltar zas kyi tshod rig pa de nyid mtshan mo 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar zas kyi tshod rig pa de nyid mtshan mo 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: “Having understood the right amount of food, he purifies his mind from obstructive states by walking and sitting and by properly applying vigilance.

original: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed la /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed la /
translated: In the first part of the night, he purifies his mind from the obscurations of walking and sitting.

original: mtshan mo'i gung thun la gtsug lag khang nas phyir byung ste gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas gtsug lag khang gi nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i gung thun la gtsug lag khang nas phyir byung ste gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas gtsug lag khang gi nang du zhugs te /
translated: In the middle part of the night, he gets up from his seat, washes his feet outside the monastery, and then enters the monastery.🔽He lies down on his right side, placing one foot on top of the other, and goes to sleep mindful and clearly aware, with a mind full of thoughts of light.

original: glo g-yas pa phab ste rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du gzhag ste snang ba'i 'du shes dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du nyal bar byed pa dang / mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la yang myur ba myur ba kho nar sad par byas nas 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: glo g-yas pa phab ste rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du gzhag ste snang ba'i 'du shes dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du nyal bar byed pa dang / mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la yang myur ba myur ba kho nar sad par byas nas 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In the last part of the night, he gets up immediately and purifies his mind from the obscurations of walking and sitting.

original: shes bzhin du @15b spyod pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes bzhin du @15b spyod pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of being watchful?

original: de ltar mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par gyur pa de 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa dang / chung zad bltas pa dang / rnam par bltas pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par gyur pa de 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa dang / chung zad bltas pa dang / rnam par bltas pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang /
translated: Thus, after applying oneself to not sleeping, one should practice with mindfulness in going and returning, in looking straight ahead and in looking all around, in bending and in stretching,

original: snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed bcangs pa dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa dang / song ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang /
analyzed: snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed bcangs pa dang / zos pa dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa dang / song ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang /
translated: in wearing the lower and upper robes, in carrying the alms bowl, in eating, drinking, consuming, and tasting, in going, standing, sitting, lying down, not lying down,

original: smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyis snyom pa bsang ba la yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyis snyom pa bsang ba la yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin no //
translated: in speaking and in not speaking, and in dispelling drowsiness.

original: de nas ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang rab tu dkon na dbang po sdom pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nas ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang rab tu dkon na dbang po sdom pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
translated: Then, it is taught that if the vow of morality is difficult to maintain, what need is there to mention the vow of the sense faculties?

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag gyur kyang //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag gyur kyang //
translated: Even if one’s morality is pure,

original: grogs bzang shin tu rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: grogs bzang shin tu rnyed par dka' //
translated: It is very difficult to find a good friend.

original: zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan dkon par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan dkon par bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the rarity of a spiritual teacher, listening to and reflecting on the holy Dharma, freedom from obstacles, increasing generosity, and the ornament of the spiritual life.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is a spiritual teacher?

original: rgyu rnam pa brgyad kyis na rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa brgyad kyis na rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: He is to be known as a spiritual teacher who is complete in every way by means of eight causes.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / rtog pa dang ldan pa dang / rjes su snying brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / rtog pa dang ldan pa dang / rjes su snying brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: He is one who is established in morality, who is learned, who is intelligent, who is compassionate, who is indefatigable, who is patient, who is fearless,

original: tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi bya ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: and who is eloquent.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is listening to and reflecting on the holy Dharma?

original: dam pa sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis sde snod gsum gyis bsdus pa dag 'dzin cing tshig 'bru dang don nyan pa dang / gcig tu dben par song ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas rnams spangs nas ji skad thos pa de dag nyid rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bgrang ba'i rnam pas chos rnams la bgrang ba'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dam pa sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis sde snod gsum gyis bsdus pa dag 'dzin cing tshig 'bru dang don nyan pa dang / gcig tu dben par song ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas rnams spangs nas ji skad thos pa de dag nyid rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bgrang ba'i rnam pas chos rnams la bgrang ba'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa dang /
translated: Having gone to a solitary place and abandoned inconceivable topics, they reflect on those very things they have heard by way of counting, through the general and specific characteristics of phenomena, by way of counting.

original: gzhal ba'i rnam par rigs pas yon tan dang / skyon nye bar brtag pa'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa yin no //🔽bar chad med pa gang @16a * //
analyzed: gzhal ba'i rnam par rigs pas yon tan dang / skyon nye bar brtag pa'i tshul gyis sems par byed pa yin no // bar chad med pa gang @16a * //
translated: They reflect by way of investigating the good qualities and faults through the reasoning of evaluation.🔽What is uninterrupted?

original: zhe na / nang la brten pa'i bar chad dang / phyi rol la brten pa'i bar chad med pa ste /
analyzed: zhe na / nang la brten pa'i bar chad dang / phyi rol la brten pa'i bar chad med pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of internal and external obstacles.

original: de la nang la brten pa'i bar chad ni sngon bsod nams ma byas pa'i phyir 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du 'bab ba dag dus dus su rnyed par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug shas che zhing yun ring ba dang /
analyzed: de la nang la brten pa'i bar chad ni sngon bsod nams ma byas pa'i phyir 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du 'bab ba dag dus dus su rnyed par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug shas che zhing yun ring ba dang /
translated: You will have a lot of illness because in the past you created karma to have a lot of illness.🔽You will have a lot of illness because in the past you created karma to have a lot of illness.🔽You will have a lot of illness because in the past you created karma to have a lot of illness.🔽You will have a lot of illness because in the past you created karma to have a lot of illness.🔽You will have a lot of illness because in the past you created karma to have a lot of illness.
