original: bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / bag med pa dang / yul ngan par skyes pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: bdag nyid rab tu 'dzin pa dang / mi brtan pa dang / bag med pa dang / yul ngan par skyes pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: being inattentive, being careless, being born in a bad place, and being like that.

original: phyi rol la brten pa'i bar chad ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten cing /
analyzed: phyi rol la brten pa'i bar chad ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten cing /
translated: External obstacles are not relying on holy people,

original: de las rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa dus dus su mi 'thob pa dang / yul ngan par gnas pas nyin mo mi sdug pa mang ba dang / mtshan mo skye bo mang po rtag tu sgra 'byin cing ca co mang la klag cor che ba dang /
analyzed: de las rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa dus dus su mi 'thob pa dang / yul ngan par gnas pas nyin mo mi sdug pa mang ba dang / mtshan mo skye bo mang po rtag tu sgra 'byin cing ca co mang la klag cor che ba dang /
translated: not obtaining timely instructions and teachings from them, living in a bad place, being distracted by many unpleasant things during the day, and at night being distracted by the sounds of many people talking, laughing, and so on.

original: rlung dang nyi ma'i reg pa grang zhing tsha ba dang / mi dang mi ma yin pas 'jigs pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: rlung dang nyi ma'i reg pa grang zhing tsha ba dang / mi dang mi ma yin pas 'jigs pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: The touch of wind and sun is cold or hot, and there is fear of humans and non-humans.

original: gzhan yang bar chad rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bar chad rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are also three other kinds of obstacles:

original: sbyor ba'i bar chad dang / rab tu dben pa'i bar chad dang / nang du yang dag 'jog gi bar chad dag med pa ni bar chad med pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bar chad dang / rab tu dben pa'i bar chad dang / nang du yang dag 'jog gi bar chad dag med pa ni bar chad med pa yin no //
translated: It is the absence of obstacles to generosity, obstacles to solitude, and obstacles to concentration.

original: gtong ba spel ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtong ba spel ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the development of generosity?

original: sems kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi yo byad dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i spyin pa sbyin par byed pa ste /🔽de yang sus sbyin par byed /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi yo byad dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa'i spyin pa sbyin par byed pa ste / de yang sus sbyin par byed /
translated: It is the giving of gifts without offense, in order to have the adornment of mind, the equipment of mind, the accumulation of spiritual practice, and the attainment of the highest goal.🔽By whom is it given?

original: su la sbyin par byed /
analyzed: su la sbyin par byed /
translated: To whom is it given?

original: ci zhig sbyin par byed /🔽cis sbyin par byed /
analyzed: ci zhig sbyin par byed / cis sbyin par byed /
translated: What is given?

original: ci ltar sbyin par byed /
analyzed: ci ltar sbyin par byed /
translated: How is it given?

original: ci'i phyir sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyin par byed cing /
translated: Why is it given?

original: gang gis de'i sbyin pa kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de'i sbyin pa kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what is the generosity of the bodhisattva made irreproachable?

original: sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag gis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag gis sbyin par byed do //
translated: It is given by the giver and the patron.

original: su la @16b sbyin par byed ce na bzhi la ste /
analyzed: su la @16b sbyin par byed ce na bzhi la ste /
translated: To whom is it given? It is given to four kinds of persons:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / sdug pa dang / khyad par can la sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / sdug pa dang / khyad par can la sbyin par byed do //
translated: One gives to those who are suffering, those who are helpful, those who are loved, and those who are exceptional.

original: ci zhig sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: What does one give?

original: sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po sbyin par byed do //
translated: One gives things that are sentient beings and things that are not sentient beings.

original: cis sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: cis sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: By what means does one give?

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las chags pa med pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa gang yin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtang bar bya ba'i phyir rang gi rgyud dang gzhan gyi rgyud la des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las gang yin pa des sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las chags pa med pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa gang yin pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po yongs su gtang bar bya ba'i phyir rang gi rgyud dang gzhan gyi rgyud la des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las gang yin pa des sbyin par byed do //
translated: By the mental activity of the mind, which is associated with non-attachment, and by the actions of body and speech that are motivated by that, in order to give up the things that are to be given, in one's own stream of being and in the stream of being of others.

original: ji ltar sbyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin par byed ce na /
translated: In what way does one give?

original: ma 'ongs pa la lta ba dang / 'bras bu mthong ba'i dad pas sbyin bar byed pa dang / 'dud pa'i sems kyis gus par sbyin par byed pa dang / brnyas pa med par rang gi lag nas sbyin par byed pa dang / gzhan la mkho ba'i dus su sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la lta ba dang / 'bras bu mthong ba'i dad pas sbyin bar byed pa dang / 'dud pa'i sems kyis gus par sbyin par byed pa dang / brnyas pa med par rang gi lag nas sbyin par byed pa dang / gzhan la mkho ba'i dus su sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: They give with a view to the future, with a view to the result, with a view to seeing the effect of their generosity. They give with a respectful attitude, with their own hands, without contempt. They give at the right time, when others need them.

original: chos dang mthun pa dang / gzu lums ma yin par legs pa bsgrubs te /
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa dang / gzu lums ma yin par legs pa bsgrubs te /
translated: They give in accordance with the Dharma, without violence, after having properly produced it.

original: gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin par byed pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bzang po dang / dam pa dang / rung ba sbyin par byed pa dang / ser sna'i dri ma dang gsog 'jog gi dri ma bsal te sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin par byed pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bzang po dang / dam pa dang / rung ba sbyin par byed pa dang / ser sna'i dri ma dang gsog 'jog gi dri ma bsal te sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: They give pure things, good things, excellent things, suitable things, after having removed the stains of stinginess and the stains of hoarding.

original: sbyin pa'i snga rol du yang yid dga' ba la sbyin pa'i tshe na yang rab tu dang bar byed cing byin nas kyang 'gyod pa med par 'gyur ba de ltar sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i snga rol du yang yid dga' ba la sbyin pa'i tshe na yang rab tu dang bar byed cing byin nas kyang 'gyod pa med par 'gyur ba de ltar sbyin par byed do //
translated: They give with a joyful mind before giving, with a clear mind while giving, and without regret after giving.

original: ci'i phyir spyin par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir spyin par byed ce na /
translated: Why does one give?

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje ba'i phyir dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams la byas pa gzo ba'i phyir dang / sdug pa rnams la byams pa dang gus pa dang gcugs pa'i phyir dang / khyad par can rnams la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i khyad par 'dod pa'i phyir sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje ba'i phyir dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams la byas pa gzo ba'i phyir dang / sdug pa rnams la byams pa dang gus pa dang gcugs pa'i phyir dang / khyad par can rnams la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i khyad par 'dod pa'i phyir sbyin par byed do //
translated: One gives out of compassion for the suffering, out of gratitude to benefactors, out of love, respect, and affection for dear ones, and out of desire for the special mundane and transcendental qualities of the holy.

original: gang gis de'i sbyin pa kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de'i sbyin pa kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does one give without reproach?🔽One gives to householders or renunciates in these ways,

original: de sems kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi yo byad dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa de dag gis khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba dag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na sbyin pa de ni kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de sems kyi rgyan dang / sems kyi yo byad dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa de dag gis khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba dag la sbyin pa sbyin par byed na sbyin pa de ni kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: in order to ornament the mind, to have the mind well-provided, to gather the equipment of yoga, and to attain the highest goal.

original: de ni gtong ba spel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gtong ba spel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “increasing generosity.”

original: dge sbyong gi rgyan gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi rgyan gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ornament of the spiritual practitioner?

original: mdor @17a * //
analyzed: mdor @17a * //
translated: In brief,

original: bsdu na rnam pa bcu bdun te /
analyzed: bsdu na rnam pa bcu bdun te /
translated: it is seventeenfold.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / nad nyung ba dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i rang bzhin can dang / shes rab rno ba dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / nad nyung ba dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i rang bzhin can dang / shes rab rno ba dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang /
translated: It is having faith, being without deceit, having few afflictions, being naturally energetic, having sharp wisdom, having few desires, being content, being easy to nourish, being easy to please,

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mdzes pa dang / drod rig pa dang / skyes bu dam pa'i chos dang ldan pa dang / mkhas pa'i rtags dang ldan pa dang / bzod pa che ba dang / des pa dang / gya nom pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / mdzes pa dang / drod rig pa dang / skyes bu dam pa'i chos dang ldan pa dang / mkhas pa'i rtags dang ldan pa dang / bzod pa che ba dang / des pa dang / gya nom pa yin no //
translated: having the ascetic qualities, being attractive, being warm-hearted, having the qualities of a holy person, having the marks of a wise person, being very patient, being gentle, and being refined.

original: des ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang shin tu rnyed par dka' na dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang shin tu rnyed par dka' na dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa la sogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that if it is very difficult to find a spiritual friend, what need is there to mention listening to the holy Dharma, reflecting on it, and so forth?

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po de dag gis ni tshogs kyi lam dkon pas de 'bras bu dang bcas par bya dgos pa'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba bstan to ;
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po de dag gis ni tshogs kyi lam dkon pas de 'bras bu dang bcas par bya dgos pa'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba bstan to ;
translated: Thus, these two verses show the path of accumulation together with its result, from the point of view of the necessity of endowing the path of accumulation with its result.

original: / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: / tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Having obtained the path of accumulation, one should endow the path of accumulation with its result.🔽With this in mind, he says:

original: 'jig rten sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang // mi dang rab tu byung ba dang // tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang // grogs bzang rnyed dka' rnyed gyur na //
analyzed: 'jig rten sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang // mi dang rab tu byung ba dang // tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang // grogs bzang rnyed dka' rnyed gyur na //
translated: When the world has a buddha, when one is a human, when one is ordained, when one has perfect morality, when one has found the good friend, having found what is difficult to find,

original: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: he says this one verse.

original: 'jig rten sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang // zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi 'byor pa rnyed pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang // zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi 'byor pa rnyed pa bstan to //
translated: The line “when the world has a buddha” shows the acquisition of the prosperity of others.

original: mi dang zhes bya bas ni bdag gi 'byor pa rnyed pa bstan to //
analyzed: mi dang zhes bya bas ni bdag gi 'byor pa rnyed pa bstan to //
translated: The line “when one is a human” shows the acquisition of one’s own prosperity.

original: rab tu byung ba dang zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa rnyed pa bstan to //🔽tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang // zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang po'i sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa rnyed pa bstan to // tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang // zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa dang / dbang po'i sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang /
translated: “Having gone forth” shows the acquisition of the aspiration for virtuous qualities.🔽“Having attained perfect morality” shows the acquisition of the vow of morality, the vow of the sense organs, the knowledge of the proper amount of food, the practice of not sleeping in the first or last part of the night,

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid rnyed pa bstan to //
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid rnyed pa bstan to //
translated: and the practice of acting with vigilance.

original: grogs bzang rnyed dka' rnyed gyur nas //
analyzed: grogs bzang rnyed dka' rnyed gyur nas //
translated: “Having found a good friend, so hard to find,”

original: zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan rnyed pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa dang / bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan rnyed pa bstan to //
translated: shows the acquisition of a spiritual teacher, listening to the true Dharma, reflection, freedom from obstacles, the increase of generosity, and the ornament of the spiritual practitioner.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig po des ni tshogs kyi @17b lam rnyed pas de'i 'bras bu dang bcas par bya dgos pa'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig po des ni tshogs kyi @17b lam rnyed pas de'i 'bras bu dang bcas par bya dgos pa'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, by this single verse, the path of accumulation is taught together with its result, in terms of the necessity of attaining the path of accumulation and its result.

original: tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan bya ba'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan bya ba'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In terms of the necessity of attaining the path of accumulation and its result, in terms of the necessity of making effort after attaining the path of accumulation,

original: mkhas pa bdag la legs 'dod cing //
analyzed: mkhas pa bdag la legs 'dod cing //
translated: the wise who desire what is good for themselves

original: de dag 'bras bcas byed 'dod pa //🔽sdom brtson rnams kyis so sor thar //
analyzed: de dag 'bras bcas byed 'dod pa // sdom brtson rnams kyis so sor thar //
translated: and wish to make that fruitful🔽should strive to listen to the pratimoksha

original: mnyan pa'i phyir ni 'bad bar bya //
analyzed: mnyan pa'i phyir ni 'bad bar bya //
translated: in order to uphold it.

original: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in a single verse.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'i rtags dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pa'i rtags dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The wise are endowed with the signs of wisdom:

original: lus kyis legs par bya ba byad pa dang / ngag gis legs par smra ba brjod pa dang / yid kyis legs par bsam pa sems pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis legs par bya ba byad pa dang / ngag gis legs par smra ba brjod pa dang / yid kyis legs par bsam pa sems pa'o //
translated: they do good with the body, speak well with the speech, and think well with the mind.

original: bdag la legs 'dod cing zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag la legs 'dod cing zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who desire what is good for themselves means those who are wise.

original: de dag 'bras bcas byed 'dod pa //🔽zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi lam de dag 'bras bu dang bcas par byed 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag 'bras bcas byed 'dod pa // zhes bya ba ni tshogs kyi lam de dag 'bras bu dang bcas par byed 'dod pa ste /
translated: They desire to make it fruitful.

original: sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam thob par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam dang rnam par dag pa'i lam thob par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They desire to make the path of accumulation fruitful by obtaining the path of preparation and the path of pure universal responsibility.

original: sdom brtson rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sdom brtson rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who are diligent in the vows means those who are ordained.

original: de rnams kyis so sor thar pa mnyan pa'i phyir 'bad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis so sor thar pa mnyan pa'i phyir 'bad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: They should strive to listen to the Pratimoksha.

original: thos pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / bsgrub pa la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thos pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / bsgrub pa la 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means they should strive to hear it, to retain it, to understand it, and to practice it.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig po des ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan bya ba'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig po des ni tshogs kyi lam rnyed pas nan tan bya ba'i sgo nas tshogs kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bya ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, by this single verse, the path of accumulation is shown to be fruitful by the practice of one who has attained it.

original: bdag gi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the accomplishment of the prātimokṣa vows from the perspective of the self, he says:

original: dge slong dbang dul kun dbang po //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong dbang dul kun dbang po // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The monk who has controlled the senses and is fully in control of his faculties.

original: dbang dul zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga po dag bsrungs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang dul zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga po dag bsrungs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “who has controlled the senses” means that the five faculties such as the eyes are guarded.

original: mig gis gzugs mthong na mtshan mar mi 'dzin mngon rtags su mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong na mtshan mar mi 'dzin mngon rtags su mi 'dzin cing /
translated: When the eyes see a form, they do not grasp at its signs or grasp at its details.

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro bar mi 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: They do not become attached or hostile.

original: kun dbang po zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: kun dbang po zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog pa ste /
translated: The phrase “is fully in control of his faculties” means that he is in a state of equanimity.

original: dbang po dang / dmigs pa dang / yul dang / dus dang / gang zag la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad la dbang po dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang / dmigs pa dang / yul dang / dus dang / gang zag la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad la dbang po dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: He controls his faculties in all situations, such as with regard to the faculties, the objects, the objects of the senses, time, and persons.

original: des ni bdag nyid kyi @18a * //
analyzed: des ni bdag nyid kyi @18a * //
translated: This verse shows that the monk who has controlled his faculties is a suitable vessel for the vows of individual liberation.

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams par byed pa ni bdag nyid la brten te ngo tsha shes pa skye ba'i sgo nas bdag gi dbang du byas te so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba bstan to
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams par byed pa ni bdag nyid la brten te ngo tsha shes pa skye ba'i sgo nas bdag gi dbang du byas te so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba bstan to
translated: The training of individual liberation is taught in terms of oneself.

original: // gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the training of individual liberation in terms of others, he said:

original: sangs rgyas mi 'gyur rab byung ba //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi 'gyur rab byung ba // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “One does not become a Buddha by going forth for the sake of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas zhes smos pa ni sangs rgyas las sam sangs rgyas kyi phyir rab tu byung ba zhes bya bar spyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes smos pa ni sangs rgyas las sam sangs rgyas kyi phyir rab tu byung ba zhes bya bar spyar ro //
translated: “One does not become a Buddha” means that one does not become a Buddha by going forth for the sake of the Buddha, or for the sake of the Buddha.

original: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nges shing 'khrul pa med pa ste /🔽bu lon gyis 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nges shing 'khrul pa med pa ste / bu lon gyis 'jigs pa'am /
translated: “One does not become a Buddha” means that it is certain and without error.🔽One does not become a Buddha out of fear of debt,

original: 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs pa'am /
translated: out of fear of livelihood,

original: rgyal pos 'jigs pa la sogs pas rab tu byung ba ma yin gyi tshul khrims dang po nyid nas yang dag par blangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal pos 'jigs pa la sogs pas rab tu byung ba ma yin gyi tshul khrims dang po nyid nas yang dag par blangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The king is not a renunciate due to fear, etc., but due to possessing the virtues of the precepts from the very beginning.

original: rab byung ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs te mgo bregs pa'o //
analyzed: rab byung ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol las legs par yang dag par blangs te mgo bregs pa'o //
translated: Renunciate means that one has properly taken up the precepts from another and shaved one's head.🔽Since one has properly taken up the precepts from another, when one violates the precepts of a monk, one should practice the prātimokṣa by relying on another, through the arising of shame.

original: des ni pha rol las sems legs par yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams par byed pa na pha rol la brten te khrel yod pa skye ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyi dbang du byas te so sor thar pa bsgrub par🔽bya ba bstan to ;
analyzed: des ni pha rol las sems legs par yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams par byed pa na pha rol la brten te khrel yod pa skye ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyi dbang du byas te so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba bstan to ;
translated: This teaches that one should practice the prātimokṣa by relying on another.

original: / chos kyi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / chos kyi dbang du byas nas so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the practice of the prātimokṣa by relying on the Dharma, it is said:

original: nges par thar pa 'dod rnams kyis //
analyzed: nges par thar pa 'dod rnams kyis //
translated: Those who desire liberation

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: should always rely on the Dharma.

original: nges par thar pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan ldas 'das pa ste /
analyzed: nges par thar pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan ldas 'das pa ste /
translated: Liberation means nirvāṇa.

original: sdug bsngal gtan spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gtan spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the abandonment of suffering.

original: 'dod rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'dod rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba rnams kyis so //
translated: By desires is meant by those who seek.🔽Since it restores what has been lost, it is the Dharma that is meant.

original: des ni nyams par gyur na phyir gso bar byed pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams pas na 'gyod pa med pa'i sgo nas chos kyi dbang du byas te /🔽so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: des ni nyams par gyur na phyir gso bar byed pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims rnams las bslab pa nyams pas na 'gyod pa med pa'i sgo nas chos kyi dbang du byas te / so sor thar pa bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The observance of the pratimoksa is taught by way of the absence of regret, because of the loss of training in morality by monks.

original: bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir //🔽so sor thar pa rtag tu bsrungs //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so sor thar pa bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir // so sor thar pa rtag tu bsrungs //
translated: The observance of the pratimoksa is taught by the characteristic of practice.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The observance of the pratimoksa is always protected.

original: rtag tu bsrungs zhes bya ba ni thog ma nyid nas nyams par mi 'gyur bar gus pa skyed cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag tu bsrungs zhes bya ba ni thog ma nyid nas nyams par mi 'gyur bar gus pa skyed cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Always protected means with respect, in the sense of not letting it deteriorate from the very beginning.

original: des ni mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir gus pa skyes nas dran @18b pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa bsrungs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so sor thar pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir gus pa skyes nas dran @18b pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir dge slong tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa bsrungs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so sor thar pa bstan to //
translated: Since it is for the purpose of not letting it deteriorate, the individual liberation is taught by the characteristic of accomplishment through the monk's guarding of the perfectly taken precepts, because mindfulness is well-established through the arising of respect.

original: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: gleng bslang ba'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The characteristic of introduction has been explained.

original: // / de'i 'og tu yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de'i 'og tu yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the characteristic of correct composition should be explained.

original: yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa yang dag par brtsam pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa yang dag par brtsam pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of correct composition is the correct composition of the extensive text of the individual liberation.

original: de yang so sor thar pa rnyed dka' ba dang / dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde bal sogs pa'i sgo nas yang dag par brtsams dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa rnyed dka' ba dang / dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde bal sogs pa'i sgo nas yang dag par brtsams dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since the individual liberation should be correctly composed from the perspective of the difficulty of obtaining it and the happiness of the arising of the Three Jewels, therefore:

original: bskal ba bye ba rnams su yang //
analyzed: bskal ba bye ba rnams su yang //
translated: Even in millions of eons

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug gsungs so //
translated: and so on, six verses are stated.

original: de la 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pa drug po de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir yang tshigs su bcad pa drug po de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, one should state the topic, purpose, connection, and ultimate purpose of these six verses.

original: de la brjod par bya ba ni so sor thar pa la gus par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba ni so sor thar pa la gus par bya ba'o //
translated: The topic is respect for the code of monastic discipline.

original: dgos pa ni gus par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni gus par byed pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to generate respect.

original: 'brel pa ni gus par bya ba de yang yang dag par brtsams pa 'dis byed pas yang dag par brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'di dang / dogs pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni gus par bya ba de yang yang dag par brtsams pa 'dis byed pas yang dag par brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i thabs 'di dang / dogs pa thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection is that this composition is connected with the method of the verses and the characteristics of the arising of doubt, since that respect is generated by this composition.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa la gus par gyur nas so sor thar ba yang dag par brtsam par 'dod pas so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa nyan pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa la gus par gyur nas so sor thar ba yang dag par brtsam par 'dod pas so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa nyan pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: The ultimate purpose is that, having generated respect for the code of monastic discipline, one who wishes to undertake the code of monastic discipline will study the extensive text of the code of monastic discipline and so forth.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa drug po 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa drug po 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: The condensed meaning of these six verses has seven parts.

original: so sor thar pa rnyed dka' ba dang / dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba dang /
analyzed: so sor thar pa rnyed dka' ba dang / dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba dang /
translated: The happiness of obtaining the pratimoksa, the happiness of the appearance of the Three Jewels, the happiness of relying on a spiritual teacher, the happiness of abandoning evil friends, the happiness of relying on the special spiritual teacher,

original: thob par bya ba dang / de bsgrub pa bde ba dang ; sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba'o //🔽de la / bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
analyzed: thob par bya ba dang / de bsgrub pa bde ba dang ; sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba'o // de la / bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //
translated: the happiness of the attainment of the result, the happiness of the practice of the result, and the happiness of the practice of the result endowed with the virtues of purification.🔽In this regard, one verse on the difficulty of obtaining the pratimoksa:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni so sor thar pa rnyed dka' ba bstan to //🔽sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su @19a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni so sor thar pa rnyed dka' ba bstan to // sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su @19a * //
translated: The difficulty of obtaining the pratimoksa is taught by this verse:

original: bcad pa gcig gis ni dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: bcad pa gcig gis ni dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba bde ba bstan to //
translated: The happiness of the appearance of the Three Jewels is taught by this verse:

original: 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba bde //
translated: The happiness of seeing the noble ones,

original: dam pa dag dang 'grogs pa bde //
analyzed: dam pa dag dang 'grogs pa bde //
translated: the happiness of associating with the good,

original: zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the happiness of relying on a spiritual teacher.

original: byis pa rnams ni ma mthong na //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni ma mthong na //
translated: Fools are not seen,

original: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: and one is always happy.

original: zhes bya bas ni sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the happiness of avoiding bad friends.

original: tshul khrims ldan pa mthong ba bde //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan pa mthong ba bde //
translated: It is happy to see those who have moral discipline.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba bstan to //
translated: This one verse shows the happiness of relying on the specific qualities of a spiritual teacher.

original: 'jug ngogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
analyzed: 'jug ngogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
translated: A river with a pleasant ford is happy.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni thob par bya ba dang / de sgrub pa bde ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni thob par bya ba dang / de sgrub pa bde ba bstan to //
translated: This one verse shows the happiness of the goal and its attainment.🔽Those who are calm and have controlled their faculties,

original: des par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba bstan te /
analyzed: des par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba bstan te /
translated: This one verse shows the happiness of the means of attainment, which is endowed with the virtues of purification.

original: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the subsidiary topics will be explained.

original: de la so sor thar pa rnyed dka' ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la so sor thar pa rnyed dka' ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In this regard, in order to take up the topic of individual liberation, which is difficult to obtain, the following verse is stated:

original: bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang //🔽so sor thar pa thos pa dang // gzung dang 'dzin ba rnyed dka' ste //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba rnams su yang // so sor thar pa thos pa dang // gzung dang 'dzin ba rnyed dka' ste //
translated: Even in millions of eons,🔽it is difficult to obtain the teachings on individual liberation,

original: sgrub pa'ang shin tu rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: sgrub pa'ang shin tu rnyed par dka' //
translated: and to attain the teacher and the taught,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: and even to practice it.

original: bskal ba zhes bya ba ni dus kyi bye brag bskal pa chen po ste /
analyzed: bskal ba zhes bya ba ni dus kyi bye brag bskal pa chen po ste /
translated: Here, an eon is a specific period of time, a great eon.

original: bskal par byed pas bskal pa'o //
analyzed: bskal par byed pas bskal pa'o //
translated: It is called an eon because it creates an eon.

original: bye ba zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi bye brag ste gnas brgyad pa'o ;
analyzed: bye ba zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi bye brag ste gnas brgyad pa'o ;
translated: Millions is a specific number, the eighth place.

original: / rnams su yang zhes bya ba ni bye brag ba grangs pa dag gis kyang brgyal rnyed par dka' bas mang po'i tshig tu bstan to //
analyzed: / rnams su yang zhes bya ba ni bye brag ba grangs pa dag gis kyang brgyal rnyed par dka' bas mang po'i tshig tu bstan to //
translated: Even in millions indicates the difficulty of obtaining it through specific numbers, showing it in the sense of many.

original: so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni lung dang rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Individual liberation has the characteristics of scripture and realization.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas tshig gi bdag nyid thos pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas tshig gi bdag nyid thos pa'o //
translated: Hearing is the hearing of the words by the ear consciousness.

original: gzung zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes las thob pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas tshig gi bdag nyid dang don gyi bdag nyid yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: gzung zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes las thob pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas tshig gi bdag nyid dang don gyi bdag nyid yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: Apprehending is the apprehension of the words and their meanings by the mental consciousness that is attained subsequently to the ear consciousness.

original: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don gyi bdag nyid bzung ba de mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don gyi bdag nyid bzung ba de mi brjed pa'o //
translated: Retaining is the non-forgetting of the words and their meanings that have been apprehended.

original: rnyed dka' ste zhes bya ba ni de gsum char yang rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: rnyed dka' ste zhes bya ba ni de gsum char yang rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: They are difficult to acquire, because all three are difficult to acquire.🔽They are like the difficulty of a blind turtle rising through the water to the surface of the great ocean and putting its neck through the hole of a yoke tossed about by the wind on the ocean surface.

original: @19b rgya mtsho chen por gnya' shing gi mig tu rus sbal zhar ba'i mgrin pa chud pa'i tshul gyis gzhan gyi 'byor pa dang / bdag gi 'byor pa la sogs pa rnyed par dka' bas bskal pa chen po bye ba phrag bgrangs pa 'das pas kyang de dag rnyed dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @19b rgya mtsho chen por gnya' shing gi mig tu rus sbal zhar ba'i mgrin pa chud pa'i tshul gyis gzhan gyi 'byor pa dang / bdag gi 'byor pa la sogs pa rnyed par dka' bas bskal pa chen po bye ba phrag bgrangs pa 'das pas kyang de dag rnyed dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are difficult to acquire because they are not acquired even in many great eons, as stated in the sutra:

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa rtogs pa'i don lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis yang dag par sgrub cing nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa rtogs pa'i don lus dang ngag dang yid dag gis yang dag par sgrub cing nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: Practice means to practice and cultivate the meaning of the pratimoksha through body, speech, and mind.

original: de'ang snga ma de gsum pas kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: de'ang snga ma de gsum pas kyang shin tu rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: Moreover, it is very difficult to obtain the former three through the latter.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa ni mngon par brtson pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa ni mngon par brtson pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because correct practice depends on striving.

original: de lta bas na so sor thar pa brjod par byas /
analyzed: de lta bas na so sor thar pa brjod par byas /
translated: Therefore, the pratimoksha should be recited.

original: gus par nyon cig / thos nas kyang drang srong chen pos ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin du rjes su bsgrub cing nan tan du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gus par nyon cig / thos nas kyang drang srong chen pos ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin du rjes su bsgrub cing nan tan du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Listen respectfully. Having heard it, you should practice and strive just as the great sage has taught. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa rnyed dka' bas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni lung dang rtogs pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa rnyed dka' bas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan te /
translated: Thus, by this verse, it is taught that the pratimoksha should be correctly undertaken because it is difficult to obtain through scripture and realization.

original: thos pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnyed par dka' ba ni lung gi sgo nas rnyed dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: thos pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnyed par dka' ba ni lung gi sgo nas rnyed dka' ba yin te /
translated: The difficulty of obtaining hearing, retention, and the teacher is the difficulty of obtaining the scriptures.

original: sgrub pa'ang shin tu rnyed par dka' ba ni rtogs pa'i sgo nas rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa'ang shin tu rnyed par dka' ba ni rtogs pa'i sgo nas rnyed par dka' ba yin no //
translated: The difficulty of practice is the difficulty of obtaining the realizations.

original: dkon mchog gsum 'byung bar bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum 'byung bar bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsams pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In terms of the happiness of the arising of the three jewels, the verse

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: The arising of the buddhas is happiness.

original: chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin //🔽dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
analyzed: chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin // dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is happiness.🔽The harmony of the Saṅgha is happiness.

original: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde //
analyzed: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde //
translated: The austerity of those in harmony is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: is stated from the perspective of the perfect practice of liberation.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽sangs rgyas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par byang chub pa'i tshe yang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde // zhes bya ba la / sangs rgyas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par byang chub pa'i tshe yang /
translated: The arising of the buddhas is happiness.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bltam pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bltam pa'i tshe'o //
translated: Here, the arising of the buddhas is the arising of the buddhas in the manner of their later arising at the time of birth.

original: de bde zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bde zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase it is happiness means that it is the cause for attaining the happiness of liberation and it is the result of happiness.

original: dper na mi bde'o zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba bde ba yin no //🔽chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po dag bstan pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas @20a * //
analyzed: dper na mi bde'o zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba bde ba yin no // chos bstan pa yang bde ba yin // zhes bya ba ni mdo sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po dag bstan pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas @20a * //
translated: For example, the phrase it is suffering is similar to the statement the appearance of the buddhas is happiness.

original: bde ba yin no //🔽dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
analyzed: bde ba yin no // dge 'dun mthun pa bde ba ste //
translated: The phrase the teaching of the Dharma is happiness means that the teaching of the twelve branches of the scriptures, such as the sutras, is the cause of happiness and it is the result of happiness.🔽The phrase the harmony of the Saṅgha is happiness means that the Saṅgha, which is the collection of the eight types of persons, is the cause of happiness and it is the result of happiness.

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang zag brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun tshul khrims dang lta ba dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba mthun pas ro gcig cing bya ba gcig tu gyur pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas bde pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gang zag brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi dge 'dun tshul khrims dang lta ba dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba mthun pas ro gcig cing bya ba gcig tu gyur pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang / 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas bde pa yin no //
translated: The phrase the practice of the true Dharma is happiness means that the practice of the true Dharma is the cause of happiness and it is the result of happiness.

original: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde //🔽zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum po dag la rjes su bsgrub pa'i dka' thub nyon mongs pa dang / nyes pa spyad pa gdung bar byed pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas bde pa yin no //🔽de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba dang / de dag gi 'bras bu bde ba nyid yin pas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mthun pa rnams kyi dka' thub bde // zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum po dag la rjes su bsgrub pa'i dka' thub nyon mongs pa dang / nyes pa spyad pa gdung bar byed pa yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa dang 'bras bu bde bar 'gyur bas bde pa yin no // de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba dang / de dag gi 'bras bu bde ba nyid yin pas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
