original: sdig pa dag las ring ngu song ba'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa dag las ring ngu song ba'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “noble” because they have gone far from evil.

original: mthong ba bde zhes bya ba ni de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen nyid du mthong na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba bde zhes bya ba ni de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen nyid du mthong na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: “ They are pleasant to see” means that they are a cause of happiness when they are seen as spiritual benefactors.

original: dam pa dag ces bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi nang na skyes bu dam pa byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: dam pa dag ces bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi nang na skyes bu dam pa byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: “ They are holy” means that among ordinary people, the holy ones are the bodhisattvas and so on.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs shing nges pa'i phyir dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs shing nges pa'i phyir dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “holy” because they are dedicated to helping others.

original: 'grogs pa bde zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mtshungs par gnas na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'grogs pa bde zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mtshungs par gnas na bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “ They are pleasant to live with” means that they are a cause of happiness when one lives with them.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed po des ni 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / dam pa dang 'grogs pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed po des ni 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / dam pa dang 'grogs pa ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, by this half-verse, it is shown that the vision of the noble ones and the company of the holy ones are the prerequisites for the perfect happiness of this life and the next. Therefore, one should undertake the practice of the Prātimokṣa through relying on a spiritual friend, by way of happiness.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to undertaking the practice of the Prātimokṣa by way of happiness through abandoning evil friends, it is said:

original: byis pa rnams ni ma @20b mthong na //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni ma @20b mthong na //
translated: When fools are not seen,

original: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: there is always happiness.

original: byis pa rnams zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'chal pa log par sgrub pa rnams te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'chal pa log par sgrub pa rnams te /
translated: Here, “fools” are those with bad wisdom who practice wrongly.

original: byes pa'i rtags dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byes pa'i rtags dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have the characteristics of a bad friend.

original: ma mthong na /
analyzed: ma mthong na /
translated: “When they are not seen”

original: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu bde ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: “there is always happiness.”

original: zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs po dang ma 'grogs na rnam pa thams cad du bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs po dang ma 'grogs na rnam pa thams cad du bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one does not associate with evil friends, one will be happy in every way.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed po des ni sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba'i sgo na so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa phyed po des ni sdig pa'i grogs po spangs pa bde ba'i sgo na so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, in this first half-verse, it is shown that one should undertake the practice of the vow of individual liberation by the door of happiness, through the avoidance of evil friends.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In the second half-verse, the Blessed One, in order to show the undertaking of the practice of the vow of individual liberation by the door of happiness, through the reliance on the distinction of spiritual benefactors,🔽said:

original: tshul khrims ldan pa mthong ba bde //
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan pa mthong ba bde //
translated: It is happiness to see one who is moral.🔽It is happiness to see one who is learned.

original: mang du thos pa mthong ba bde //
analyzed: mang du thos pa mthong ba bde //
translated: It is happiness to see an arhat

original: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi //🔽dgra bcom pa dag mthong ba bde //
analyzed: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi // dgra bcom pa dag mthong ba bde //
translated: who is liberated from all future rebirth.

original: zhe bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhe bya ba tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: This is one verse.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The distinction of spiritual benefactors is of two kinds:

original: nye bar brtags pa dang don dam pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa dang don dam pa'o //
translated: conventional and ultimate.

original: nye bar btags pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The conventional is of two kinds:

original: zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o //
translated: He is established in the branches of serenity and in the branches of insight.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: He is established in the branches of serenity, as indicated by the words, “he is endowed with morality.”

original: tshul khrims la gnas nas sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas nas sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, having established himself in morality, he can settle his mind in even meditation.

original: de mthong ba bde ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni gzhan la gnod pa'i bsam pa la log pa las bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mthong ba bde ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni gzhan la gnod pa'i bsam pa la log pa las bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is happy in his view, because one who is endowed with morality is the cause of happiness, since he turns away from the intention to harm others.

original: lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa ni mang du thos pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa ni mang du thos pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: He is established in the branches of insight, as indicated by the words, “he is learned.”

original: mang du thos na shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang du thos na shes rab skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, when one is learned, wisdom arises.

original: de mthong ba bde ba ni thos pa dang ldan pa ni thos pa'i stobs kyi lta ba dang 'gyod pa dang / the tshom sel bas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mthong ba bde ba ni thos pa dang ldan pa ni thos pa'i stobs kyi lta ba dang 'gyod pa dang / the tshom sel bas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is happy in his view, because one who is learned is the cause of happiness, since he dispels the views, regrets, and doubts that arise from what one has heard and thought.

original: don dam pa ni /
analyzed: don dam pa ni /
translated: The ultimate is

original: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi //
analyzed: yang srid rnam par grol ba yi //
translated: liberation from all future rebirth.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: The term “worthy one” is taught.

original: yang srid rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid kyis rnam par grol ba bstan to //
analyzed: yang srid rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar yang mi skye ba'i chos nyid kyis rnam par grol ba bstan to //
translated: The term “liberated from rebirth” teaches liberation by the very nature of not being subject to rebirth in cyclic existence.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa bstan te /🔽dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas ni sgra 'os @21a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa bstan te / dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas ni sgra 'os @21a * //
translated: The term “worthy one” teaches the destruction of the enemy of the afflictions.

original: pa la sogs pa'i don gzhan du yang 'dren pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa nyid kyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i don gzhan du yang 'dren pas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa nyid kyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The term “worthy one” can also be interpreted to mean “worthy of worship” and so on. Therefore, in order to teach the specific possession of the fruit of a worthy one,

original: yang srid rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yang srid rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the term “liberated from rebirth” is mentioned.

original: de dag mthong ba bde ba yin //
analyzed: de dag mthong ba bde ba yin //
translated: They are happy to see them.

original: dgra bcom pa thob pa ni dge legs kyi bsam pa mchog dang ldan pa yin pas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa thob pa ni dge legs kyi bsam pa mchog dang ldan pa yin pas bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the attainment of a worthy one is endowed with the supreme thought of virtue, it is the cause of happiness.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten nas bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khyad par la brten nas bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, this verse shows that one should begin the Prātimokṣa through happiness by relying on the special spiritual teacher.

original: thob par bya pa dang de sgrub pa bad ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: thob par bya pa dang de sgrub pa bad ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to beginning the Prātimokṣa through happiness in obtaining it and accomplishing it,🔽he says:

original: 'jug dogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
analyzed: 'jug dogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
translated: The river with a pleasant ford is pleasant.

original: chos la goms pa'i skye bo bde //
analyzed: chos la goms pa'i skye bo bde //
translated: The person who is accustomed to the Dharma is happy.

original: shes rab thob par gyur pa bde //
analyzed: shes rab thob par gyur pa bde //
translated: The one who has attained wisdom is happy.

original: nga'o nga rgyal zad pa bde //
analyzed: nga'o nga rgyal zad pa bde //
translated: The one who has eliminated pride is happy.

original: zhes bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /
translated: Here, he says one verse.

original: thob par bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'o ;
analyzed: thob par bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'o ;
translated: The object to be obtained is liberation.

original: / de sgrub pa ni gang zag rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: / de sgrub pa ni gang zag rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The one who accomplishes it is the individual yogi.

original: de la thob par bya ba bde ba ni /
analyzed: de la thob par bya ba bde ba ni /
translated: Among them, the happiness of the object to be obtained is shown by

original: 'jug ngogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //🔽zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'jug ngogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //🔽zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: the river with a pleasant ford is pleasant.

original: dper na chu klung 'jug ngogs kyi chu ka bde na chu blang sla ba de bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i chu klung gi 'jug dogs kyi lam 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms kyi mtha' dang bdag nyid ngal ba'i mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pas bde ba'i yang rnam par
analyzed: dper na chu klung 'jug ngogs kyi chu ka bde na chu blang sla ba de bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i chu klung gi 'jug dogs kyi lam 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms kyi mtha' dang bdag nyid ngal ba'i mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pas bde ba'i yang rnam par
translated: For example, if the water at the mouth of a river is easy to draw, then it is easy to draw water from the river.

original: grol pa'i chu blang sla ste /🔽des ni thob bar byas pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: grol pa'i chu blang sla ste / des ni thob bar byas pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Similarly, the path that is the mouth of the river of complete liberation is easy to draw the water of complete liberation, because it is happy, since it is free from the two extremes: the extreme of the enjoyments of desire and the extreme of self-mortification.🔽This teaches that one should begin the practice of liberation through the door of happiness.

original: de sgrub par byed pa bde ba ni /
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa bde ba ni /
translated: The happiness of accomplishing that is taught by the three remaining verses beginning with:

original: chos la goms pa'i skye bo bde //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lhag ma gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: chos la goms pa'i skye bo bde // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lhag ma gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The person who is accustomed to the Dharma is happy.

original: chos la goms pa zhes bya ba ni dge pa'i chos la goms pa ste /
analyzed: chos la goms pa zhes bya ba ni dge pa'i chos la goms pa ste /
translated: The person who is accustomed to the Dharma is accustomed to virtuous dharmas.

original: des ni tshogs kyi la ma dang sbyor pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni tshogs kyi la ma dang sbyor pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the accomplishment of the path of accumulation and the path of preparation.

original: de bde ba ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba 'thob ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bde ba ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba 'thob ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That happiness is the cause of attaining the happiness of complete liberation.

original: shes rab thob par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab thob par gyur ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab thob par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab thob par gyur ba ste /
translated: Having attained wisdom means having attained uncontaminated wisdom.

original: des ni rnam par dag pa'i lam sgrub bar byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rnam par dag pa'i lam sgrub bar byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the path of purification.

original: de bde ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par grol ba'i bde ba nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bde ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par grol ba'i bde ba nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is happy means that he has attained the happiness of liberation through the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: @21b nga'o nga rgyal zad pa bde //
analyzed: @21b nga'o nga rgyal zad pa bde //
translated: He is happy, his pride is destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum ba'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: This means that he is free from attachment to the three realms.

original: des ni mi slob pa'i lam sgrub par byed ba bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mi slob pa'i lam sgrub par byed ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the path of no-more-learning.

original: de bde ba ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba nyid mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bde ba ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba nyid mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is happy means that he has realized the happiness of liberation.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni thob par bya ba dang / de sgrub pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni thob par bya ba dang / de sgrub pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, that verse shows that one should undertake the life of a monk by attaining the goal and by the happiness of achieving it.

original: sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /🔽des par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag / dgon pa zhi ba rnams su rgas gyur dang // mang du thos pa nags kyi nang dag tu //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / des par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag / dgon pa zhi ba rnams su rgas gyur dang // mang du thos pa nags kyi nang dag tu //
translated: The verse is stated from the perspective of the one who practices, who is endowed with the qualities of training, and who is happy.

original: lang tsho yol ba rnams kyi gnas pa bde //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te /🔽sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag rnal 'byor pa ste /🔽de ni / nges par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag / ces bya ba dang ; mang du thos pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: lang tsho yol ba rnams kyi gnas pa bde // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gsungs te / sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag rnal 'byor pa ste / de ni / nges par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag / ces bya ba dang ; mang du thos pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The verse is stated from the perspective of the one who practices, who is endowed with the qualities of training, and who is happy.🔽The verse is stated from the perspective of the one who practices, who is endowed with the qualities of training, and who is happy.🔽The verse is stated from the perspective of the one who practices, who is endowed with the qualities of training, and who is happy.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni dgon pa pa dang shing drung pa la sogs pa bcu gnyis te /🔽de ni / dgon pa zhi ba rnams su rgas gyur dang // zhes bya ba dang / nags kyi nang dag tu /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ni dgon pa pa dang shing drung pa la sogs pa bcu gnyis te /🔽de ni / dgon pa zhi ba rnams su rgas gyur dang // zhes bya ba dang / nags kyi nang dag tu /
translated: The verse is stated from the perspective of the one who practices, who is endowed with the qualities of training, and who is happy.🔽The verse is stated from the perspective of the one who practices, who is endowed with the qualities of training, and who is happy.🔽The verse is stated from the perspective of the one who practices, who is endowed with the qualities of training, and who is happy.

original: lang tsho yol ba rnams zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: lang tsho yol ba rnams zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Those who have passed beyond youth is taught.

original: de bde ba ni gnas pa bde zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de bde ba ni gnas pa bde zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The happiness of that is taught by the happiness of abiding.

original: de la nges bar byas shing zhes bya bas ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnam par dag pa bstan te bsam pa des par blangs shing mngon par brtson pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nges bar byas shing zhes bya bas ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan rnam par dag pa bstan te bsam pa des par blangs shing mngon par brtson pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among those, having made it certain teaches the purity of the virtues of training, because one has taken up the intention and made effort.

original: dbang po thul ba dag ces bya bas ni yongs su dag pa bstan te /
analyzed: dbang po thul ba dag ces bya bas ni yongs su dag pa bstan te /
translated: The tamed senses teaches the complete purity.

original: dbang po sdom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one possesses the restraint of the senses.

original: de ltar nges par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag dgon pa zhi ba rnams su rgas par gyur pa'i gnas bde'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de ltar nges par byas shing dbang po thul ba dag dgon pa zhi ba rnams su rgas par gyur pa'i gnas bde'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Thus, having made it certain and tamed the senses, they are happy in old age in the peaceful forests.

original: dgon pa zhib rnams su zhes bya bas ni skye bo med pa nyid kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: dgon pa zhib rnams su zhes bya bas ni skye bo med pa nyid kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The peaceful forests teaches the excellence of the abode free from people.

original: rgas gyur zhes bya ba ni rab tu dpen ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges bar spyor ba'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: rgas gyur zhes bya ba ni rab tu dpen ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid la nges bar spyor ba'i rim gyis so //
translated: Old age is applied in the sequence of definite engagement in complete solitude and one-pointed mind.

original: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum gyi bstan bcos dag thos pa ste /
analyzed: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum gyi bstan bcos dag thos pa ste /
translated: One who is learned is one who has heard the treatises on the three scriptural collections.

original: des ni dgon pa zhi ba rnams su rgas par gyur pa de 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan te /🔽mang du @22a * //
analyzed: des ni dgon pa zhi ba rnams su rgas par gyur pa de 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan te / mang du @22a * //
translated: This shows that his old age in the peaceful forest is fruitful.

original: thos pa dgon par gnas pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa dgon par gnas pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the learned person who lives in the forest has a fruitful life, but not one who does not.

original: nags kyi nang dag tu zhes bya ba ni gnas mal shing drung bstan to //
analyzed: nags kyi nang dag tu zhes bya ba ni gnas mal shing drung bstan to //
translated: The phrase in the forest shows that his bed and seat is at the foot of a tree.

original: lang tsho yol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni gzhol pa nyid zad par byas pa rnams so //🔽de rnams kyi gnas pa bde zhes bya ba ni gson pa bde ba ste /
analyzed: lang tsho yol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni gzhol pa nyid zad par byas pa rnams so // de rnams kyi gnas pa bde zhes bya ba ni gson pa bde ba ste /
translated: The phrase in the prime of life shows that he has eliminated all self-indulgence.

original: tshe 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba dang bdag dang gzhan la bde ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba dang bdag dang gzhan la bde ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase he lives happily shows that he lives happily in this life, and that he lives happily for himself and for others, because he is the cause of the happiness of both this life and the next.

original: 'dir dgon pa dang nags kyi nang zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: 'dir dgon pa dang nags kyi nang zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: The words forest and grove in the verse are merely examples.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis po thams cad kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis po thams cad kyang bsdu'o //
translated: All twelve of these qualities of training are included in this verse.🔽Thus, this verse teaches that those who practice and strive to subdue their faculties will be happy in old age if they live in a peaceful forest far from towns, and those who are learned will be happy if they live in the forest and let their youth pass and come to an end.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni sgrub par byed pa gang dag gis mngon par brtson par byas nas dbang po dag thul ba na dgon pa zhi ba grong las thag ring ba'i phyogs dag tu rgas par gyur pa rnams dang / gang dag mang du thos pa na nags kyi nang dag tu lang tsho gzhon pa nyid yol zhing zad par byas pa de rnams kyis gnas pa zhes bya bar gson pa nyid ni bde'o zhes sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba'i sgo
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa des ni sgrub par byed pa gang dag gis mngon par brtson par byas nas dbang po dag thul ba na dgon pa zhi ba grong las thag ring ba'i phyogs dag tu rgas par gyur pa rnams dang / gang dag mang du thos pa na nags kyi nang dag tu lang tsho gzhon pa nyid yol zhing zad par byas pa de rnams kyis gnas pa zhes bya bar gson pa nyid ni bde'o zhes sgrub par byed pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bde ba'i sgo
translated: Those who practice and possess the qualities of training will be happy in this life.

original: nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nas so sor thar pa yang dag par brtsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, they should undertake the practice of individual liberation.

original: yang dag bar brtsam pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
analyzed: yang dag bar brtsam pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin to /
translated: The characteristics of undertaking it properly have been explained.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Vinaya Verses: A Compendium of the Monastic Law, Volume Two

original: de'i 'og tu gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the characteristics of the extensive text should be explained.

original: gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the extensive text are the teaching of the characteristics of the extensive text of the Pratimoksha.

original: de yang dus dang por bya ba dang / mdo gdon pa bstan dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang dus dang por bya ba dang / mdo gdon pa bstan dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since the first time period must be taught and the sutra recited,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba nas dran pa dang bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung thams cad gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba nas dran pa dang bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung thams cad gsungs so //
translated: the entire text from “Venerable ones, the first part of the summer retreat and the remainder are just so” up to “One should practice with mindfulness and heedfulness” is stated.

original: de la 'dir yang gzhung rgyas pa de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir yang gzhung rgyas pa de dag gi brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang 'brel pa dang / dgos pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, the subject matter, purpose, connection, and ultimate purpose of those extensive texts should be stated.

original: de la brjod par bya ba ni gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ba ni gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
translated: Here, the subject matter is the characteristics of the extensive text.

original: dgos pa ni de dag rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni de dag rtogs pa'o //
translated: The purpose is understanding them.

original: 'brel pa ni @22b rtogs pa de yang gzhung rgyas pa 'dis byed pas gzhung rgyas pa'i thabs 'di dang dgos pa thams cad las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni @22b rtogs pa de yang gzhung rgyas pa 'dis byed pas gzhung rgyas pa'i thabs 'di dang dgos pa thams cad las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection is that the text is the means for understanding that, and the characteristics of the text are connected with the purpose.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pas tshul khrims rnam par dag na 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni so sor thar pa'i gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pas tshul khrims rnam par dag na 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: The ultimate purpose is that by understanding the characteristics of the text of the Prātimokṣa, if one's ethics are pure, one attains nirvāṇa by cultivating the noble path.

original: de la gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gzhung rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, the summarized meaning of the characteristics of the text is twofold:

original: dus dang por bya ba dang / mdo gdon pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang por bya ba dang / mdo gdon pa'o //
translated: the preliminary duties and the recitation of the sūtra.

original: de la dus dang por bya ba ni mdo gdon pa'i snga rol du bya ba ste cho ga'o //
analyzed: de la dus dang por bya ba ni mdo gdon pa'i snga rol du bya ba ste cho ga'o //
translated: The preliminary duties are the rituals to be performed before the recitation of the sūtra.

original: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Its summarized meaning is sixfold:

original: so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs dang / mi 'du ba dgag pa dang / mchod cing lung dbog pa dang / yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa dang / de'i phan yon dang / yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o//
analyzed: so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs dang / mi 'du ba dgag pa dang / mchod cing lung dbog pa dang / yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa dang / de'i phan yon dang / yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o//
translated: The disadvantages of not listening to the Pratimoksha, the prohibition against not assembling, the worship and oral transmission, the correct practice, the benefits of that, and the disadvantages of not practicing correctly.

original: mdo gdon pa ni gsol ba bya ba nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gdon pa ste las so //
analyzed: mdo gdon pa ni gsol ba bya ba nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gdon pa ste las so //
translated: The recitation of the sutra is the action of reciting the five types of recitation of the Pratimoksha Sutra, starting with the request.

original: de'i bsdus pa'i don yang rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de'i bsdus pa'i don yang rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Its summarized meaning is also sixfold:

original: gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The request, the recitation of the nidana, the recitation of the defeats, the recitation of the remaining in the Sangha, the recitation of the undetermined, and the explanation of the characteristics of the complete recitation.

original: de la tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji cam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la tshe dang ldan pa dag so ga rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji cam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Among them, Venerable ones, it is just as much as the remaining of the hot season, just that much... and so on.

original: bag yod pas 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: bag yod pas 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: The passage up to “one attains it through heedfulness” teaches the disadvantage of not paying attention to listening to the pratimokṣa.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni don nyung ba /🔽bya ba nyung ba yin pas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni don nyung ba / bya ba nyung ba yin pas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from “The Bhagavān said, ‘The śrāvaka saṅgha has few goals

original: dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mi 'du ba dgag pa bstan to //🔽sh'akya seng ge de la ni //
analyzed: dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mi 'du ba dgag pa bstan to // sh'akya seng ge de la ni //
translated: and few activities’” up to “having asked, one should speak” teaches the prohibition against not gathering.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni mchod cing lung 'bogs pa bstan to //🔽thos nas drang srong chen po yis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni mchod cing lung 'bogs pa bstan to // thos nas drang srong chen po yis //
translated: The one verse beginning with “To that Śākya Lion” teaches the worship and recitation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bstan to //🔽che ba gang dag ngag tsam gyis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bstan to // che ba gang dag ngag tsam gyis //
translated: The two verses beginning with “Having heard it, the great sage” teach the establishment in correct practice.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad @23a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad @23a * //
translated: The one verse beginning with “Those who are great through mere speech”

original: pa gcig gis ni de'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: pa gcig gis ni de'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: teaches its benefits.

original: su la srab 'di med pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: su la srab 'di med pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: One verse on the disadvantage of not practicing correctly:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa 'ba' zhig gi las kyi lam ni gsol ba bstan to //🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis ni gleng gzhi gdon pa la sogs pa rim pa bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa 'ba' zhig gi las kyi lam ni gsol ba bstan to // tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis ni gleng gzhi gdon pa la sogs pa rim pa bzhin bstan to //
translated: The proclamation of the motion is the path of action consisting of the proclamation of the motion alone, beginning with the words, “May the community of bhikṣus listen!🔽The proclamation of the motion and the single announcement is the path of action consisting of the proclamation of the motion and the single announcement, beginning with the words, “The community of bhikṣus is pure with regard to this matter.🔽The proclamation of the motion, the single announcement, and the three announcements is the path of action consisting of the proclamation of the motion, the single announcement, and the three announcements, beginning with the words, “The community of bhikṣus is pure with regard to this matter.

original: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the specific meaning will be explained.

original: so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to listening to the Prātimokṣa, the disadvantage of not paying attention is stated:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag sog rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag sog rnams kyi 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Venerable ones, the Prātimokṣa is as much as this much, what has passed and what remains.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag zhes bya ba ni rgan pa rnams dang gzhon pa dag la snyan pa'i tshig gis 'bod pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag zhes bya ba ni rgan pa rnams dang gzhon pa dag la snyan pa'i tshig gis 'bod pa'o //
translated: The phrase venerable ones is a polite way of addressing both the elders and the young.

original: sog rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus tshigs mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: sog rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus tshigs mtshon pa ste /
translated: The phrase in the spring indicates the time for the observance ceremony.

original: so ga dang / dbyar dang / ston dang / dgun dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid kyi dus tshigs drug po gang gi tshe so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i dus tshigs de nyid kyi ming smos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: so ga dang / dbyar dang / ston dang / dgun dang / dgun smad dang / dpyid kyi dus tshigs drug po gang gi tshe so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i dus tshigs de nyid kyi ming smos par bya ba yin no //
translated: The six seasons are spring, summer, autumn, winter, late winter, and the rainy season. The name of the season in which the Sūtra of Individual Liberation is recited should be mentioned.

original: de la dus tshigs drug po re re la yang zla ba gnyis gnyis yod pas mang po'i tshig tu byas te /
analyzed: de la dus tshigs drug po re re la yang zla ba gnyis gnyis yod pas mang po'i tshig tu byas te /
translated: Since each of the six seasons has two months, the plural particle is used.

original: so ga'i dus tshigs ni dpyid zla tha chungs nya nas dbyar zla ra ba nya'i bar dang / dbyar zla ra ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so ;
analyzed: so ga'i dus tshigs ni dpyid zla tha chungs nya nas dbyar zla ra ba nya'i bar dang / dbyar zla ra ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so ;
translated: The spring season is the two months from the full moon of the last month of winter to the full moon of the first month of summer, and the two months from the full moon of the first month of summer to the full moon of the middle month of summer.

original: / dbyar gyi dus tshigs ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar dang / dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //🔽ston gyi dus tshigs ni ston zla ra ba nyan nas ston zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar dang / ston zla 'bring po nya nas ston zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //🔽dgun gyi dus tshigs ni ston zla tha chungs nya nas dgun zla ra ba'i nya'i bar dang / dgun zla ra ba nya nas dgun zla 'phring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
analyzed: / dbyar gyi dus tshigs ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar dang / dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so // ston gyi dus tshigs ni ston zla ra ba nyan nas ston zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar dang / ston zla 'bring po nya nas ston zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so // dgun gyi dus tshigs ni ston zla tha chungs nya nas dgun zla ra ba'i nya'i bar dang / dgun zla ra ba nya nas dgun zla 'phring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
translated: The rainy season is the two months from the full moon of the middle summer month to the full moon of the last summer month, and from the full moon of the last summer month to the full moon of the first autumn month.🔽The autumn season is the two months from the full moon of the first autumn month to the full moon of the middle autumn month, and from the full moon of the middle autumn month to the full moon of the last autumn month.🔽The winter season is the two months from the full moon of the last autumn month to the full moon of the first winter month, and from the full moon of the first winter month to the full moon of the middle winter month.

original: dgun smad kyi dus tshigs ni dgun zla 'bring po nya nas dgun zla tha chungs nya'i bar dang / @23b dgun zla tha chungs nya nas dpyid zla ra pa'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
analyzed: dgun smad kyi dus tshigs ni dgun zla 'bring po nya nas dgun zla tha chungs nya'i bar dang / @23b dgun zla tha chungs nya nas dpyid zla ra pa'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
translated: The late winter season is the two months from the full moon of the middle winter month to the full moon of the last winter month, and from the full moon of the last winter month to the full moon of the first spring month.

original: dpyid kyi dus tshigs ni dpyid zla ra nya nas dpyid zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar dang / dpyid zla 'bring po nya nas dpyid zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
analyzed: dpyid kyi dus tshigs ni dpyid zla ra nya nas dpyid zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar dang / dpyid zla 'bring po nya nas dpyid zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gnyis so //
translated: The spring season is the two months from the full moon of the first spring month to the full moon of the middle spring month, and from the full moon of the middle spring month to the full moon of the last spring month.

original: de la so ga'i dus tshigs la so sor thar pa 'don na ni so ga rnams kyi zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la so ga'i dus tshigs la so sor thar pa 'don na ni so ga rnams kyi zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If the pratimoksha vows are recited in the spring season, one should say “of the springs.”

original: de bzhin du dbyar dang / ston dang / dgun dang / dpyid kyi dus tshigs la so sor thar pa 'don na yang dbyar rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyar dang / ston dang / dgun dang / dpyid kyi dus tshigs la so sor thar pa 'don na yang dbyar rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, if the pratimoksha vows are recited in the summer, autumn, winter, or spring seasons, one should say “of the summers” and so forth.

original: 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba ni zla ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bya ba ni zla ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: As much as has passed and as much as remains should be stated.

original: 'das pa ji tsam pa de tsam brjod par bya ba dang / lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa ji tsam pa de tsam brjod par bya ba dang / lhag ma ji tsam pa de tsam brjod par bya'o //
translated: As much as has passed should be stated and as much as remains should be stated.

original: de la so ga'i dus tshigs la ni gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de la so ga'i dus tshigs la ni gso sbyong 'don pa'i dus bzhi yod de /
translated: In the spring season, there are four times for reciting the poṣadha.

original: dpyid zla tha chungs gnam stong dang / dbyar zla ra ba nya dang / dbyar zla ra ba gnam stong dang / dbyar zla 'bring po nya'o ;
analyzed: dpyid zla tha chungs gnam stong dang / dbyar zla ra ba nya dang / dbyar zla ra ba gnam stong dang / dbyar zla 'bring po nya'o ;
