translated: This passage also shows that one should be disenchanted with cyclic existence and should be diligent in virtue.

original: de la 'dir 'khor bas skyo bar bya zhing dge ba la brtson par bya ba'i rgyur ci'i phyir rga ba dang 'chi ba mngon par 'ong ba dang ston pa'i bstan pa 'jig par 'gyur ba smos she na /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'khor bas skyo bar bya zhing dge ba la brtson par bya ba'i rgyur ci'i phyir rga ba dang 'chi ba mngon par 'ong ba dang ston pa'i bstan pa 'jig par 'gyur ba smos she na /
translated: Why does this passage mention that aging and death will come and that the Teacher’s doctrine will perish as the causes for being disenchanted with cyclic existence and for being diligent in virtue?

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yongs su nyams par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i rgyu'i gtso bo yongs su nyams par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It does so in order to teach that the primary cause of pure conduct will be lost.

original: 'di ltar tshangs par spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshangs par spyod pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'grub ste /
translated: Pure conduct is accomplished in two ways:

original: lus dang / gnas kyis so //
analyzed: lus dang / gnas kyis so //
translated: through the body and through the basis.

original: de la lus kyi ni lus sbyor bzod pa dang / rgyun ma chad pas tshangs par spyod pa 'grub ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi ni lus sbyor bzod pa dang / rgyun ma chad pas tshangs par spyod pa 'grub ste /
translated: Pure conduct is accomplished through the body by means of patience and by means of uninterrupted practice.

original: de yongs su @25b nyams par bstan pa'i phyir rga ba dang 'chi ba mngon par 'ong zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yongs su @25b nyams par bstan pa'i phyir rga ba dang 'chi ba mngon par 'ong zhing zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate its complete degeneration, he says, old age and death come.

original: lus sbyor mi bzod pa dang / rgyun chad pas tshangs par mi spyod pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: lus sbyor mi bzod pa dang / rgyun chad pas tshangs par mi spyod pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba go rims bzhin no //
translated: The degeneration of pure conduct is due to the body's inability to endure the practice and to the interruption of the practice.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gzhan dag dang / mya ngan la sogs pa nyes dmigs dag ci'i phyir ma smos par rga shi nyi tshe smos she na /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gzhan dag dang / mya ngan la sogs pa nyes dmigs dag ci'i phyir ma smos par rga shi nyi tshe smos she na /
translated: Why is only aging and death mentioned, and not the other members of existence and the faults of sorrow, etc.?

original: lang tsho dang gson pas tshangs par spyod pa 'grub cing rga ba dang 'chi bas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu'i gtso bo smos pas gzhan yang zhar la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lang tsho dang gson pas tshangs par spyod pa 'grub cing rga ba dang 'chi bas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu'i gtso bo smos pas gzhan yang zhar la rig par bya'o //
translated: Since pure conduct is accomplished by youth and life, and degenerates due to aging and death, the principal cause is mentioned, and the others are understood by implication.

original: gnas kyis ji ltar zhen /
analyzed: gnas kyis ji ltar zhen /
translated: How is it by basis?

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan ba ste /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan ba ste /
translated: The basis is the teaching of the Buddha, which is the basis for the arising of pure conduct.

original: de yongs su nyams par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yongs su nyams par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate its complete degeneration, he says,

original: ston pa'i bstan pa yang 'jig par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa yang 'jig par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of the Master will also perish means

original: ston pa'i bstan pa zhig na tshangs par spyod pa skye ba'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa zhig na tshangs par spyod pa skye ba'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that when the teaching of the Master perishes, there is no basis for the arising of pure conduct.

original: ston pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Master is the Blessed Buddha,

original: phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he teaches without error.

original: de'i bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gsung rab tu gtogs ba yan lag bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gsung rab tu gtogs ba yan lag bcu gnyis te /
translated: The teaching of that is the twelve branches of the scriptures,

original: des slob ma ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des slob ma ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they teach disciples through that.

original: de 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa yongs su nyams pas so //
analyzed: de 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa yongs su nyams pas so //
translated: The perishing of that is the complete degeneration of practice.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bag yod pas rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because it is so, therefore it is said, Therefore, venerable ones, you should practice yoga with heedfulness.

original: bag yod pas zhes smos pa ni rgyu'i dngos pos dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag yod pas zhes smos pa ni rgyu'i dngos pos dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement with heedfulness is because heedfulness is the cause that gathers all virtuous dharmas.

original: rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “One should practice yoga” means “one should strive by oneself.”

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang gzhan yang gang dag de lta bu dang mthun pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams kyang bag yod pas 'thob bo🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang gzhan yang gang dag de lta bu dang mthun pa dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams kyang bag yod pas 'thob bo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “The enlightenment of the tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas, and also those other things that are similar to that—the wholesome states that are the factors of awakening—are attained through heedfulness.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: “Tathāgata” means “one who has realized reality just as it is.”

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bcom pa'am /
translated: “Arhat” means “one who has destroyed the enemies that are the afflictions,”

original: mchod par 'os pa'o //🔽nyan thos @26a * //
analyzed: mchod par 'os pa'o // nyan thos @26a * //
translated: or “one who is worthy of worship.”

original: dang rang sangs rgyas dag la'ang de yod pas de las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dang rang sangs rgyas dag la'ang de yod pas de las khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since that also exists for śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, in order to teach the distinction from them, he says, “perfectly awakened buddhas.”

original: ye shes phyin ci ma log par yang dag par shas bya ma lus par rdzogs par thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes phyin ci ma log par yang dag par shas bya ma lus par rdzogs par thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pa gang la yod pa'o //
translated: It is that which is possessed by the one who has fully understood and realized the unerring, perfect intuition that is complete in every way.

original: de rnams kyi byang chub ces bya ba ni thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byang chub ces bya ba ni thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: The word “enlightenment” in the phrase “of those who are intent upon enlightenment” refers to the realization.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du brtag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du brtag pa'o //
translated: “Moreover” refers to another aspect of the bodhisattvas’ conscientiousness.

original: gang dag ces bya ba ni dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba ni dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “Those who” refers to “the virtuous qualities.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub dang mthun pa'o //
translated: ” “Such as” refers to those that are conducive to enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub skyed par byed pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byang chub skyed par byed pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: “The virtuous qualities that are conducive to enlightenment” are those qualities such as the applications of mindfulness that give rise to the enlightenment that is characterized by the knowledge of termination and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: de dag kyang bag yod pas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag kyang bag yod pas 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that “they are attained through heedfulness.”

original: de ltar skabs de dag gis ni so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod na tshe'i dus 'das pa dang rga shi mngon par 'ong ba dang / ston pa'i bstan pa 'jig par 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs yong pas so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna gtod cing bag yod pas dge ba'i chos la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan
analyzed: de ltar skabs de dag gis ni so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod na tshe'i dus 'das pa dang rga shi mngon par 'ong ba dang / ston pa'i bstan pa 'jig par 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs yong pas so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna gtod cing bag yod pas dge ba'i chos la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgo nas so sor thar pa mnyan pa la rna mi gtod pa'i nyes dmigs bstan
translated: Thus, these passages indicate the faults of not listening to the Sūtra of Individual Liberation, since one will die, aging and death will manifest, and the Teacher's doctrine will be destroyed.

original: to / mi 'du ba dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni ngon nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas dge 'dun gyis thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: to / mi 'du ba dgag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni ngon nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas dge 'dun gyis thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to prevent non-gathering, the Blessed One said, The Saṅgha of the Blessed One's hearers has few duties and few activities, so the Saṅgha should first do whatever needs to be done.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa dang / legs pa drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi bcom pa dang / legs pa drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One means one who has conquered the four māras and possesses the six excellences.

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ji ltar thob pa sgrogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ji ltar thob pa sgrogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The word “hearer” means one who proclaims the fruit of his attainment.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de dag gi tshogs te mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de dag gi tshogs te mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The word “Saṅgha” means a collection of such persons, because it is not divided.

original: don nyung ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
analyzed: don nyung ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyis so //
translated: “Having few concerns” means having few mental activities.

original: bya ba nyung ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: bya ba nyung ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gnyis kyis so //
translated: “Having few duties” means having few activities of body and speech.

original: dge 'dun gyis thog mar bya ba ci yong ces bya ba ni dgag pa ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis thog mar bya ba ci yong ces bya ba ni dgag pa ste /
translated: The phrase “what is the first duty of the Saṅgha?” is a prohibition.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas de'i phyir dge 'dun la gso spyong 'di dus su 'du zhing 'dun pa dang yongs su dag par @26b brjod par bya ba las gzhan pa'i thog mar bya🔽ba ci yod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pas de'i phyir dge 'dun la gso spyong 'di dus su 'du zhing 'dun pa dang yongs su dag par @26b brjod par bya ba las gzhan pa'i thog mar bya ba ci yod de /
translated: Since the Saṅgha of the Blessed One’s hearers has few concerns and few duties, therefore, the Saṅgha has no first duty other than to recite the Prātimokṣa at the proper time, to gather together, and to declare its purity.

original: ci yang med kyis thams cad 'dus shig ces bya ba med par dgag pa'i sgo nas mi 'du ba dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: ci yang med kyis thams cad 'dus shig ces bya ba med par dgag pa'i sgo nas mi 'du ba dgag pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “there is no duty at all” is a negative statement that prohibits the Saṅgha from not gathering together.

original: yang na dge 'dun gyi thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni dri ba ste /
analyzed: yang na dge 'dun gyi thog mar bya ba ci yod ces bya ba ni dri ba ste /
translated: Or else, what is the first business of the Saṅgha?🔽This is a question because the Bhagavān’s śrāvaka Saṅgha has little purpose and little business.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pa de'i phyir dge 'dun la gso sbyong gi dus su 'du ba'i tshe gang byas na mi mthun pa nyid kyis 'du bar mi 'gyur ba'i thog mar bya ba
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun don nyung ba bya ba nyung ba yin pa de'i phyir dge 'dun la gso sbyong gi dus su 'du ba'i tshe gang byas na mi mthun pa nyid kyis 'du bar mi 'gyur ba'i thog mar bya ba
translated: Therefore, when the Saṅgha gathers at the time of the poṣadha purification, what is the first business that should be done so that they will not gather due to disagreement?

original: ci yod ces dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci yod ces dri ba'o //
translated: This is the question.🔽The answer to that is, “Venerables, ask those who are absent about their intention and purity.

original: de'i lan gdab pa'i tshig tu tshe dang ldan pa dag ma lhags pa rnams la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dris shig / dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i lan gdab pa'i tshig tu tshe dang ldan pa dag ma lhags pa rnams la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dris shig / dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Having asked, you should announce it.”

original: ma lhags pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnam pa lnga po /
analyzed: ma lhags pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnam pa lnga po /
translated: Those who are absent refers to the five types of concordant poṣadhas.

original: bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / sdum pa'i gso sbyong dag las gar byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / sdum pa'i gso sbyong dag las gar byed kyang rung ste /
translated: the fourteenth, the fifteenth, the auspicious purification, the purification of harm and the purification of reconciliation.🔽At that time, all the fully ordained monks who are worthy of being included in the saṅgha within the boundaries should gather in the place of purification.

original: de'i dus su mtshams kyi nang na dge slong dge 'dun gyi kha bskang bar 'os pa ji snyed 'khod pa thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du bar bya ba yin pa las de dag gi nang nas mi 'du bar gnang ba nab dang / dbang med pa dang /
analyzed: de'i dus su mtshams kyi nang na dge slong dge 'dun gyi kha bskang bar 'os pa ji snyed 'khod pa thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du bar bya ba yin pa las de dag gi nang nas mi 'du bar gnang ba nab dang / dbang med pa dang /
translated: Those who are permitted not to attend are those who are unable to attend due to illness,

original: srog gi bar chad dang / tshangs par sbyong pa'i bar chad kyis 'jigs pa gang dag gso sbyong gi gnas su ma lhags pa rnams so //
analyzed: srog gi bar chad dang / tshangs par sbyong pa'i bar chad kyis 'jigs pa gang dag gso sbyong gi gnas su ma lhags pa rnams so //
translated: those who are unable to attend due to fear of obstacles to life or obstacles to pure conduct.

original: mi 'du bar gnang ba de dag las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na gso sbyong gi gnas su mi 'du mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi 'du bar gnang ba de dag las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na gso sbyong gi gnas su mi 'du mi rung ste /
translated: Except for those who are permitted not to attend, it is not suitable for others who are within the boundaries not to attend the place of purification.

original: mi 'du na thams cad du rang la nyes byas dang / dge 'dun gyi las mi 'chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'du na thams cad du rang la nyes byas dang / dge 'dun gyi las mi 'chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not agree, he will not confess his offense or the Saṅgha’s action against him anywhere.

original: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dris shig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dris shig ces bya ba la /
translated: “Ask about his consent and his purification.”

original: 'dun pa dri ba ni las mi mthun pa dag mi bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dun pa dri ba ni las mi mthun pa dag mi bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: As for asking about his consent, this is to prevent discord.

original: mi mthun pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Discord is of two kinds:

original: 'dus par rjes su ma zhugs pa nyid dang / phyir zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus par rjes su ma zhugs pa nyid dang / phyir zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: not participating in the assembly and opposing it.

original: de la 'dus par rjes su ma zhugs pa ni dge slong las de'i mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa tshogs kyi kha skong bar 'os pa lus sam 'dun pas dge 'dun 'dus pa'i nang du rjes su ma zhugs pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'o //🔽phyir zlog par byed @27a * //
analyzed: de la 'dus par rjes su ma zhugs pa ni dge slong las de'i mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa tshogs kyi kha skong bar 'os pa lus sam 'dun pas dge 'dun 'dus pa'i nang du rjes su ma zhugs pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'o // phyir zlog par byed @27a * //
translated: Not participating in the assembly is when a monk who is included in the same legal procedure as the monk who is to be sent back to the beginning is worthy of being a quorum-completing monk, but he does not participate in the assembly of the Saṅgha either physically or by proxy.

original: pa ni dge slong las de'i mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa /🔽spyod lam las ma nyams pa /
analyzed: pa ni dge slong las de'i mtshams kyi khongs su gtogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa / spyod lam las ma nyams pa /
translated: Opposing it is when a monk who is included in the same legal procedure as the monk who is to be sent back to the beginning is a monk in good standing,🔽who has not lost the proper conduct,

original: ngag yang dag par bsdams pa /
analyzed: ngag yang dag par bsdams pa /
translated: who has not violated his verbal vows,🔽and

original: 'dul ba'i bya ba mngon par shes pa zhe 'gras pa med pas las gzhan la byed pa chos dang mi ldan pa phyir zlog par byed na mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i bya ba mngon par shes pa zhe 'gras pa med pas las gzhan la byed pa chos dang mi ldan pa phyir zlog par byed na mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The activity of the Vinaya is to be done by one who has the superknowledges and is free from hostility. If one who is not endowed with the Dharma does it, it is not in accord.

original: de bas na mi mthun pas de gnyis bsal ba'i phyir ni ma lhags pa rnams la 'dun pa dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pas de gnyis bsal ba'i phyir ni ma lhags pa rnams la 'dun pa dri bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to remove those two non-conformities, the absence of those who have not come should be announced.

original: yongs su dag pa dri ba ni ma lhags pa gang dag gis 'dun pa phul ba de dag snod du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dri ba ni ma lhags pa gang dag gis 'dun pa phul ba de dag snod du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The announcement of purity is for those who have not come and have offered their consent to become suitable recipients.

original: de la cho ga ni dge skos kyis gso sbyong gi tshe tshul shir brims pas dge slong rnams bgrangs shing ma lhags pa dngos su yod dam glo bur du 'ongs pa la sogs pa yod par 'khrigs na gso sbyong de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad las kyi
analyzed: de la cho ga ni dge skos kyis gso sbyong gi tshe tshul shir brims pas dge slong rnams bgrangs shing ma lhags pa dngos su yod dam glo bur du 'ongs pa la sogs pa yod par 'khrigs na gso sbyong de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad las kyi
translated: In that, the procedure is that when the duties are being distributed at the Poṣadha, the monks are counted. If there are actually those who have not come or those who have come suddenly, and so on, and they are not counted, then the Poṣadha is done by the entire Saṃgha in the presence of those who have come.

original: gnas su tshogs pas dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pa dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum tshig gis bsko bar bya zhing des btsal ba dang / bod pa dang / mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su blta ba la sogs pa dag gis bsam pa thag pa nas mtshams kyi nang btsal te ma lhags pa rnams la deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad na tshe dang ldan pa dag 'dun pa 'bul lam bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su
analyzed: gnas su tshogs pas dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pa dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum tshig gis bsko bar bya zhing des btsal ba dang / bod pa dang / mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su blta ba la sogs pa dag gis bsam pa thag pa nas mtshams kyi nang btsal te ma lhags pa rnams la deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad na tshe dang ldan pa dag 'dun pa 'bul lam bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su
translated: In the place where the saṅgha has gathered, one or two or three monks who are endowed with five qualities should be appointed by the majority of the saṅgha to take up the purification.

original: dag gam zhes yongs su dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dag gam zhes yongs su dri bar bya'o //
translated: They should search for the absent monks, and having searched, they should ask the absent monks, “Today the saṅgha is performing the poṣadha. Venerable ones, will you offer your consent or not? Are you pure with regard to the obstructive dharmas or not?”

original: ma lhags pa rnams kyis de la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma lhags pa rnams kyis de la 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The absent monks should offer their consent and their purity to them.

original: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The procedure for the monks who offer their consent and their purity is as follows.

original: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te rgyan pa la phyag 'tshal nas tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te rgyan pa la phyag 'tshal nas tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: The sick monk, who is offering his consent and purity, should remove his two sandals, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay homage to the preceptor, sit in the kneeling position with palms joined, and say:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please heed me.

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth, the day of the poṣadha of the saṅgha.

original: bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: Today is also the fifteenth, the day of my poṣadha, of the sick monk so-and-so, who is suffering and gravely ill.

original: bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di @27b zhes bgyi ba bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes bdag mchi'o //
analyzed: bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di @27b zhes bgyi ba bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes bdag mchi'o //
translated: I, the sick monk so-and-so, who is suffering and gravely ill, declare my purity from the obstructions to the poṣadha.

original: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
translated: I offer my consent to the saṅgha acting in accordance with the Dharma.

original: bdag gi gso sbyong yang yongs su dag go //
analyzed: bdag gi gso sbyong yang yongs su dag go //
translated: My poṣadha is pure.”

original: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
translated: He should also express his intention and his purity.

original: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan gsum bzlas shing /
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan gsum bzlas shing /
translated: He should also make his announcement.

original: de'i rjes la len pa pos thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la len pa pos thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: After that, the receiver should say, “It is a means.”

original: 'bul bas ni legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bul bas ni legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The offerer should say, “It is good.”

original: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa snga phyir blang zhing snga phyir dbul du yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa snga phyir blang zhing snga phyir dbul du yang rung ste /
translated: It is also suitable to take up the intention and purity in sequence, and to offer them in sequence.

original: sngags kyi bye brag ni 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gang 'bul ba de nyi tshe'i ming smos te lan gsum bzlas par bya'o //🔽dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas gal te de skad brjod mi nus na lus sam /🔽ngag gam lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed na 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa phul ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi bye brag ni 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa gang 'bul ba de nyi tshe'i ming smos te lan gsum bzlas par bya'o // dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas gal te de skad brjod mi nus na lus sam / ngag gam lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed na 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa phul ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: The difference in the mantra is that the name of the one who offers the intention and purity is mentioned three times.🔽If the monk who is offering the intention and purity is not able to say this, he should offer the intention and purity with his body,🔽or with his speech, or with a bodily or verbal expression.

original: lus sam / ngag gam /
analyzed: lus sam / ngag gam /
translated: If he is not able to do that,🔽he should offer the intention and purity with his mind.

original: lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed mi nus na dge 'dun thams cad der dong zhing gso sbyong bya ba'am /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed mi nus na dge 'dun thams cad der dong zhing gso sbyong bya ba'am /
translated: If he is unable to offer his assent and purification through physical or verbal manifest action, then all the members of the saṅgha should go there and perform the poṣadha.

original: yang na dge slong de dge 'dun gyi nang du blangs te gso sbyong bya'o ;
analyzed: yang na dge slong de dge 'dun gyi nang du blangs te gso sbyong bya'o ;
translated: Or else, that bhikṣu should be brought into the midst of the saṅgha and the poṣadha performed.

original: / dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: / dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The rules of customary behavior for a bhikṣu who is accepting assent and purification are as follows.

original: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pas 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa blangs nas brgyug par mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pas 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa blangs nas brgyug par mi bya /
translated: A bhikṣu who is accepting assent and purification should not run,

original: mgyogs par mi bya /
analyzed: mgyogs par mi bya /
translated: should not go quickly,

original: mchong bar mi bya /
analyzed: mchong bar mi bya /
translated: should not jump,

original: phyi rol la mchong bar mi bya /🔽'obs la mchong bar mi bya /
analyzed: phyi rol la mchong bar mi bya / 'obs la mchong bar mi bya /
translated: should not jump outside,🔽should not jump into a pit,

original: bar rim la mchong bar mi bya /
analyzed: bar rim la mchong bar mi bya /
translated: should not jump over a row,

original: steng gi nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: steng gi nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya /
translated: should not sit in the sky above,

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar mi bya /
translated: should not go outside the boundary,

original: gom pa gcig gis skas kyi rim pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis skas kyi rim pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
translated: and should not ascend two steps of a ladder with one foot.

original: gom pa gcig gis them skas kyi them pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis them skas kyi them pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
translated: One should not skip two steps of the staircase with one step.

original: chu lkog ma nub pa tsam la 'bog par mi bya /🔽gnyid log par mi bya /
analyzed: chu lkog ma nub pa tsam la 'bog par mi bya / gnyid log par mi bya /
translated: One should not enter the saṅgha with one’s chin covered with water.🔽One should not enter the saṅgha while asleep.

original: snyoms par 'jug par mi bya bar dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par mi bya bar dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: One should not enter the saṅgha while in meditative equipoise.

original: dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pa @28a * //
analyzed: dris nas kyang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa len pa @28a * //
translated: And having asked, one should declare it.

original: des de blangs te /🔽gso sbyong gi gnas su phyin nas dge slong ngam /
analyzed: des de blangs te / gso sbyong gi gnas su phyin nas dge slong ngam /
translated: Having taken it in that way,🔽having gone to the place of the poṣadha, one should declare it to the bhikṣus

original: dge 'dun la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la brjod par bya'o //
translated: or to the saṅgha.

original: de brjod pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni /
analyzed: de brjod pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni /
translated: The rite and mantra for declaring it is as follows:

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa seng ge'i khri la 'dug pa'i mdun rol du dge 'dun thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas su stan la 'dug pa na gang gi tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis tshe dang ldan pa dag ma lhags pa rnams kyi 'dun pa
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa seng ge'i khri la 'dug pa'i mdun rol du dge 'dun thams cad gso sbyong gi gnas su stan la 'dug pa na gang gi tshe dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis tshe dang ldan pa dag ma lhags pa rnams kyi 'dun pa
translated: In front of the one who is reciting the Prātimokṣa Sūtra sitting on the lion throne, when all the saṅgha are sitting on their seats in the place of the poṣadha, at the time when the saṅgha’s sthavira is saying, “Venerable ones, the intention🔽and purity of those who are not present should be declared,”

original: dang yongs su dag pa brjod cing /
analyzed: dang yongs su dag pa brjod cing /
translated: and

original: brjod pa yang rig par gyis shig ces smras pa'i tshe des dge slong ngam /
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par gyis shig ces smras pa'i tshe des dge slong ngam /
translated: And you should also make the announcement.”

original: yang na dge 'dun la de'i 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa cig car dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dge 'dun la de'i 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa cig car dbul bar bya'o //
translated: At that time, he should offer his intention and his purification to the monk or🔽to the saṅgha.

original: dge slong la dbul na ni des dge slong drung na 'dug pa'i mdun du 'dug ste 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong la dbul na ni des dge slong drung na 'dug pa'i mdun du 'dug ste 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he offers it to a monk, he should sit in the presence of that monk and say this:

original: che dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: che dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the poṣadha of the saṅgha.

original: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: In such-and-such a place, the poṣadha of the sick monk named so-and-so, who is suffering, who is very sick, is also the fifteenth.

original: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba de bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kho na nyid mchi'o //
analyzed: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba de bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kho na nyid mchi'o //
translated: In such-and-such a place, the sick monk named so-and-so, who is suffering, who is very sick, says that he is pure with regard to the factors that are obstacles.”

original: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mang dpal 'dun pa 'bul lo de'i gso sbyong yang yongs su dag go //
analyzed: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mang dpal 'dun pa 'bul lo de'i gso sbyong yang yongs su dag go //
translated: I offer the Saṅgha’s property in accordance with the Dharma. His Poṣadha is also pure.

original: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
translated: I announce the Saṅgha’s property and purity.

original: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: I also declare the announcement.”

original: dge 'dun la 'bul na ni des dge 'dun gyi dbus su rgan pa'i mthar 'greng ste 'dud pa dang bcas pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la 'bul na ni des dge 'dun gyi dbus su rgan pa'i mthar 'greng ste 'dud pa dang bcas pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: If it is to the Saṅgha, he should stand in the midst of the Saṅgha, at the feet of the most senior monk, with his palms together in homage, and say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: deng dag 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
analyzed: deng dag 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth Poṣadha of the Saṅgha.

original: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: In such and such a place, the monk named so-and-so, who is sick, suffering, and gravely ill, also has the fifteenth Poṣadha.

original: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bde bar bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kho na nyid mchi'o //
analyzed: gnas ga ge mo zhig na dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bde bar bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kho na nyid mchi'o //
translated: In such and such a place, the monk so and so, who is sick, suffering, and very ill, says this: ‘I am well, and I am pure with regard to the matters that are obstacles.’

original: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun chos bzhin du mdzad pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
translated: I offer my assent to the Saṅgha’s doing the poṣadha in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de'i gso sbyong yang yongs su @28b dag go //🔽'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: de'i gso sbyong yang yongs su @28b dag go // 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
translated: His poṣadha is also pure.🔽I announce the assent and the purity.

original: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan cig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do zhes lan cig brjod par bya'o //
translated: I announce the announcement.

original: dge 'dun gyis kyang de dang du blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kyang de dang du blang bar bya ste /
translated: The Saṅgha should also accept that.

original: des na 'dun pa phul bas ni dge 'dun gyi las mi mthun par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na 'dun pa phul bas ni dge 'dun gyi las mi mthun par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, by offering his assent, the Saṅgha’s business will not be disrupted.

original: yongs su dag pa phul bas ni gang zag ma lhags pa bdag nyid snod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa phul bas ni gang zag ma lhags pa bdag nyid snod du 'gyur ro //
translated: By offering his purity, the absent individual himself becomes a vessel.

original: len pa de dge 'dun gyi nang du ma phyin par shi'am /
analyzed: len pa de dge 'dun gyi nang du ma phyin par shi'am /
translated: If the one who is receiving it dies before he has entered the Saṅgha,

original: khyim par babs pa la sogs par gyur na ma blangs pa nyid yin pas yang blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim par babs pa la sogs par gyur na ma blangs pa nyid yin pas yang blang bar bya'o //
translated: If one becomes a householder, etc., then one has not taken it up, so one should take it up again.

original: phyin na ma brjod kyang blangs pa nyid yin pas yang blang mi dgos so //
analyzed: phyin na ma brjod kyang blangs pa nyid yin pas yang blang mi dgos so //
translated: If one goes forth, then one has taken it up even without reciting it, so it is not necessary to take it up again.

original: mi 'du ba dgag pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: mi 'du ba dgag pa bshad zin to /
translated: The prohibition against not gathering has been explained.

original: // / mchod cing lung dbog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: // / mchod cing lung dbog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the rite of worship and recitation,🔽he says,🔽With palms together,🔽I will recite the Prātimokṣa

original: sh'akya seng ge de la ni //🔽sen mo bcu yi thal sbyar te //🔽so sor thar pa gdon par byas //
analyzed: sh'akya seng ge de la ni // sen mo bcu yi thal sbyar te // so sor thar pa gdon par byas //
translated: for that Śākya Lion,

original: gdul ba'i don dung las nyon //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gdul ba'i don dung las nyon // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: listening for the sake of taming.

original: sh'akya zhes bya ba ni gdung brgyud de des ni khyim pa'i phyogs kyi rigs rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: sh'akya zhes bya ba ni gdung brgyud de des ni khyim pa'i phyogs kyi rigs rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: Śākya is the family line. By that he shows the purity of the family of the householder side.

original: seng ge zhes bya ba ni yon tan te /
analyzed: seng ge zhes bya ba ni yon tan te /
translated: Lion is a quality.

original: des ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi mkhyen pa rnam par dag pa bstan te /
analyzed: des ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi mkhyen pa rnam par dag pa bstan te /
translated: By that he shows the purity of the knowledge of the ordained side,

original: mi bsnyengs pa dag gis mu stegs can gyi ri dags skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bsnyengs pa dag gis mu stegs can gyi ri dags skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he terrifies the tīrthika deer with his fearlessness.

original: sen mo bcu zhes bya ba ni sor mo bcu mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: sen mo bcu zhes bya ba ni sor mo bcu mtshon par byed do //
translated: The ten fingers are the ten toes.

original: thal sbyar te zhes bya ba ni lag mthil gnyis kyi sor mo bcu thal mo sbyar te'o //
analyzed: thal sbyar te zhes bya ba ni lag mthil gnyis kyi sor mo bcu thal mo sbyar te'o //
translated: With palms joined means with the ten fingers of the two palms joined.

original: de dag gis ni mchod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mchod pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the worship.

original: thal mo sbyar te ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar te ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is done with palms joined?

original: so sor thar pa gdon par byas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa gdon par byas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The recitation of the Prātimokṣa is stated.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po /
translated: The recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra is the recitation of the five parts:

original: gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par gyur pa gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par gyur pa gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the introduction, the recitation of the defeats, the recitation of the residual faults, the recitation of the undetermined offenses, and the recitation of the entire text.

original: gdul ba'i don du nga las nyon //
analyzed: gdul ba'i don du nga las nyon //
translated: Listen to me for the sake of taming.

original: zhes bya ba ni slob ma rnams gdul ba'i don du ste yang dag par sdud par byed pa'am so sor thar pa 'don pa nga las nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni slob ma rnams gdul ba'i don du ste yang dag par sdud par byed pa'am so sor thar pa 'don pa nga las nyon cig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This means for the sake of taming the disciples, the reciter or the one who is reciting the Prātimokṣa should say, “Listen to me.”

original: de dag gis ni lung 'bogs pa bstan to //🔽mchod cing lung 'bogs pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: de dag gis ni lung 'bogs pa bstan to // mchod cing lung 'bogs pa bshad zin to /
translated: These verses explain the recitation of the scriptures.

original: // / yang dag par bsgrub tu gzhug pa'i @29a * //🔽dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: // / yang dag par bsgrub tu gzhug pa'i @29a * // dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The explanation of worship and recitation is finished.

original: thos nas drang srong chen po yis //
analyzed: thos nas drang srong chen po yis //
translated: The verses beginning with the words, “Having heard, the great sage”

original: ji skad gsungs bzhin bsgrub bya zhing //🔽kha na ma tho phra rnams la //🔽brtun zhing byed pa nyid du gyes //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs bzhin bsgrub bya zhing // kha na ma tho phra rnams la // brtun zhing byed pa nyid du gyes // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs te /
translated: explain the topic of the correct practice.

original: thos nas zhes bya pa ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gi lung phog pa thos nas so //
analyzed: thos nas zhes bya pa ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gi lung phog pa thos nas so //
translated: “Having heard” means having received the oral transmission of the five types of recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: drang srong chen po zhes bya ba ni ston pa bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: drang srong chen po zhes bya ba ni ston pa bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The “great sage” is the teacher, the Blessed One,

original: tshul khrims kyi ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has the nature of morality.

original: ji skad gsungs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'jig rten dang mi 'gal bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'jig rten dang mi 'gal bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin du'o //
translated: “As it is taught” means that one should practice in accordance with the teachings, without contradicting the Vinaya or worldly custom.

original: bsgrub bya zhing zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug gi sgo nas nan tan du bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya zhing zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug gi sgo nas nan tan du bya ba'o //
translated: The “field of practice” is the object of practice, which is to be done with effort through the practice of the preparatory, the actual, and the concluding stages.

original: kha na ma tho zhes bya ba ni sdig pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho zhes bya ba ni sdig pa ste /
translated: “Sin” means evil,

original: dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is despised by the holy ones.

original: phra rnams la zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bas pa cha phra mo rnams la'o //
analyzed: phra rnams la zhes bya ba ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bas pa cha phra mo rnams la'o //
translated: “Even the slightest” means even the slightest of the downfalls that are proscribed.

original: brtun zhing byed pa nyid du gyis //
analyzed: brtun zhing byed pa nyid du gyis //
translated: “Be diligent and do it!”

original: zhes bya ba ni bsrung ba la sogs pa dag la 'bad pa lhur blang bar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsrung ba la sogs pa dag la 'bad pa lhur blang bar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: means “Be energetic in guarding and so forth!”

original: phra mo rnams la yang brtun zhing byed pa nyid du bya na rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dad bcas pa chen po rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs par shes par bya'o //🔽rtag tu 'bad pas bda' ba yi //
analyzed: phra mo rnams la yang brtun zhing byed pa nyid du bya na rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dad bcas pa chen po rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes gsungs par shes par bya'o // rtag tu 'bad pas bda' ba yi //
translated: It should be understood that this means that if one is diligent and does even the slightest, what need is there to mention the great natural sins and the proscribed sins?🔽The mind-horse is hard to rein in;

original: sems rta kha blan dka' ba na //
analyzed: sems rta kha blan dka' ba na //
translated: it runs wild with effort.

original: mthun pa'i gzer rnon brgya pa yi //
analyzed: mthun pa'i gzer rnon brgya pa yi //
translated: It is hard to control with a hundred hooks of concentration.

original: srab ni so sor thar 'di yin //
analyzed: srab ni so sor thar 'di yin //
translated: The bridle is this Prātimokṣa.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The verse is to be interpreted as follows:

original: rtag tu 'bad pas bda' ba zhes bya ba ni sems rta dmu rgod dang 'dra ba 'di ni lam bde ba dang 'dra ba'i dge ba'i phyogs la gzhug pa'i dus na rtag tu brungs bzhin du 'then zhing brtson 'grus kyi lcag gis bda' zhing bskyod dgos pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bad pas bda' ba zhes bya ba ni sems rta dmu rgod dang 'dra ba 'di ni lam bde ba dang 'dra ba'i dge ba'i phyogs la gzhug pa'i dus na rtag tu brungs bzhin du 'then zhing brtson 'grus kyi lcag gis bda' zhing bskyod dgos pa'o //
translated: “Always urged on with effort” means that this mind, which is like a wild horse, must be urged on and stirred with the whip of effort, always drawn as if in a plough, when it is being led along the path of virtue, which is like a pleasant road.

original: sems rta zhes bya ba ni sems nyid rta dmu rgod dang 'dra ba'o ;
analyzed: sems rta zhes bya ba ni sems nyid rta dmu rgod dang 'dra ba'o ;
translated: “The mind-horse” means that the mind itself is like a wild horse.

original: / kha bla na dka' ba zhes bya ba ni lam gol pa dang 'dra ba'i mi dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dus na rlung bzhin du 'phyo zhing chu lon gyis 'gug srab kyi phyir kha blan dka' zhing dgug dka' ba'o //
analyzed: / kha bla na dka' ba zhes bya ba ni lam gol pa dang 'dra ba'i mi dge ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i dus na rlung bzhin du 'phyo zhing chu lon gyis 'gug srab kyi phyir kha blan dka' zhing dgug dka' ba'o //
translated: “Difficult to rein in” means that when it is being led along the path of nonvirtue, which is like a false path, it is difficult to rein in and difficult to turn back, like the wind, or like a river without a dam.

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsham zhing rkyen du 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsham zhing rkyen du 'bab pa ste /
translated: “Favorable” means suitable and appropriate.

original: rta dmu rgod rtag @29b tu lcag gi 'bad pas bda' zhing 'gug srab kyi kha lcags kyis blan dka' ba ni gzer bu rnon pa brgya pa'i sras kyis bsrab pa 'tsham zhing rkyen du bab pa la sems dmu rgod rtag tu brtson 'grus kyi 'bad pas bda' zhing
analyzed: rta dmu rgod rtag @29b tu lcag gi 'bad pas bda' zhing 'gug srab kyi kha lcags kyis blan dka' ba ni gzer bu rnon pa brgya pa'i sras kyis bsrab pa 'tsham zhing rkyen du bab pa la sems dmu rgod rtag tu brtson 'grus kyi 'bad pas bda' zhing
translated: A wild horse is always difficult to control with the goad of effort and the bit of ethics, but it is suitable to tame it with a hundred sharp nails.

original: tshul khrims kyi chu lon gyis kha bla na dka' ba la ni bslab pa'i gzhi gzer bu gdung ba rnon po brgya pa'i so sor thar pa bcas pa 'di'i tsham zhing rkyen du bab pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi chu lon gyis kha bla na dka' ba la ni bslab pa'i gzhi gzer bu gdung ba rnon po brgya pa'i so sor thar pa bcas pa 'di'i tsham zhing rkyen du bab pa'o //
translated: The wild mind is always difficult to control with the effort of diligence and the dam of ethics, but it is suitable to tame it with the nails of the hundred sharp stakes of the bases of training, which are the individual liberation vows.

original: gser rnon pa zhes bya ba ni 'gug srab kyi kha lcags gzer bu rnon po mang po dang ldan pa dang 'dra bar so sor thar pa 'di yang bslab pa'i gzhi gdung bar byed pa mang po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gser rnon pa zhes bya ba ni 'gug srab kyi kha lcags gzer bu rnon po mang po dang ldan pa dang 'dra bar so sor thar pa 'di yang bslab pa'i gzhi gdung bar byed pa mang po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Just as a bit has many sharp nails, this individual liberation has many sharp stakes of the bases of training.

original: brgya pa zhes bya ba ni mang po mtshon pa'i tshig yin gyi grangs brgyar nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brgya pa zhes bya ba ni mang po mtshon pa'i tshig yin gyi grangs brgyar nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The term “hundred” is a word indicating many, it is not definite as a number of one hundred.

original: srab ni so sor thar 'di yin //
analyzed: srab ni so sor thar 'di yin //
translated: The bridle is this Prātimokṣa.

original: zhes bya ba ni srab dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srab dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is like a bridle.

original: de dag gis ni de ltar drang srong chen pos ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du bsgrub pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra mo rnams la yang brtun zhing 'bad par bya ba dang / sems kyi rta dmu rgod la so sor thar pa'i 'gug srab kyis bsrab dgos pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni de ltar drang srong chen pos ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du bsgrub pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra mo rnams la yang brtun zhing 'bad par bya ba dang / sems kyi rta dmu rgod la so sor thar pa'i 'gug srab kyis bsrab dgos pa'i sgo nas so sor thar pa yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, they teach the correct practice of the Prātimokṣa by way of the practice of the great sages, by way of the effort and striving in even the slightest misdeed, and by way of the need to bridle the wild horse of the mind with the bridle of the Prātimokṣa.

original: yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub tu gzhug pa bshad zin to /
translated: The correct practice has been explained.

original: // / de'i phan yon bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: // / de'i phan yon bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Now, in order to teach its benefits, it is said:

original: che ba gang dag dag tsam gyis //
analyzed: che ba gang dag dag tsam gyis //
translated: Those who turn back

original: ldog cing mtshams las mi 'da' ba //🔽de dag mi rta bzang po ste //
analyzed: ldog cing mtshams las mi 'da' ba // de dag mi rta bzang po ste //
translated: and do not transgress the boundaries🔽through just the greatness of the Prātimokṣa,

original: nyon mongs g-yul las nges rgyal 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs g-yul las nges rgyal 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: are good horses who will certainly conquer the battle against the afflictions.

original: che ba zhes bya ba ni che ba'i bdag nyid can te bslab pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: che ba zhes bya ba ni che ba'i bdag nyid can te bslab pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The “great” are those who have the nature of greatness, because they desire the training.

original: dag tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni chad pa la sogs pa rnam par bsal bas so //
analyzed: dag tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni chad pa la sogs pa rnam par bsal bas so //
translated: “Just by the mere purity” means by the exclusion of the fault of being incomplete, etc.

original: ldog cing zhes bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: ldog cing zhes bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa las so //
translated: “They turn away” means from what should not be done.

original: mtshams las zhes bya ba ni bslab pa las so //
analyzed: mtshams las zhes bya ba ni bslab pa las so //
translated: “From the boundary” means from the training.

original: mi 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dral ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dral ba'o //
translated: “They do not transgress” means they do not violate.

original: de dag mi rta bzang po ste //
analyzed: de dag mi rta bzang po ste //
translated: They are good horses.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi de dag ni rta cang shes dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi de dag ni rta cang shes dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Those people are like thoroughbred horses.

original: nyon mongs g-yul las zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag dang gzhan la gnon pa nyid kyi g-yul dang 'dra ste de la'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs g-yul las zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag dang gzhan la gnon pa nyid kyi g-yul dang 'dra ste de la'o //
translated: “In the battle with the afflictions” means that the nature of the afflictions is like a battle because they oppress oneself and others.

original: nges rgyal 'gyur zhes bya bas ni nyon mongs pa mthar byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges rgyal 'gyur zhes bya bas ni nyon mongs pa mthar byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “They will certainly be victorious” means that they will put an end to the afflictions and attain the fruit of nirvana.

original: de dag gis ni de ltar so sor thar pa yang @30a * //
analyzed: de dag gis ni de ltar so sor thar pa yang @30a * //
translated: Thus, they are called “those who have gone forth.”

original: dag par bsgrub na nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las nges par rgyal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag par bsgrubs pa de'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: dag par bsgrub na nyon mongs pa'i g-yul las nges par rgyal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag par bsgrubs pa de'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: If one practices correctly, one will definitely be victorious in the battle against the afflictions.

original: de'i phan yon bshad zin to /
analyzed: de'i phan yon bshad zin to /
translated: The benefits of that correct practice have been explained.

original: // / yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ;
analyzed: // / yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ;
translated: Now, in order to explain the faults of incorrect practice,🔽he says:🔽Those who do not have this bridle

original: su la srab 'di med pa dang // nam du'ang 'dod par mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: su la srab 'di med pa dang // nam du'ang 'dod par mi 'gyur ba //
translated: will never have it.

original: de dag nyon mongs g-yul gyis dkrugs //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs g-yul gyis dkrugs //
translated: They are disturbed by the battle of the afflictions,

original: 'jog bral rnam par 'khyam par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jog bral rnam par 'khyam par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and, lacking placement, they wander.

original: su la srab 'di med pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dag la med pa ste /
analyzed: su la srab 'di med pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dag la med pa ste /
translated: Those who do not have this bridle do not have it among the tīrthikas,

original: yang dag par ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have not taken it up correctly.

original: nam du'ang 'dod par mi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: nam du'ang 'dod par mi 'gyur ba //
translated: They will never have it.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dag la ni 'ga' yang 'dod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dag la ni 'ga' yang 'dod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who enjoy sense objects will never have it,

original: tshul khrims la mngon par mi phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la mngon par mi phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not turn to morality.

original: dkrugs zhes bya ba ni pham par byas pa'o //
analyzed: dkrugs zhes bya ba ni pham par byas pa'o //
translated: Agitation means being defeated.

original: 'jog bral zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dul bas lhag pa'i sems kyi zhi ba la 'jog par byed pas 'jog pa ni dul ba nyid de de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'jog bral zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dul bas lhag pa'i sems kyi zhi ba la 'jog par byed pas 'jog pa ni dul ba nyid de de dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from placement means that because of the discipline of superior morality, one places the mind in the peace of superior mind. Placement is discipline, and one is free from that.

original: rnam par 'khyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lan mi nyung bar ngan song la sogs pa'i 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'khyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lan mi nyung bar ngan song la sogs pa'i 'khor bar 'khor bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One wanders means that one wanders in cyclic existence, such as in the lower realms, many times.

original: de dag gi bslab pa med pa dang / mi 'dod pa yang dag par mi sgrub pa dag dul ba nyid dang bral bas zhi ba mi 'thob cing 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag par sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi bslab pa med pa dang / mi 'dod pa yang dag par mi sgrub pa dag dul ba nyid dang bral bas zhi ba mi 'thob cing 'khor bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag par sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: The disadvantage of not accomplishing what is to be done is shown by the fact that they do not attain peace due to being free from discipline and they wander in cyclic existence.

original: yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bshad zin te /
analyzed: yang dag par mi sgrub pa'i nyes dmigs bshad zin te /
translated: The disadvantage of not accomplishing what is to be done has already been explained.

original: de dag ni dus dang por bya ba ste cho ga'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dus dang por bya ba ste cho ga'o //
translated: These are the first time and the thing to be done, the rite.

original: da ni mdo 'don pa'i las bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mdo 'don pa'i las bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the work of reciting the sutra should be explained.

original: de la gsol ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la gsol ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In this regard, with regard to the request,

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyang bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyang bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste /
translated: Today is the fourteenth or fifteenth poṣadha of the saṅgha.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad de /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad de /
translated: If the time is acceptable to the saṅgha and you grant permission, today the saṅgha will perform poṣadha.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon to //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon to //
translated: The Sūtra of Individual Liberation will be recited.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is the announcement.

original: 'di ni mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba bstan te /
translated: This teaches the announcement for reciting the Sūtra of Individual Liberation.

original: gsol ba ma brjod na ma bskos par byed pa nyid yin pas mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa @30b lnga po dag gdon pa'i mdun rol du gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba ma brjod na ma bskos par byed pa nyid yin pas mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa @30b lnga po dag gdon pa'i mdun rol du gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o //
translated: If the announcement is not made, since it would be done without appointment, it would be discordant. Therefore, here only the announcement ritual should be performed prior to reciting the five Sūtras of Individual Liberation.

original: gdon par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gdon par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The announcement for reciting the Sūtra of Individual Liberation should be done like this:

original: mdo gdon pa seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas so sor thar pa'i mdo bstod ra dang / dus dang por bya ba'i tshig dag je bton nas /
analyzed: mdo gdon pa seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas so sor thar pa'i mdo bstod ra dang / dus dang por bya ba'i tshig dag je bton nas /
translated: The reciter of the sutra sits on the lion throne and recites the praise of the Pratimoksa Sutra and the words to be done at the beginning of the ceremony.

original: de'i 'og tu gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las 'di bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las 'di bya'o //
translated: After that, this rite of request alone should be done.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i tshig gis bod pa ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i tshig gis bod pa ste /
translated: The phrase Venerable monks is a polite form of address.

original: btsun ba rnams kyi tshogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btsun ba rnams kyi tshogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means assembly of venerable ones.

original: gsan du gsol zhes bya ba ni gzhan la sems pa dag nyan pa la rna gtod cing gus par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsan du gsol zhes bya ba ni gzhan la sems pa dag nyan pa la rna gtod cing gus par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Please listen means pay attention and listen respectfully to others' thoughts.

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Today is the fourteenth or fifteenth day of the Sangha's purification and renewal.

original: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong bar byed pa gnas ste /
analyzed: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong bar byed pa gnas ste /
translated: Purification and renewal means to cultivate and purify the three trainings.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is of two kinds:

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang / zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang / zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ngo //
translated: the purification and renewal of harmony and the purification and renewal of tranquility.

original: de la mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te /🔽gnas dang tshogs pa dang cho gas mthun par bya'o //
