translated: The purification of the latter is the purification of the former.🔽The purification of the latter

original: lhag pa'i sems la brten te lhag pa'i shes rab skye bas bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la brten te lhag pa'i shes rab skye bas bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since higher wisdom is generated in dependence on higher meditative stabilization, one should understand that the three trainings are restored and purified by the concordant purificatory fast and the purificatory fast of meditative serenity.

original: skabs 'dir ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Here one should take up the concordant purificatory fast.

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The concordant purificatory fast has five types:

original: bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / sdum pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / sdum pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
translated: the fourteenth, the fifteenth, the auspicious purificatory fast, the purificatory fast that arises from harm, and the purificatory fast of reconciliation.

original: de dag thams cad la yang gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa sngar byas te so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gson dgos so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad la yang gsol ba dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa sngar byas te so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gson dgos so //
translated: In all of these, one must recite the Sūtra of Individual Liberation after first performing the announcement and the proposal.

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnam pa lnga po @31a * //
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong rnam pa lnga po @31a * //
translated: From among those five types of concordant purificatory fasts,

original: de dag las 'dir ni bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa'i skabs yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag las 'dir ni bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa'i skabs yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: here the fourteenth and fifteenth are taught as the occasion.

original: bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa'am bco lnga pa ste zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The fourteenth or the fifteenth day.🔽In the six seasons, each consisting of two months, there are twenty-two days of poṣadha, every two months.

original: de la dus tshigs drug la zla ba gnyis gnyis yong ba dag gi nyi shu gnyis gnyis la gso sbyong nyi shu bzhi yod pa de dag tshes grangs kyi yang dag pa la ltos na ni thams cad gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dus tshigs drug la zla ba gnyis gnyis yong ba dag gi nyi shu gnyis gnyis la gso sbyong nyi shu bzhi yod pa de dag tshes grangs kyi yang dag pa la ltos na ni thams cad gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no //
translated: If one considers the true number of days, all poṣaḍhas are on the fifteenth day.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi dus la ltos na ni gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi dus la ltos na ni gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin te /
translated: If one considers the worldly convention, the poṣadha is on the fourteenth day.

original: dus tshigs drug po de dag gi zla ba phyed phyed las pa'i gso sbyong drug po de dag go //
analyzed: dus tshigs drug po de dag gi zla ba phyed phyed las pa'i gso sbyong drug po de dag go //
translated: The six poṣadhas are the half-months of the six seasons.

original: 'di skad ces bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bstan to //
translated: It is taught:🔽The first and last half-months of the three summer months and the three winter months are not suitable for poṣadha. The first and last half-months of the three months of rain are suitable for poṣadha.

original: dbyar zla gsum dang dgun zla gsum gyi ni rab dang tha chungs mar gyi ngos bco lnga mi thub pas ra ba dang tha chungs kye gnam stong bzhi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyar zla gsum dang dgun zla gsum gyi ni rab dang tha chungs mar gyi ngos bco lnga mi thub pas ra ba dang tha chungs kye gnam stong bzhi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The poṣadha is on the fourteenth day.

original: ston zla gsum dang dpyid zla gsum gyi ni 'bring po mar gyi ngos bco lnga mi thub pas 'bring po'i gnam stong gnyis gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: ston zla gsum dang dpyid zla gsum gyi ni 'bring po mar gyi ngos bco lnga mi thub pas 'bring po'i gnam stong gnyis gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The fourteenth is the Poṣadha of the middle month of the three months of autumn and the three months of winter, because the fifteenth is not included.

original: lhag ma bco brgyad ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no //🔽bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / sdum pa'i gso sbyong dag byed na ni de'i tshe deng dge 'dun gyi bkra shis kyi gso sbyong ste zhe'am /🔽deng dge 'dun gyi gdon pa byung ba'i gso sbyong ste zhe'am /
analyzed: lhag ma bco brgyad ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no // bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / sdum pa'i gso sbyong dag byed na ni de'i tshe deng dge 'dun gyi bkra shis kyi gso sbyong ste zhe'am / deng dge 'dun gyi gdon pa byung ba'i gso sbyong ste zhe'am /
translated: The remaining eighteen days are the fifteenth.🔽If one performs the auspicious Poṣadha, the Poṣadha of the arising of harm, and the Poṣadha of reconciliation, then at that time one should specify: Today is the Saṃgha’s auspicious Poṣadha.🔽Today is the Saṃgha’s Poṣadha of the arising of harm.

original: deng dge 'dun gyi sdum pa'i gso sbyong ste zhes dmigs kyis smos par bya ste /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi sdum pa'i gso sbyong ste zhes dmigs kyis smos par bya ste /
translated: Today is the Saṃgha’s Poṣadha of reconciliation.

original: de dag ni gang gi tshe bya dgos pa de'i tshe bya bar zad kyi dus nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: de dag ni gang gi tshe bya dgos pa de'i tshe bya bar zad kyi dus nges pa ni med do //
translated: These are to be performed when necessary, but there is no fixed time.

original: bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa ni dus nges pa yin pas de las snga phyir byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga pa ni dus nges pa yin pas de las snga phyir byar mi rung ngo //
translated: The fourteenth and fifteenth are fixed times, so it is not suitable to perform them earlier or later.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready and approves, it should remain silent.

original: dus la bab cing zhes bya ba ni las bya ba'i dus la bab pa ste /
analyzed: dus la bab cing zhes bya ba ni las bya ba'i dus la bab pa ste /
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready and approves, it should remain silent.

original: 'dir ni gso sbyong gi dus dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni gso sbyong gi dus dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the first announcement.

original: bzod na zhes bya ba ni las de gzhag par mi 'os shing bya bar bzod pa ste /
analyzed: bzod na zhes bya ba ni las de gzhag par mi 'os shing bya bar bzod pa ste /
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready and approves, it should remain silent.

original: 'di yang gso sbyong gi las dang sbyar ro //🔽dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig ces bya ba ni cang ma smra bas so //
analyzed: 'di yang gso sbyong gi las dang sbyar ro // dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig ces bya ba ni cang ma smra bas so //
translated: This is the second announcement.🔽If the Saṅgha is ready and approves, it should remain silent.

original: deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad de zhes bya ba ni las de gzhag par mi 'os pa yin na bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad de zhes bya ba ni las de gzhag par mi 'os pa yin na bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the third announcement.🔽The Saṅgha has approved and remains silent.🔽I will now recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon to zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / @31b pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon to zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / @31b pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang /
translated: The Prātimokṣa Sūtra is recited in five parts: the introduction, the pārājikas, the saṃghāvaśeṣas, the undetermined rules, and the conclusion.

original: ril gyis gdon pa dag go //
analyzed: ril gyis gdon pa dag go //
translated: The entire procedure is called a “motion.”

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes bya ba ni go bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes bya ba ni go bar bya ba ste /
translated: This is the motion.

original: las brgya rtsa gcig ni las gsum gyis bsdus te /
analyzed: las brgya rtsa gcig ni las gsum gyis bsdus te /
translated: The one hundred and one legal procedures are included in three types of procedures:

original: gso ba'i las dang / gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis so //
analyzed: gso ba'i las dang / gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis so //
translated: the procedure consisting of motion alone, the procedure consisting of motion and one announcement, and the procedure consisting of motion and three announcements.

original: de la gsol ba'i las ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la gsol ba'i las ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Among these, the procedure consisting of motion alone is twenty-four.

original: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las ni bzhi bcu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las ni bzhi bcu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The procedure consisting of motion and one announcement is forty-seven.

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las ni sum cu'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las ni sum cu'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: The procedure consisting of motion and three announcements is thirty.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'i las nyi shu rtsa bzhi po de dag gi nang nas gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'i las nyi shu rtsa bzhi po de dag gi nang nas gcig yin no //
translated: This is one of the twenty-four procedures consisting of motion alone.

original: gsol ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: gsol ba bshad zin to /
translated: The motion has been explained.

original: // / da ni gleng gzhi gdon pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni gleng gzhi gdon pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the announcement of the basis will be explained.

original: de la gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In this regard, with regard to the presentation of the basis,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Venerables, we will perform the poṣadha.”

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon pa'i gsol ba byas nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa 'di la 'khor yongs su dag cing snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir ltung ba yod
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon pa'i gsol ba byas nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa 'di la 'khor yongs su dag cing snod du rung bar bya ba'i phyir ltung ba yod
translated: The so-called “setting forth of the introduction” is as follows: Having made the request to recite the Pratimokṣa Sūtra, in order to make the assembly pure and suitable as a vessel for reciting the Pratimokṣa Sūtra, if there is an offense, one should confess it; if there is none, one should remain silent; and if one remains silent, one should be understood to be pure.

original: na mthol du gzhug pa dang / med na cang mi smra bar bya ba dang / cang mi smra na yongs su dag par rig par bya ba'i cho gas gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: na mthol du gzhug pa dang / med na cang mi smra bar bya ba dang / cang mi smra na yongs su dag par rig par bya ba'i cho gas gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the procedure for setting forth the introduction.

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The summarized meaning of this setting forth of the introduction is sixfold:

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa dang / ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs dang / dag pa'i phan yon dang / gdon pa'i mjug bsdu ba dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa dang / ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs dang / dag pa'i phan yon dang / gdon pa'i mjug bsdu ba dang / gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'o //
translated: The transmission of the setting forth of the introduction, the teaching of the method of setting forth the introduction, the disadvantages of impurity, the benefits of purity, the conclusion of the recitation, and the proclamation of the setting forth of the introduction.

original: de la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
translated: Venerable ones, we will perform the poṣadha.

original: so so thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyi khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig /
analyzed: so so thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyi khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig /
translated: If you have any downfalls, confess them.🔽If you have no downfalls, remain silent.

original: ltung ba med na cang mi smra zhig / cang mi smra na bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
analyzed: ltung ba med na cang mi smra zhig / cang mi smra na bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
translated: By this, the announcement of the basis is taught.

original: ji ltar so sor dris nas dge slong gis lan btab pa de bzhin du dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur @32a * //
analyzed: ji ltar so sor dris nas dge slong gis lan btab pa de bzhin du dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur @32a * //
translated: Just as the monk responds to the individual questions, so too in this assembly of monks,🔽this should be proclaimed up to three times.

original: yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan to //
analyzed: yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan to //
translated: By this, the method of establishing the basis is taught.

original: yang dge slong gang dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags pa na ltung pa yod la dran bzhin du mi mthol na de shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags pa na ltung pa yod la dran bzhin du mi mthol na de shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba yin no //
translated: Again, if a monk, when this sort of assembly of monks has been proclaimed up to three times, has an offense and does not reveal it, then he is knowingly lying.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya bas ni ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya bas ni ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs bstan to //
translated: “Venerable Ones, knowingly lying is said by the Lord to be an obstacle.” This teaches the danger of impurity.

original: de bas na dge slong ltung ba byung ba rnam par dag par 'dod pas ltung ba yod la dran zhing mthong ba mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dge slong ltung ba byung ba rnam par dag par 'dod pas ltung ba yod la dran zhing mthong ba mthol bar bya'o //
translated: “Therefore, a monk who has had an offense and who desires purification should reveal the offense that he remembers and sees.

original: mthol nas bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthol nas bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having revealed it, he will dwell in comfort.

original: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dag pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dag pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: If he does not reveal it, he will not.” This teaches the benefit of purification.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gleng gzhi bton zin to zhes bya bas ni gdon pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gleng gzhi bton zin to zhes bya bas ni gdon pa'i mjug bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase Venerable ones, I have recited the nidana of the Sutra on Individual Liberation indicates the conclusion of the recitation.

original: de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan ba dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan ba dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
translated: In this context, the phrase I ask the Venerable Ones, are you pure in this matter? is to be repeated a second and a third time.

original: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa ni bsgrag par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya bas ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa ni bsgrag par bya ba bstan to //
translated: If the Venerable Ones are pure in this matter, they should remain silent. I shall thus understand that the Venerable Ones are pure in this matter. This indicates the proclamation of the establishment of the nidana.

original: de la re zhig gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the limbs of the transmission of the establishment of the nidana should be explained.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba ni gnas dang / tshogs pa dang / cho gas mthun pa'i gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya ba ni gnas dang / tshogs pa dang / cho gas mthun pa'i gso sbyong bya ste zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
translated: The phrase Venerable Ones, we will perform the poṣadha is to be connected with we will perform the poṣadha that is in accordance with the place, assembly, and procedure.

original: / rnam pa gang gis gso sbyang bya zhe na /
analyzed: / rnam pa gang gis gso sbyang bya zhe na /
translated: By what means is purification practiced?

original: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyi zhes bya bar gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyi zhes bya bar gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.”

original: sems drang por bsgrub pa dang / 'gal ba bzlog pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang tshul khrims gso bar byed pa yod pas de ngag bsal ba'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems drang por bsgrub pa dang / 'gal ba bzlog pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang tshul khrims gso bar byed pa yod pas de ngag bsal ba'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since there are other means of purifying morality, such as establishing a straight mind and turning away from contradiction, in order to eliminate those, it is said, “recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.”

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gdon gyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po dag gdon gyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra is to be applied in five ways.

original: so sor thar pa 'don pa ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi las yin no //
analyzed: so sor thar pa 'don pa ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi las yin no //
translated: Reciting the Prātimokṣa is the duty of the saṅgha’s elder.

original: des mi nus pa nyid yin na gnyis pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: des mi nus pa nyid yin na gnyis pa'i las yin no //
translated: If he is unable to do it, it is the duty of the second elder.

original: @32b des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na gsum pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: @32b des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na gsum pa'i las yin no //
translated: If he is also unable to do it, it is the duty of the third elder.

original: des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na thams cad kyi res kyis gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na thams cad kyi res kyis gdon par bya'o //
translated: If he is also unable to do it, it should be recited by all in turn.

original: res bab pa'i tshe des gdon mi nus na gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: res bab pa'i tshe des gdon mi nus na gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If one is unable to recite it at the proper time, one should request another to recite it.

original: de ma btub na de dge 'dun gyis de la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ma btub na de dge 'dun gyis de la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If that is not possible, the Saṅgha should request someone to recite it.

original: 'don ba de dag gi tshig phyed kyang ma 'khrul bar legs par thon pa nyid yin na gdon gyi gzhan du na mi 'chags so //
analyzed: 'don ba de dag gi tshig phyed kyang ma 'khrul bar legs par thon pa nyid yin na gdon gyi gzhan du na mi 'chags so //
translated: If the recitation is not correct, even if it is half a word, it is not a recitation, unless it is a different language.

original: 'don pa'i tshe rdugs na lhag ma gzhan gyis gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: 'don pa'i tshe rdugs na lhag ma gzhan gyis gdon par bya'o //
translated: If the recitation is interrupted, the remainder should be recited by another.

original: dum bu 'dzin pa nyid yin na ji snyed kyis gzhung bsrongs pa de snyed kyis pheg tu bcad de gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: dum bu 'dzin pa nyid yin na ji snyed kyis gzhung bsrongs pa de snyed kyis pheg tu bcad de gdon par bya'o //
translated: If it is a recitation of a portion, it should be recited to the extent that the text is preserved.

original: 'don bar byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges par gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag las /
analyzed: 'don bar byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges par gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag las /
translated: The recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra by the reciter has five aspects: reciting the nidāna, reciting the defeats, reciting the offenses entailing suspension, reciting the undetermined offenses, and reciting the entire text.

original: gleng gzhi gdon pa ni rdzogs pa kho nar mi gdon du mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: gleng gzhi gdon pa ni rdzogs pa kho nar mi gdon du mi rung ngo ;
translated: It is not suitable to not recite the nidāna at all.

original: / gleng gzhi bton nas lhag ma rnams ni thos pa bsgrags pas bsgrub tu rung ngo //🔽de yang gleng gzhi pa ton nas pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa brtsams nas pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
analyzed: / gleng gzhi bton nas lhag ma rnams ni thos pa bsgrags pas bsgrub tu rung ngo // de yang gleng gzhi pa ton nas pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa brtsams nas pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
translated: Having recited the nidāna, the rest is established by reciting what is heard.🔽Moreover, having recited the nidāna, having begun to recite the defeats, the class of defeats must be recited in its entirety.

original: pham par 'gyur ba bton nas dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa brtsams na dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba bton nas dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa brtsams na dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
translated: Having recited the defeats, having begun to recite the offenses entailing suspension, the class of offenses entailing suspension must also be recited in its entirety.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma thon nas ma nges pa gdon pa brtsams na ma nges pa'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma thon nas ma nges pa gdon pa brtsams na ma nges pa'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos te /
translated: Having recited the offenses entailing suspension, having begun to recite the undetermined offenses, the class of undetermined offenses must also be recited in its entirety.

original: pham par 'gyur ba dag dang dge 'dun lhag ma dang ma nges pa yan chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams nas gang brtsams pa'i sde tshan de nyid rdzogs par bya dgos so //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dag dang dge 'dun lhag ma dang ma nges pa yan chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams nas gang brtsams pa'i sde tshan de nyid rdzogs par bya dgos so //
translated: Having begun to recite the defeats, offenses entailing suspension, and undetermined offenses, the class that one has begun must be recited in its entirety.

original: spong ba'i ltung byed man chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams nas lhag ma so sor thar pa'i gzhung thams cad rdzogs par gdon dgos te /
analyzed: spong ba'i ltung byed man chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams nas lhag ma so sor thar pa'i gzhung thams cad rdzogs par gdon dgos te /
translated: The remaining sections of the Pratimoksa are to be recited from the beginning, and the entire text is to be recited.

original: ril gyis gdon pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin no ;
analyzed: ril gyis gdon pa zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin no ;
translated: This is also called the complete recitation.

original: / mgo brtsams pa'i sde tshan rdzogs par bya dgos pa de dag ma rdzogs na mi 'chags so //
analyzed: / mgo brtsams pa'i sde tshan rdzogs par bya dgos pa de dag ma rdzogs na mi 'chags so //
translated: If the sections that are to be recited from the beginning are not completed, the confession is not done.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gron du 'gro ba 'gron po don mthun pa dag sdod du mi btub na 'gro bzhin du gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gron du 'gro ba 'gron po don mthun pa dag sdod du mi btub na 'gro bzhin du gdon par bya ste /
translated: If the travelers who are going on a journey together are not able to stay and recite the Pratimoksa, they should recite it while traveling.

original: 'di ni las mi 'dug pa nyid kyis bya'o zhes @33a * //
analyzed: 'di ni las mi 'dug pa nyid kyis bya'o zhes @33a * //
translated: This is to be done by the one who is not the chief worker.

original: gsungs pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: This is an exception to the rule.

original: sgra mi 'don na mdor bsdus te gdon to //
analyzed: sgra mi 'don na mdor bsdus te gdon to //
translated: If they are unable to recite it, they should recite it in brief.

original: de yang mi 'don na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mi 'don na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If they are unable to do that, they should bless each other.

original: chos ma yin pas 'don na mi 'chags te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas 'don na mi 'chags te /
translated: If they recite it incorrectly, the confession is not done.

original: gdon par bya ba dang de'i tshang dang / dus dang 'don par byed pa rnams de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni 'dir chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gdon par bya ba dang de'i tshang dang / dus dang 'don par byed pa rnams de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni 'dir chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is not to fail to recite the text, the context, the time, and the reciter in the same way.

original: gdon par bya ba de kho na ltar nye bar ma bzung ba ni so sor thar ba'i mdo las gzhan pa phran tshegs la sogs pa 'don pa'o //
analyzed: gdon par bya ba de kho na ltar nye bar ma bzung ba ni so sor thar ba'i mdo las gzhan pa phran tshegs la sogs pa 'don pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is not to recite the Ksudraka-vastuka, etc., in a way that is different from the Pratimokṣa Sūtra.

original: de'i tshad de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gleng gzhi mi 'don cing lhag ma rnams kyang thos pa bsgrags pas sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshad de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gleng gzhi mi 'don cing lhag ma rnams kyang thos pa bsgrags pas sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is not to recite the nidana, and not to practice the remaining [parts] by proclaiming the hearing.

original: de'i dus de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gso sbyong gi dus las gzhan pa'i dus su 'don pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gso sbyong gi dus las gzhan pa'i dus su 'don pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is not to recite at a time other than the time of the poṣadha.

original: 'don par byed pa de kho na bzhin nye bar mi gzung ba ni gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / mtshan ma dang lta ba dang tshul khrims mthun pa dag las gzhan pas 'don pa'o //
analyzed: 'don par byed pa de kho na bzhin nye bar mi gzung ba ni gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / mtshan ma dang lta ba dang tshul khrims mthun pa dag las gzhan pas 'don pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is not to recite with someone other than a person who is fully ordained, and who is similar in terms of the signs, views, and morality.

original: dge slong gcig pu gnas na des gtsug lag khang chag chag gdab par bya /
analyzed: dge slong gcig pu gnas na des gtsug lag khang chag chag gdab par bya /
translated: If a single monk is staying in a monastery, he should sprinkle the temple,

original: phyag dar bya /
analyzed: phyag dar bya /
translated: sweep it,

original: ba lang gi lci ba sar pa'i byug pas byug par bya /
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba sar pa'i byug pas byug par bya /
translated: and smear it with cow dung.

original: seng ge'i khri bsham par bya /
analyzed: seng ge'i khri bsham par bya /
translated: He should set up the lion throne,

original: mar me gzugs par bya /
analyzed: mar me gzugs par bya /
translated: light the lamps,

original: chos nyan du gzhug pa dag bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyan du gzhug pa dag bya'o //
translated: and prepare the seats for the listeners.

original: de'i 'og tu phyogs chas chen por 'dug ste phyogs bzhir blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyogs chas chen por 'dug ste phyogs bzhir blta bar bya'o //
translated: Then he should sit in the middle of the temple and look in the four directions.

original: der dge slong yongs su dag pa lta ba mthun pa dag 'ong na 'di skad ces kye tshe dang ldan pa dag myur bar shog shig / deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no zhes brjod par bya zhing de dag dang lhan cig 'dug ste
analyzed: der dge slong yongs su dag pa lta ba mthun pa dag 'ong na 'di skad ces kye tshe dang ldan pa dag myur bar shog shig / deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no zhes brjod par bya zhing de dag dang lhan cig 'dug ste
translated: If he sees pure monks who share the same view coming, he should say, ‘Come, Venerables, today is the fifteenth, the day of the poṣadha of the saṅgha.’ He should then sit with them

original: gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: and perform the poṣadha.

original: gal te 'grub na de lta na legs ji ste mi 'grub na dge slong des byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'grub na de lta na legs ji ste mi 'grub na dge slong des byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If they arrive, it is good. If not, the monk should perform the consecration.

original: 'di ltar bya ste des rang gi stan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste des rang gi stan la 'dug ste /
translated: He should do it like this. He should sit on his own seat🔽and say:

original: 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should arouse the mind in this way and also express it in words.

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the purification and confession for the Saṅgha.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa yin te /
translated: For me, the monk named so-and-so, it is also the fifteenth day of purification and confession.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kyang bdag smra /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kyang bdag smra /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, declare that I am pure with regard to the factors that are obstacles.

original: bdag yongs su dag par lha rnams kyis gzung du @33b gsol ;
analyzed: bdag yongs su dag par lha rnams kyis gzung du @33b gsol ;
translated: I request the gods to bear witness that I am pure.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir deng gso sbyong byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir deng gso sbyong byin gyis brlab po //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, consecrate this purification and confession for the sake of perfecting the aggregate of morality.

original: gang gi tshe dge 'dun tshogs pa rnyed pa de'i tshe dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gso sbyong rgya cher nyams su myong bar bya zhing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge 'dun tshogs pa rnyed pa de'i tshe dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gso sbyong rgya cher nyams su myong bar bya zhing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon par bya'o //
translated: When I find an occasion to join the Saṅgha, at that time I will experience the purification and confession in detail together with the Saṅgha and recite the Sūtra on Individual Liberation.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: In the same way, repeat a second and a third time.

original: gang na dge slong gnyis 'khod pa der ni rim pa de bzhin bya zhing /
analyzed: gang na dge slong gnyis 'khod pa der ni rim pa de bzhin bya zhing /
translated: In a place where there are two monks, one should act in the same sequence.

original: dus kyi bar du bsdad de ma grub na mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste gcig la gcig 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dus kyi bar du bsdad de ma grub na mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste gcig la gcig 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one does not accomplish it by staying for a period of time, one should sit in front of the other in a squatting position and say this:

original: btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable or long-lived one, please listen.

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the poṣadha of the saṅgha, and for me, the monk named so-and-so, it is also the fifteenth day of the poṣadha.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kyang bdag mchis /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes kyang bdag mchis /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, am pure with regard to the dharmas that are obstacles.

original: bdag yongs su dag par btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pas gzung du gsol /
analyzed: bdag yongs su dag par btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pas gzung du gsol /
translated: Please accept me as pure by the venerable or long-lived one.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bgyi pa'i slad du deng gso sbyong byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su rdzogs par bgyi pa'i slad du deng gso sbyong byin gyis brlab po //
translated: For the sake of completing the aggregate of morality, I, the monk named so-and-so, will now consecrate the poṣadha.”

original: gang gi tshe dge 'dun tshogs ba rnyed pa de'i tshe dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gso sbyong rgya cher nyams su myong bar bgyi zhing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge 'dun tshogs ba rnyed pa de'i tshe dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu gso sbyong rgya cher nyams su myong bar bgyi zhing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon par bgyi'o //
translated: When one finds a gathering of the Saṅgha, at that time one should experience the Poṣadha together with the Saṅgha, and recite the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: In the same way, repeat two or three times.

original: gang na dge slong gsum 'khod pa der ni rim pa bzhin bya zhing dus kyi bar du bsdad de /
analyzed: gang na dge slong gsum 'khod pa der ni rim pa bzhin bya zhing dus kyi bar du bsdad de /
translated: Where there are three bhikṣus present, there one should do it in order, and stay until the time.

original: de ma grub na rgan rims bzhin gral du 'khod de rim gyis byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags snga ma nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ma grub na rgan rims bzhin gral du 'khod de rim gyis byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags snga ma nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: If that is not accomplished, then sitting in order of seniority, one should recite the previous mantra of consecration in order.

original: gang na dge slong bzhi 'khod pa der ni de rnams kyis gsol ba byas te gso sbyong bya zhing der nad pa'i yongs su dag pa ni blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang na dge slong bzhi 'khod pa der ni de rnams kyis gsol ba byas te gso sbyong bya zhing der nad pa'i yongs su dag pa ni blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Where there are four bhikṣus present, there they should request and do the Poṣadha. In that case, the sick person's purity should not be taken.

original: gang na dge slong lnga'am lhag pa 'khod pa der ni de rnams kyis gsol bar byas te gso sbyong bya ste /
analyzed: gang na dge slong lnga'am lhag pa 'khod pa der ni de rnams kyis gsol bar byas te gso sbyong bya ste /
translated: Where there are five or more bhikṣus present, there they should request and do the Poṣadha.

original: der ni nad pa'i yongs su dag pa yang blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: der ni nad pa'i yongs su dag pa yang blang bar bya'o //
translated: In that case, the purification of the sick person should also be accepted.

original: khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig ces bya ba ni bshags par bya ba yod na yang bshags par bya /
analyzed: khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig ces bya ba ni bshags par bya ba yod na yang bshags par bya /
translated: If there is an offense that should be confessed, then confess it.

original: bsdam par bya ba yod na yang bsdam par bya /🔽byin gyis brlab par bya ba yod na yang byin @34a * //
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba yod na yang bsdam par bya / byin gyis brlab par bya ba yod na yang byin @34a * //
translated: If there is an offense that should be restrained, then restrain it.

original: gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If there is an offense that should be blessed, then bless it.

original: 'di la gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the method of establishing the basis for this?🔽Before the assembly gathers in the place of purification, one should examine the downfalls of the fortnight that has passed since the last purification. If there is an offense that should be confessed, then confess it.

original: gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor brtag par bya ste ltung ba shes pa bshags pa'am bsdam pa'am byin gyis brlab pas phyir bcos te las kyi
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor brtag par bya ste ltung ba shes pa bshags pa'am bsdam pa'am byin gyis brlab pas phyir bcos te las kyi
translated: If there is an offense that should be restrained, then restrain it.🔽If there is an offense that should be blessed, then bless it.

original: gnas su 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas su 'dug par bya'o //
translated: Then one should go to the place of the rite.

original: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The mantra and ritual for this is as follows:

original: ltung byed 'ba' zhig gam /
analyzed: ltung byed 'ba' zhig gam /
translated: If it is only a downfall,

original: so sor bshags par bya ba 'am bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas las gang yang rung ba zhig shes na des mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya ba 'am bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas las gang yang rung ba zhig shes na des mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
translated: If one knows any of the downfalls that are to be individually confessed or the faults that are to be confessed, one should remove one's two shoes, pull up one's upper robe onto one's shoulder,🔽and squat in front of a fully ordained monk who is of the same view and has the same sect, who is in the same boundary, and who is of a different name and class of offense than oneself.

analyzed: ji ltar so sor dris nas dge slong gis lan btab pa zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The question, “How does a bhikṣu respond after being asked individually?” is an example that teaches the method for establishing the nidāna.

original: dper na gso sbyong gi tshe dge slong dag gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i sngon rol kho nar gso spyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor rtog par byed cing /
analyzed: dper na gso sbyong gi tshe dge slong dag gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i sngon rol kho nar gso spyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor rtog par byed cing /
translated: For example, at the time of the poṣadha purification ceremony, before the bhikṣus gather in the poṣadha hall, they individually examine their downfalls during the previous half month.

original: ltung ba shes shing mthong na dge slong gcig gi mdun du skabs dbye bar gsol te /🔽ltung ba mthol ba na dag pa sbyin pa'i dge slong des ltung ba mthong ngam zhes dris pa na /
analyzed: ltung ba shes shing mthong na dge slong gcig gi mdun du skabs dbye bar gsol te / ltung ba mthol ba na dag pa sbyin pa'i dge slong des ltung ba mthong ngam zhes dris pa na /
translated: If he recognizes and sees the downfall, he should request permission to confess it in the presence of one monk.🔽When he confesses the downfall, the monk who grants purification should ask, “Do you see this downfall?”🔽The monk who has the downfall should reply, “I see it.”

original: mthong ngo zhes lan gdab pa dang / phyin chad sdom mam zhes dris pa na sngom mo zhes lan gdab pa lan gsum dris nas dge slong gis kyang lan gsum lan gdab pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes lan gdab pa dang / phyin chad sdom mam zhes dris pa na sngom mo zhes lan gdab pa lan gsum dris nas dge slong gis kyang lan gsum lan gdab pa'o //
translated: When the monk who grants purification asks, “Will you restrain yourself from this downfall in the future?” the monk who has the downfall should reply, “I will restrain myself.”🔽This is the method for asking and answering three times.

original: de bzhin du dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i don nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i don nyid yin te /
translated: The phrase “in the same way, this assembly of monks should be informed three times” is the method for presenting the introduction.

original: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i 'khor 'dir yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i 'khor 'dir yang ngo //
translated: The phrase “in the same way, this assembly of monks” refers to the assembly that is reciting the Sūtra of the basket’s entrance.

original: lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'og nas gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'i tshig 'di skad ces de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag ;
analyzed: lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'og nas gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'i tshig 'di skad ces de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag ;
translated: “I ask the venerable ones,

original: ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri'o //
analyzed: ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri'o //
translated: ‘Are you pure in this matter?’🔽I ask a second and a third time,

original: ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
analyzed: ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
translated: ‘Are you pure in this matter?’🔽If you are pure in this matter, remain silent.

original: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba de nyid so sor thar pa'i gzhung las ji @38a * //
analyzed: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba de nyid so sor thar pa'i gzhung las ji @38a * //
translated: I will thus understand that this is acceptable to the venerable ones.’🔽”

original: skad 'byung ba kho na bzhin go rims dang tshig ma 'khrul par lan gcig gdon par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: skad 'byung ba kho na bzhin go rims dang tshig ma 'khrul par lan gcig gdon par bya ba yin te /
translated: This passage should be recited once in the same order and without error in the words as it appears in the text of the Pratimoksha.

original: de la lan gcig bton pa nyid na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa de nyid kyis lan gsum bsgrag par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la lan gcig bton pa nyid na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa de nyid kyis lan gsum bsgrag par byas pa yin no //
translated: The passage that states, “When it is recited once, it is asked,” and “It is asked a second and a third time,” is itself the proclamation of the three recitations.

original: tshig de skabs 'dir gong du spar te bsgrag par bya ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: tshig de skabs 'dir gong du spar te bsgrag par bya ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Nor is it that the words are to be repeated and proclaimed here.

original: sngar gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i tshig ji skad bstan pa de skabs 'dir lan gsum bsgrag par bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i tshig ji skad bstan pa de skabs 'dir lan gsum bsgrag par bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it that the words of the proclamation of the nidāna, as previously presented, are to be proclaimed three times here.

original: de'i 'og tu ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs kyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i gleng gzhi'i dbang gis bcas pa ma yin gyi gang yang rung ba spyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs kyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste / yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'i gleng gzhi'i dbang gis bcas pa ma yin gyi gang yang rung ba spyir bstan pa'o //
translated: After that, the meaning of the branch of the disadvantages of impurity should be explained.🔽The phrase any bhikṣu is a general statement, not limited by the context of the origin story.

original: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang sngar lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags pa na zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa 'don pa'i nang du gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba lan gcig bton pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang sngar lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags pa na zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa 'don pa'i nang du gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba lan gcig bton pa na ste /
translated: The phrase even in this assembly of bhikṣus, when it is proclaimed up to three times refers to the proclamation of the nidāna, as presented, when the words that will be stated below are recited once, within the recitation of the Prātimokṣa.

original: de lan gcig bton pa na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa de nyid lan gsum bsgrags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lan gcig bton pa na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa de nyid lan gsum bsgrags pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase he should be asked once, he should be asked twice, and he should be asked three times means that he should be asked three times.

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'i tshig de lan gsum bzlas par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'i tshig de lan gsum bzlas par ni mi bya'o //
translated: But the words that set forth the origin stories should not be repeated three times.

original: ltung ba yod la zhes bya ba ni sngar chos bzhin du phyir ma bcos pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba yod la zhes bya ba ni sngar chos bzhin du phyir ma bcos pa'o //
translated: If he has a downfall means that he has not previously corrected it in accordance with the teachings.

original: dran bzhin du mi mthol na ni zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin pas mi dran pa la ltung ba med kyi dran bzhin du mi mthol na ltung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: dran bzhin du mi mthol na ni zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin pas mi dran pa la ltung ba med kyi dran bzhin du mi mthol na ltung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: If he does not confess it while remembering it, means that since in this case the perception is the most important factor, there is no downfall if he does not remember it. But if he does remember it and does not confess it, there is a downfall.

original: / yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra bas yid gnyis za ba byin gyis mi rlob na yang ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra bas yid gnyis za ba byin gyis mi rlob na yang ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: Since doubt is similar to perception, if he is not sure, he also incurs this downfall.

original: de shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni brdzun la rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni brdzun la rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: He is knowingly telling a lie means that there are five kinds of lies:

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba dang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba dang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and lies that are an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de la pham par gyur pa'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te mi'i chos bla ma smra ba'o //
analyzed: de la pham par gyur pa'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te mi'i chos bla ma smra ba'o //
translated: A lie that is a root downfall is to lie with the intention to deceive about a sublime, superhuman quality.

original: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te gzhi med pa dang bag tsam gyis skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te gzhi med pa dang bag tsam gyis skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: A lie that is a partial defeat is to lie with the intention to deceive about a serious matter or a trivial matter.

original: @38b nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i tshe dge 'dun 'dus pa la shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su ston pa dang / chos chos ma yin par ston pa sta /
analyzed: @38b nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i tshe dge 'dun 'dus pa la shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su ston pa dang / chos chos ma yin par ston pa sta /
translated: A lie that is a serious violation is to lie with the intention to deceive about a serious matter when one is in the process of creating a schism in the order, or to teach what is not Dharma as Dharma or to teach what is Dharma as not Dharma to an assembly of the order.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs kyi nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs kyi nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: This is a serious violation that is part of the class of downfalls that require confession alone.

original: ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni snga ma gsum dang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun dang bzhi las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni snga ma gsum dang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun dang bzhi las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba ste /
translated: Lying that is a serious offense is lying that is other than the above three and lying that is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Lying is posited by the power of the conception of the object, not by the power of the object.

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni skabs 'di nyid kyis bstan te /
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni skabs 'di nyid kyis bstan te /
translated: Lying that is an offense of wrong conduct is indicated in this context.

original: gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cad mi smra bas 'da' bar byed na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cad mi smra bas 'da' bar byed na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not speak when asked three times, “Are you pure in this?” during the confession ceremony, and one passes the time without speaking, though one knows that one is impure, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: des na nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi yid kyi ni ma yin te kha rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rig byed de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi yid kyi ni ma yin te kha rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rig byed de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is a complete offense of wrong conduct, but it is not mental, because it exists as verbal action such as changing the expression on one’s face.

original: de ltar shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba de ni ma dag pa yin na ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba de ni ma dag pa yin na ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What are the faults of impurity?

original: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽brdzun du smra ba de ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa byas pa dang / sdig pa'i lta ba can dang / sa gzhan na gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya ba gsungs te / brdzun du smra ba de ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa byas pa dang / sdig pa'i lta ba can dang / sa gzhan na gnas pa dang /
translated: Therefore it is said, “Venerables, the Buddha has said that lying while knowing this is an act that obstructs.”

original: tha dad par gnas pa rnams kyis smras na yang mngon bar mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad par gnas pa rnams kyis smras na yang mngon bar mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin la /
translated: Since lying is a natural offense, it obstructs the higher rebirths and definite excellence even if it is spoken by one who is not fully ordained, by one who has degenerated, by one who has committed heinous acts, by one who holds wrong views, by one who abides in other levels,🔽or by one who abides in a separate saṅgha.

original: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pas smras na ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang / ga nyig lhag par spyad pa yin pas lhag par yang mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pas smras na ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang / ga nyig lhag par spyad pa yin pas lhag par yang mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin par gsungs so //
translated: If a fully ordained monk speaks, it is a natural offense and a natural offense with a basis, and since it is also a concealed offense, it is said to be an obstruction to higher rebirth and definite excellence.

original: skabs 'di ni cho ga las 'das na las mi 'chags so zhes gsungs te /🔽las ni gsol ba dang / brjod pa dang / so sor thar pa gdon pa dang / dgag dbye'i @39a * //🔽las dang / las brgya rtsa gcig gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: skabs 'di ni cho ga las 'das na las mi 'chags so zhes gsungs te / las ni gsol ba dang / brjod pa dang / so sor thar pa gdon pa dang / dgag dbye'i @39a * // las dang / las brgya rtsa gcig gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: In this context, if one transgresses the rite, the action is not confessed.🔽The action is included in the one hundred and one actions:🔽the action of proposal, the action of recitation, the action of reciting the Pratimoksha, the action of the lifting of restrictions,

original: cho ga ni dge 'dun tshang ba dang / las brjod ba dang / las byed pa gnyis kyi chos ma yin pas mi bya ba dang / mi mthun pa dag mi bya ba dang / tshogs kyi mi bya ba yin pa 'dir so sor thar pa 'don pa ni gso sbyong gi las yin la /
analyzed: cho ga ni dge 'dun tshang ba dang / las brjod ba dang / las byed pa gnyis kyi chos ma yin pas mi bya ba dang / mi mthun pa dag mi bya ba dang / tshogs kyi mi bya ba yin pa 'dir so sor thar pa 'don pa ni gso sbyong gi las yin la /

original: de chos ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa dag gis las mi bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de chos ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa dag gis las mi bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase it is not Dharma, so do not do it refers to not doing actions such as lying that are associated with error.

original: 'dir ltung ba yod pa ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ltung ba yod pa ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Here, having a downfall is associated with error.

original: de dran bzhin du mi mthol ba shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba yang rang bzhin las nyams pa yin pas de ma bshags sam byin gyis ma brlabs pa dag gis gso sbyong gi las byas na las de mi 'chags pa'i nyes dmigs gzhan yang yod do //
analyzed: de dran bzhin du mi mthol ba shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba yang rang bzhin las nyams pa yin pas de ma bshags sam byin gyis ma brlabs pa dag gis gso sbyong gi las byas na las de mi 'chags pa'i nyes dmigs gzhan yang yod do //
translated: If one knowingly lies while remembering one's downfall, one degenerates from the nature of a monk. If one does the poṣadha rite without confessing that or having it blessed, there is another disadvantage: that action is not purified.

original: de'i 'og tu dag pa'i phan yon gyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dag pa'i phan yon gyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the branch of the benefits of purification should be explained.

original: de bas na dge slong ltung ba byung ba rnam par dag par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba'i nyes byas tsam yang rnam par dag par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: de bas na dge slong ltung ba byung ba rnam par dag par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba'i nyes byas tsam yang rnam par dag par 'dod pas so //
translated: The phrase therefore, a monk who wishes to be pure with respect to downfalls means that one who wishes to be pure with respect to even a mere misdeed of knowingly lying.

original: ltung ba yod pa la dran zhing mthong ba mthol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bshags pa dang bsdam pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa gang bya bar 'os pa de bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba yod pa la dran zhing mthong ba mthol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bshags pa dang bsdam pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa gang bya bar 'os pa de bya'o //
translated: One should confess the existence of downfalls, remembering and seeing them. This means that one should do whatever is appropriate: confession, restraint, and consecration.

original: de ltar mthol ba de ni dag pa yin na dag pa'i phan yon gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar mthol ba de ni dag pa yin na dag pa'i phan yon gang zhe na /
translated: If one confesses in that way, that is purification. What is the benefit of purification?

original: de'i phyir mthol na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthol na bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, One who confesses will dwell in the bliss of contact.

original: mthol na tshul khrims kyi phan yon bcu 'thob cing mngon par mtho ba dang des par legs pa'i bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: mthol na tshul khrims kyi phan yon bcu 'thob cing mngon par mtho ba dang des par legs pa'i bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba'o//
translated: By confessing, one attains the ten benefits of morality and dwells in the bliss of high status and definite goodness.

original: tshul khrims kyi phan yon bcu ni 'gyod pa med pa'i rim gyis mchog tu dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i chos 'thob par 'gyur ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phan yon bcu ni 'gyod pa med pa'i rim gyis mchog tu dga' ba sngon du 'gro ba'i chos 'thob par 'gyur ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa dag go //
translated: The ten benefits of morality are as previously explained, from attaining the Dharma preceded by supreme joy through the absence of regret.

original: mngon par mtho ba ni mtho ris so //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba ni mtho ris so //
translated: High status is the higher realms.

original: nges par legs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nges par legs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Definite goodness is nirvana.

original: skabs 'dir 'phral du cho ga las ma 'das pa'i las 'chags pa'i phan yon gzhan yang yod do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir 'phral du cho ga las ma 'das pa'i las 'chags pa'i phan yon gzhan yang yod do //
translated: Here, there are other benefits of confessing the offense, which are not beyond the rite.🔽If one does not confess, one does not become pure.

original: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni rjes su 'gro ba sngar bstan pa de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan to /
analyzed: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni rjes su 'gro ba sngar bstan pa de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan to /
translated: This shows the reverse pervasion of the forward pervasion taught above.

original: nga'i tshangs par spyod pa skye bo mang po la phan pa yangs par gyur pa lha dang mi'i bar dag la yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nga'i tshangs par spyod pa skye bo mang po la phan pa yangs par gyur pa lha dang mi'i bar dag la yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The statement, “My pure life will be of benefit to many people, will be for the welfare of the world, will be for the happiness of many people, will be for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods, humans, and the general populace, and will be taught for a long time,” refers to the uninterrupted teaching.

original: thob pa rnams bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / ma thob pa ma zhugs pa rnams bde bar 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa rnams bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba dang / ma thob pa ma zhugs pa rnams bde bar 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those who have attained it will abide in happiness and those who have not attained it will enter into it happily.

original: de la nga'i tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi chos 'dul ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la nga'i tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi chos 'dul ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir spyod pa'o //
translated: In this passage, the phrase “my pure life” refers to the Bhagavån’s Dharma and Vinaya, which is practiced for the sake of nirvån a.

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs dang rus rnams la phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs dang rus rnams la phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “of benefit to many people” refers to the benefit of the kṣatriya and other castes.

analyzed: yangs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi rigs de dag nyid gong nas gong du 'phel bar 'gyur ba las brtsams so //
translated: The phrase “will be for the welfare of the world” refers to the increase of those very castes of sentient beings.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi bar la zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la mthu yod pa'i phyir yin gyi bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje nyi tshe bar gyur pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: yang dag par rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang / ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase he taught the Dharma indicates that the Buddha taught the Dharma in its entirety, that is, he taught the Dharma in its entirety with respect to the mode of being of phenomena and with respect to the diversity of phenomena.

original: phan yon bcu po de dag mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
